Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta Group, a global leader in agricultural technology and innovation, employs 60,000 people across more than 100 countries to transform agriculture through tailor-made solutions for farmers, society, and our planet. Our diverse portfolio encompasses seeds, crop protection, nutrition products, agronomic solutions, and digital services, all designed to help farmers produce healthy food, feed, fiber, and fuel while conserving natural resources and protecting the environment. Our mission is to address critical challenges such as climate change and food security through sustainable practices and cutting-edge solutions, while safeguarding the planet's resources.

Syngenta Seeds, a leading developer and producer of Field Crops, Vegetable, and Flower Seeds, is part of Syngenta Group. We bring farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops.

Job Description


Type: Permanent
Business Unit: P&S – Vegetable Seed Enhancement Technology
Location: NL-Enkhuizen 


Responsibilities

The Vegetable Seed Enhancement Team (VSET) is closely connected to the vegetable seeds R&D, production and processing plants and services all Syngenta vegetable sites globally. We have an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated Data Scientist to join us and be a member of a multidisciplinary team embedded with a variety of stakeholders to support the global vegetable seeds business. You will focus on designing and implementing imaging technologies, algorithms, and building artificial intelligence systems to automate measurements and understanding of seeds and plants. Key responsibilities will include:


Translating the imaging and AI systems to commercial scales that could be used across vegetable seed processing plants.
Designing and implementing automated seed processing systems using image-based methods and artificial intelligence.
Applying AI and machine learning techniques to study and analyse seed phenotypes and seedling characteristics.
Processing and interpreting large datasets to identify trends in seed quality and translating the findings to practical solutions to improve seed quality.
Collaborating with interdisciplinary teams to drive innovation in seed science and practical solutions beneficial to the global Syngenta VEG business.


Qualifications


Ph.D. or MSc degree with proven experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence or equivalent qualifications.
Strong knowledge of image analysis, machine learning, and seed physiology; or willingness to learn and establish strong knowledge of seed physiology and business.
Strong project management skills with the ability to lead projects in a corporate environment.
Ability to convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences, while influencing and persuading key stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to make data-driven decisions, while valuing and incorporating expert inputs when needed.
English language proficiency at minimum B2 level (Common European Framework scale) and willingness to learn Dutch.
Enjoys working in a highly diverse corporate environment with focus on innovation and customer centricity.


Additional Information

Take your chance!

At Syngenta, we believe in creating an inclusive and diverse work environment where all employees are valued and given the opportunity to grow. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive package of secondary employment benefits.

Are you excited to strengthen our team? Don't miss this great opportunity! Apply online today at www.syngenta.com. For questions, please contact our recruiter Nienke Terluin at Nienke.terluin@syngenta.com.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Checkout.com is one of the most exciting fintechs in the world. Our mission is to enable businesses and their communities to thrive in the digital economy. We’re the strategic payments partner for some of the best known fast-moving brands globally such as Wise, Hut Group, Sony Electronics, Homebase, Henkel, Klarna and many others. Purpose-built with performance and scalability in mind, our flexible cloud-based payments platform helps global enterprises launch new products and create experiences customers love. And it's not just what we build that makes us different. It's how.

We empower passionate problem-solvers to collaborate, innovate and do their best work. That’s why we’re number 9 on the Forbes Cloud 100 list and on Glassdoor’s list of Top 10 fintechs to work for. And we’re just getting started. We’re building diverse and inclusive teams around the world — because that’s how we create even better experiences for our merchants and our partners. And we need your help. So, join us to build tomorrow, today.

Job Description

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Checkout.com in the ML Platform team, you will contribute to the development of scalable systems that power real-time fraud detection and payment optimization. This is your opportunity to grow alongside top-tier engineers while making a tangible impact on millions of transactions globally.

The solutions that you will be building will power our stack of value added services in the Payments Performance area. We’re a growing team in an expanding area within the company and we’re looking for individuals who have strong ownership, are passionate about productionising ML and have a pragmatic approach to converting big problems into smaller iterations to constantly deliver value.

How You’ll Make An Impact


Build systems for training, deploying and monitoring machine learning models used in our payments platform, at scale
Scale our feature store to more and increasingly complex use-cases both online and offline
Deliver end to end features with full ownership under mentorship of talented engineers


Qualifications


Proficiency in writing clear, production-ready Python code
Familiarity with production ML models (online or offline) and standard MLOps practices
Familiarity with monitoring and observability of production systems, with a strong sense of ownership
Familiarity in Cloud-based application development (we use AWS)
Familiarity with one or more ML frameworks and technologies: scikit-learn, xgboost, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark, Databricks, SageMaker, Vertex AI, Kubeflow, Seldon, Triton
Strong communication skills, able to express ideas clearly and collaborate across teams
Growth mindset, always on the lookout for stretch challenges
Curiosity to tackle open-ended problems and learn from failures


Additional Information

Apply without meeting all requirements statement

If you don't meet all the requirements but think you might still be right for the role, please apply anyway. We're always keen to speak to people who connect with our mission and values.

We believe in equal opportunities

We work as one team. Wherever you come from. However you identify. And whichever payment method you use.

Our clients come from all over the world — and so do we. Hiring hard-working people and giving them a community to thrive in is critical to our success.

When you join our team, we’ll empower you to unlock your potential so you can do your best work. We’d love to hear how you think you could make a difference here with us.

We want to set you up for success and make our process as accessible as possible. So let us know in your application, or tell your recruiter directly, if you need anything to make your experience or working environment more comfortable. We’ll be happy to support you.

Take a peek inside life at Checkout.com via


Our Culture video https://youtu.be/BEwnpHuadSw
Our careers page https://www.checkout.com/careers
Our LinkedIn Life pages bit.ly/3OaoN1U
Our Instagram https://www.instagram.com/checkout_com/

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
WHY CHOOSE ENECO?

Eneco has the ambition to lead the energy transition. We excel in the complete chain from energy producing assets to serving customers. This integrated approach connects all Eneco employees and enables us to fulfil our mission. You can feel it throughout the whole organisation, and it leads to multidisciplinary innovations such as Toon, e-Mobility and our Virtual Power Plant.




You are going to work at a company large enough to effect real change, within a digital department that has the flexibility to rival a start-up. Our organization is open and brimming with energy. At Eneco, anyone with a sharp mind and a positive and active mindset can contribute to a more sustainable world.




Create data driven innovations, services, and products for the whole company.




In Eneco’s digital data science team you will set up data-driven solutions together with other business units. This means you can work on a wide variety of topics on the commercial and the operational side of Eneco, as well as the integration between those two. On the commercial side, this can mean advising customers on sustainable investments based on energy use and building characteristics. On the operational side, improving efficiency of district heating or implementing predictive maintenance for wind turbines can be your next subjects. As an integrated energy company, Eneco is also always looking for innovative solutions to integrate supply and demand. In all these projects, adding value both for the customer and for Eneco is key.




Energy companies have large amounts of data available to work with, and Eneco is a leader in this field, for example from our smart thermostat Toon. The big question is: how will you leverage this data? Distributed energy generation and changes in energy demand have upended the conventional market for energy. Digital innovations help to align supply and demand and help the customer have a care-free experience; data plays a crucial part in all this.




YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

Identify problems that can be solved using data science and turn those into impactful projects.
Test and develop your ideas through hackathons, prototypes, and pilots all the way up to a working product or service.
Interact with business stakeholders, data analysts, machine learning and data engineers to balance commercial requirements with engineering best practices.
Convey the data science way of working within the organization.
Pragmatic and iterative approach to data science: able to quickly show results to convince the business, rather than wanting to apply the most complex algorithms.




WHAT YOU BRING

You can easily adapt to new environments and situations. You have focus, courage and a “can do” attitude. You use these qualities to obtain the goals that you set for yourself in an ever-changing professional environment.




MSc in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) field.
4+ years of experience working as a data scientist within a company.
Knowledge of common data science techniques, NLP techniques and statistical methods.
Strong oral and written presentation skills in English.
An interest in the energy domain and innovations and a curious mindset.
Ability to independently drive data science projects and to inspire and guide more junior data scientists.
Fluent in Python and SQL, experience with Azure, MLFlow, AirFlow and Databricks is a plus.




WE HAVE A LOT TO OFFER

A gross salary between €68,000.00 - €97,000.00 (annual salary including 8% holiday allowance for a full-time contract), depending on knowledge and experience.
A free spendable flex budget of 14% per on top of your monthly salary, for example to buy extra vacation days or have it paid out.
Public transport card, also privately sustainable on the road, with which you also travel for free in your free time throughout the Netherlands.
Parental leave, good pension scheme and career opportunities.
Hybrid working; you will work 40% in the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide where best to work.
Drive data driven decision making to build innovative digital products
Help Eneco and its customers become climate neutral by 2035




INTERESTED?

Do you see yourself working as a Data Scientist at Eneco and do you dare take up the challenge to extend the leading position of Eneco in the energy transition? Then you should apply for this position!

  • Drive data driven decision making to build innovative digital products
  • Help Eneco and its customers become climate neutral by 2035


INTERESTED?

Do you see yourself working as a Data Scientist at Eneco and do you dare take up the challenge to extend the leading position of Eneco in the energy transition? Then you should apply for this position!

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

Artefact is a leading global consulting company dedicated to accelerating the adoption of data and AI to positively impact people and organizations. We specialize in data & AI transformation and data marketing to drive tangible business results across the entire enterprise value chain.




Artefact offers the most comprehensive set of data-driven solutions per industry, built on deep data science and cutting-edge AI technologies, delivering AI projects at scale in all industry sectors. From strategy to operations, we offer an end-to-end approach and solutions: data strategy, data quality and governance, data platforms, AI Factory, data-driven customer experience and marketing ROI. Our 1500+ employees operate in 22 countries (Europe, Asia, Americas, Middle East, Africa) and we partner with 1000+ clients, including some of the world’s top 300 brands such as Samsung, L’Oréal, and Sanofi.




Do you want to be at the forefront of helping clients on their digital and data journeys while positioning Artefact as a leader in innovation? Join our forward-thinking team in a rapidly growing environment with ample career advancement opportunities. If you're passionate about technology and data, this is your chance to make an impact!




What You Will Be Doing:

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will play a key role in supporting clients across different industries in their data-driven transformations. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:




Working on exciting data science projects: You will help develop and implement data science solutions that transform clients’ businesses. These include projects in Causal Inference, GenAI (especially using open-source & open-weight LLMs), Forecasting and Optimisation
Collaborating across teams: Work with our creative, strategy, and activation teams to deliver comprehensive services.
Building client relationships: Use your technical skills to help clients enhance their marketing efforts and data strategies.
International exposure: You’ll have opportunities to work on projects with global teams, gaining valuable experience across different markets such as the US, France, Sweden & the UK.




You will also:

Ensure successful and timely delivery of your data Science & ML projects.
Keep your team updated on progress and share achievements.
Work closely with consultants to understand clients' needs and create impactful data science solutions.
Ensure your solutions provide real value to clients and their goals.
Be a strong team player and contribute to shared objectives.




What We Are Looking For

We’re seeking someone who has:




Educational Background: A completed Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, machine learning, mathematics, or related subjects).
Hands-On Experience: Some experience (e.g., internships or working student roles) in data engineering, analytics, or consulting, preferably in a marketing or digital context is considered a plus.
Technical Skills: Knowledge of computer science fundamentals, data processing, algorithms, and data architecture. Experience with tools like Python and SQL is a plus.
Analytical Mindset: A love for working with data to find actionable insights and solve problems.
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills, comfortable discussing technical and non-technical topics with clients and team members.
Curiosity and Passion: A genuine interest in learning and exploring new technologies and tools in data and AI.




Why You Should Join Us:




Learning and Development: Join a team of passionate Data Scientists and ML Engineers who will support your growth and provide ample learning opportunities.
Culture of Celebration: We pride ourselves on creating a collaborative and fun work environment with regular team events and activities.
Competitive Rewards: Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including a competitive salary, phone & travel reimbursements, remote work allowance, and a Onefit membership discount.
Work-Life Balance: We offer flexibility with a hybrid working environment that lets you balance personal and professional commitments.
Fuel Your Day: Enjoy a healthy and delicious daily lunch from our extensive organic buffet.
Weekly Unwind: Take advantage of our weekly massage sessions to de-stress and relax.
Centrally Located: Our Utrecht office is conveniently situated near the station for easy commuting.
Career Growth Opportunities: We’re committed to your professional development, offering continuous learning and internal promotion opportunities.




Join Us Now and Be Part of the Future:

Artefact is experiencing exciting growth, and this is the perfect time to join our dynamic team and contribute to our success story.

Come join us!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
UNILEVER IS LOOKING FOR A DATA SCIENTIST

Location: Wageningen, The Netherlands or you can be located in Sharnbrook, UK

Full-time

Local conditions apply – need to have the right to work in NL or UK.

Salary: for the Netherlands 44 K – 62 K depending on background and experience

Travel: As per job/site requirements

About Unilever

Do you want to work for a company that makes a difference in the world? At Unilever, we have a clear purpose - to make sustainable living common place. Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of fast-moving consumer goods with strong operations in more than 100 countries and sales in 190. With products that are used over two billion times a day around the world, we work to create a better future every day and help people feel good, look good and get more out of life with brands and services that are good for them and good for others. Dedicated to serving consumers and the communities where we live, work and play, Unilever employs more than 171,000 people worldwide.

Job Purpose

The Global Nutrition and Ice Cream R&D team is heavily investing in data recording technology, which is transforming our product development capability, providing a step change in our ability to capture formulation, processing, packaging, pilot plant and factory data. This provides the opportunity for the Data Scientist to be a part of a major transformation agenda as we seek to fully exploit the benefits of data storage, management, and its analysis.

As Our Data Scientist You Have a Passion For


Dealing with big data, finding signal patterns invisible for your R&D colleagues
Applying data analysis to provide key insights in product portfolio
Evaluating, Characterizing & Analyzing data from Unilever R&D (e.g., product development processes), and combining data sources from other Unilever internal functions and external to generate insights


WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE?


Identify data analytics opportunities in product, packaging and process development;
Generate insights through an agile analytical lifecycle: scope & plan, data preparation & exploration, analysis and data modeling, recommendation, and implementation;
Design data modeling and data visualization applications;
Find business opportunities via data-mining approach and drive change by acting as a global thought leader to share and steer strategic decisions;
Build and develop expertise in R&D on data modeling and visualization;
Develop and utilize a network of internal Unilever contacts working in data analytics to make use of synergies and embed into Unilever’s existing tools;
Working with external partners and leading related projects;


Skills You Should Have


Strong knowledge in data science: model building and validation, database, statistics, machine learning
Excellent programming skills;
Excellent knowledge of most of the items as statistics packages, Python, “R”, R Shiny, and Analytics databases: SQL and ETL frameworks;
Experience in text mining and natural language processing techniques;
Ability to work autonomic as a data scientist in a R&D focused environment;
Team player who can give direction and function in multi-disciplinary teams;
Communication of your work in different “languages” reaching stakeholders, other experts as well as the R&D community and attract them to the projects;
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
Strong networker


Relevant Experience

Essential


MSc in applied mathematics/statistics, computer science, econometrics, chemometrics
1-3 years of working experience
Proven track record as data analyst/scientist
Experience with data model development and optimization
Experience with data visualization and dashboard tools
Experience with descriptive analysis, predictive analysis, prescriptive analysis, and machine


learning

Desirable


Experience deploying analysis and visualizations for production usage
Experience with Azure cloud service, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Analysis Services
Experience working in an international environment


What Does Unilever Offer

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!


Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus, share scheme.
Flexible cross-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities & wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.
Plenty of company-paid holidays to further ensure your work-life balance is maintained.
We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.
Under the Hybrid Working principles, you will be expected to spend a minimum of 40% in the office or at customers, suppliers or partners to connect and collaborate. For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped. When you are at the office , you can enjoy our tasty canteen with prepped food and own products.
Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.
My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription).
Company laptop and mobile phone
Green Mobility Policy.


EXCITED?

Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.

Looking forward to meeting you!

Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against.

By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.

NOTE: Please save a copy of this vacancy for personal use as it will disappear from the website after closing of the role.

NOTE: Deadline for applying is at 23.59 the day before the Job Posting End Date.

HTML:
UNILEVER IS LOOKING FOR A DATA SCIENTIST

Location: Wageningen, The Netherlands or you can be located in Sharnbrook, UK

Full-time

Local conditions apply – need to have the right to work in NL or UK.

Salary: for the Netherlands 44 K – 62 K depending on background and experience

Travel: As per job/site requirements

About Unilever

Do you want to work for a company that makes a difference in the world? At Unilever, we have a clear purpose - to make sustainable living common place. Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of fast-moving consumer goods with strong operations in more than 100 countries and sales in 190. With products that are used over two billion times a day around the world, we work to create a better future every day and help people feel good, look good and get more out of life with brands and services that are good for them and good for others. Dedicated to serving consumers and the communities where we live, work and play, Unilever employs more than 171,000 people worldwide.

Job Purpose

The Global Nutrition and Ice Cream R&D team is heavily investing in data recording technology, which is transforming our product development capability, providing a step change in our ability to capture formulation, processing, packaging, pilot plant and factory data. This provides the opportunity for the Data Scientist to be a part of a major transformation agenda as we seek to fully exploit the benefits of data storage, management, and its analysis.

As Our Data Scientist You Have a Passion For

  • Dealing with big data, finding signal patterns invisible for your R&D colleagues
  • Applying data analysis to provide key insights in product portfolio
  • Evaluating, Characterizing & Analyzing data from Unilever R&D (e.g., product development processes), and combining data sources from other Unilever internal functions and external to generate insights

WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE?

  • Identify data analytics opportunities in product, packaging and process development;
  • Generate insights through an agile analytical lifecycle: scope & plan, data preparation & exploration, analysis and data modeling, recommendation, and implementation;
  • Design data modeling and data visualization applications;
  • Find business opportunities via data-mining approach and drive change by acting as a global thought leader to share and steer strategic decisions;
  • Build and develop expertise in R&D on data modeling and visualization;
  • Develop and utilize a network of internal Unilever contacts working in data analytics to make use of synergies and embed into Unilever’s existing tools;
  • Working with external partners and leading related projects;

Skills You Should Have

  • Strong knowledge in data science: model building and validation, database, statistics, machine learning
  • Excellent programming skills;
  • Excellent knowledge of most of the items as statistics packages, Python, “R”, R Shiny, and Analytics databases: SQL and ETL frameworks;
  • Experience in text mining and natural language processing techniques;
  • Ability to work autonomic as a data scientist in a R&D focused environment;
  • Team player who can give direction and function in multi-disciplinary teams;
  • Communication of your work in different “languages” reaching stakeholders, other experts as well as the R&D community and attract them to the projects;
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken)
  • Strong networker

Relevant Experience

Essential

  • MSc in applied mathematics/statistics, computer science, econometrics, chemometrics
  • 1-3 years of working experience
  • Proven track record as data analyst/scientist
  • Experience with data model development and optimization
  • Experience with data visualization and dashboard tools
  • Experience with descriptive analysis, predictive analysis, prescriptive analysis, and machine

learning

Desirable

  • Experience deploying analysis and visualizations for production usage
  • Experience with Azure cloud service, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Analysis Services
  • Experience working in an international environment

What Does Unilever Offer

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!

  • Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus, share scheme.
  • Flexible cross-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities & wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.
  • Plenty of company-paid holidays to further ensure your work-life balance is maintained.
  • We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.
  • Under the Hybrid Working principles, you will be expected to spend a minimum of 40% in the office or at customers, suppliers or partners to connect and collaborate. For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped. When you are at the office , you can enjoy our tasty canteen with prepped food and own products.
  • Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.
  • My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription).
  • Company laptop and mobile phone
  • Green Mobility Policy.

EXCITED?

Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.

Looking forward to meeting you!

Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against.

By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Apollo Agriculture:

Apollo Agriculture is a leading agri-fintech platform empowering small-scale farmers across Africa to increase their profits and farm more sustainably. Apollo uses artificial intelligence and automated operations to unlock the massive, untapped small-scale farming market. Apollo enables farmers to access the optimized financing, high-quality farm products, expert digital advice, and risk management solutions they need to invest and scale their businesses. Apollo grew paying customers over 2.5x in 2023 to over 200K small-scale farmers in Kenya and Zambia, increasing revenue to nearly $30M with robust unit economics. Apollo partners with key global agriculture companies like Bayer, OCP and Yara, and is backed by Anthemis, Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, Flourish Ventures, Leaps by Bayer, and Softbank Vision Fund. Apollo’s team brings together technology, credit and operations experience from The Climate Corporation, Google, Capital One, Revolut, and One Acre Fund.

About the Role:

Apollo is seeking an exceptional Machine Learning Engineer to join our Tech team and help us develop predictive Machine Learning models that power our credit decisioning, fraud prevention and farming advisory capabilities.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to combine different data sources like survey data, satellite imagery, weather forecasts and more to improve the capabilities and accuracy of our machine learning models to enhance our different business processes and improve the experience of our customers through different parts of their journey. You will work across different parts of our business and in collaboration with our Product & Engineering and Credit teams to achieve these goals.

This is a hands-on role which requires deep knowledge of developing models in Python, deploying and operating them in production.

Reporting Lines: This role reports to the Engineering Manager.

Responsibilities:


Build Machine Learning models to improve key areas of our product and customer lifecycle
Design, develop and deploy systems at scale to handle our growing demand
Maintain and evolve our cloud-based ML Platform, which we use for feature engineering, model development and model training in production
Propose and evaluate potential usage of ML model across Apollo
Mentor other engineers and peers across the organization on how to apply machine learning to improve our product
Collaborate with our engineering, product and credit teams to evolve our credit & fraud decision and advisory capabilities



You:


Are excited about the mission of transforming the livelihoods of smallholder farmers
Are a creative problem solver and excited to solve problems where technology doesn’t work as usual. Imagine challenges like poor or non-existent cell phone coverage, limited quality mobile phone hardware and limited demographic and weather datasets, and so on
Have experience as a ML Engineer, Data Scientist or similar role, developing and maintaining ML Platforms and Model Pipelines. This includes understanding best practices on how to establish a model baseline, address concept drift, and how to develop, deploy, and continuously monitor/improve a productionized machine learning application. This typically means you have 3+ years of experience in such a role
Have experience writing software at scale in any programming language such as Python, Java, Golang or Scala. This typically means you have 5+ years of professional software development experience at a fast growing technology company
Have Knowledge of cloud computing fundamentals, including 1+ years working on AWS cloud-based infrastructure and experience with technologies such as ECS and Sagemaker to to build, train, and deploy ML models at scale
Are an exceptional writer and communicator. You can turn technical challenges and solutions into digestible technical documents and proposals to seek alignment and enable efficient technical decision making
Are a tireless problem solver who can roll up your sleeves to tackle whatever challenges need urgent attention, no matter when they arise. You have a “whatever it takes” attitude and are comfortable managing peers across different teams to get the job done



We:


Are a collaborative team of smart and ambitious people who are dedicated to serving our customers.
Make magic happen to solve hard problems and always come with solutions when challenges arise.
Are comfortable taking risks that can result in radical scale, and understand that failures are opportunities to learn and improve.
Are considerate listeners and take the time to deeply understand and seek out ideas from the people around us, even when we disagree.
Offer a dynamic environment that fosters talent, collaboration and growth.
Take pride in our work and share the responsibility to see it through from conception to deployment.
Back up our talk with a competitive compensation and benefits package and challenging projects.
Value autonomy, honesty, transparency, and respect.
Are excited to hear from you!



At Apollo Agriculture, we are building an inclusive and supportive work environment where every individual has the opportunity to thrive. We encourage female candidates to apply to this position

Title: R&D Development Specialist
Description:
Company Description

Who are we?


World's #1 coffee and tea company
Local roots since 1753, headquartered in the Netherlands
Operating in 100+ countries with 50+ brands (L’OR, Peet’s, Jacobs, Senseo, and more!)


What’s it like to work here?


Hybrid work model: a mix of office and remote time
Office time to connect with colleagues and unleash the possibilities of coffee and tea together
Remote time for focused work
Career growth: We support skill-building and development
Competitive salary + additional benefits (learning budget, career development, insurance, pension plans)
25 + 12 paid vacation days – because we care about work-life balance!


#unleashyourpossibility #acupofamazing

Job Description

Ready to make an impact?

We're looking for a Development Specialist to join our Global R&D, Technology Solutions team. A diverse squad that’s all about learning, growing, and developing—together. 🚀

In this role, you’ll lead tech projects from research to implementation, working closely with NPD, Engineering, and Operations teams. We need someone who’s not just skilled but also a strong communicator and driven to succeed. Your work will directly impact our value chain.

Here’s What You’ll Be Responsible For


Lead small to mid-sized technology and/or ingredient development projects or lead workstreams within a larger technology project .
Responsible for project/workstream planning, budget and resources.
Collaborate with engineering, packing and category colleagues to ensure on time in full project delivery
R&D lead of standard process installation projects
Responsible for writing technology factbooks and Commissioning, Qualification, Verification preparation & completion
Build and apply relevant technological knowledge and best practices to support execution of projects as well as trouble shooting of manufacturing challenges.
Tasks can include: defining and leading pilot or plant trials, reporting & presenting findings within JDE stakeholders and project teams, providing technical consultancy or support in personal expertise areas

What do we offer: 💥


An opportunity to take your ideas from concept to full-scale implementation 🚀
Work with cutting-edge process & ingredient tech that’s transforming the coffee & tea world ☕🌍
Boost your leadership skills and be part of strategic discussions 📈
Direct connections with top-level stakeholders across the business 💼
Lead & collaborate in a global, multidisciplinary team 🌎
Build your network inside & outside JDE Peet's through meaningful collaborations 🤝


Qualifications

Looking for an R&D Development Specialist with a passion for excellence! 🌟

We need someone who takes ownership, embraces responsibility, and isn’t afraid to lead the way. Ideally, you’ve got 2-5 years of experience and a solid sense of your own value. Experience in process engineering, operations, or project management in food or FMCG industries? 🍔📦 Big plus!

We’re all about diverse teams 🌍 and want someone who values that too. While we could give you a checklist of “must-haves,” we prefer to look at the bigger picture. We’ll definitely consider your experience with R&D technology development projects and stakeholder management, but we’re most excited about what you bring to the table overall. 💡

Here’s a quick look at our “nice-to-haves”: 👇


Leading R&D Technology projects.
Experience in executing laboratory, Pilot Plant or Industrial scale trials with a high level of autonomy.
Working with design of experiences (DoE) and/or statistical tools
Experienced use of MS Tools.
Ability to travel internationally as required by project needs.
Academic level of degree (Chemical Engineering/Process Engineering or similar).
2-5 years post studies relevant work experience.


Additional Information

Ready to apply?


Interested? Apply now!
Quick feedback after application
Recruitment process includes an online assessment and interviews
Pre-employment check may be part of the process.


More About US

We are people united by the power and possibility of tea and coffee. At JDE Peet’s, we thrive on the freedom to pursue opportunities, provoking new ideas to make an impact at scale. Our ambition is simple – JDE Peet's: unleashing the possibilities of coffee and tea.

We bring action to our intentions, following through on what was agreed, always pushing things forward. We offer our people a range of learning and development programmes to support their personal growth. We’ve worked hard to build an open, collaborative environment where you can approach anyone and be heard.

At JDE Peet's, we believe it’s amazing what can happen over a cup of coffee or tea. We also believe that a diverse and inclusive culture enables us to serve every coffee and tea lover in the best possible way. No matter who you are, where you come from, how you live your life, or how you enjoy your coffee or tea, you can fulfil your ambitions and contribute to our success.

When you grow, we grow, and coffee & tea grows.

UNLEASH YOUR POSSIBILITY!

Find out more at https://careers.jacobsdouweegberts.com/

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Skills and Qualifications:

1. Educational Background:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field. PhD is a plus.




2. Technical Skills:

a. Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.

b. Solid knowledge of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques.

c. Hands-on experience with data manipulation and analysis using libraries like Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc.

d. Familiarity with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or similar.

e. Experience with databases (SQL, NoSQL) and data extraction techniques.

f. Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plus.




3. Experience:

a. Proven experience (2-5 years) in a data scientist role or similar.

b. Experience in implementing machine learning models in a production environment is preferred.

c. Experience with deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch.

d. Knowledge of NLP (Natural Language Processing) and computer vision techniques.

e. Experience working with large-scale datasets in a cloud computing environment.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Freeday, we aim to unlock human potential by leveraging disruptive technologies and building an AI-powered digital workforce that excels in repetitive tasks. By automating these tasks, we allow people to focus on more creative, rewarding work. We are a young, fast-growing IT company with a dynamic, no-nonsense culture. Located in the heart of Rotterdam, our team is driven by innovation, collaboration, and a passion for AI's potential to change the world.

Freeday is looking for a motivated Machine Learning Engineer to join our fast-growing AI team. This is an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level by working on innovative machine-learning solutions that power our automated services. You will be involved in the development, deployment, and optimization of machine learning models, all within a supportive environment that encourages growth and learning.




As a Machine Learning Engineer at Freeday, you'll be surrounded by forward-thinking, innovative minds and cutting-edge AI technologies. Whether you’ve had 1 or 3 years of experience, we want someone who’s eager to learn, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and contribute to the projects that will shape the future of automation.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to drive our automated services.
Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to define project objectives and align machine learning efforts with business goals.
Optimize machine learning algorithms for scalability and performance.
Contribute to the deployment of machine learning models in production environments using MLOps practices.
Continuously learn and adapt to new machine learning techniques and tools.
Take ownership of your projects while working in close collaboration with more senior team members for guidance and support.




What We Offer:

A dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative work environment.
A competitive salary and pension plan.
Opportunities for professional development, including learning new machine learning techniques and tools.
A fun, inclusive, and collaborative team culture with regular social events, sports activities, and team-building opportunities.
The chance to work on impactful projects that automate workflows and unlock human potential.
A company laptop to support your work effectively.
Room for growth, initiative, and the chance to make a real difference within the team




Our Culture:




At Freeday, we’re not just about the work—we’re about you. We embrace a collaborative and innovative culture where ideas flow freely, and everyone is encouraged to take ownership. Whether you’re developing machine learning models or learning new skills, you’ll be part of a supportive environment where growth and personal development are key.




Requirements:

1-3 years of experience in machine learning or a related role, preferably in the tech sector.
Strong programming skills in Python and a good understanding of popular ML frameworks (such as TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Basic familiarity with cloud technologies like AWS or Google Cloud.
Some experience or familiarity with MLOps tools like MLflow or Kubeflow is a plus.
You enjoy tackling challenges, are not afraid to take initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about automation, AI, and the potential of technology to solve real-world problems.
Great communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.




***

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

HTML:
At Freeday, we aim to unlock human potential by leveraging disruptive technologies and building an AI-powered digital workforce that excels in repetitive tasks. By automating these tasks, we allow people to focus on more creative, rewarding work. We are a young, fast-growing IT company with a dynamic, no-nonsense culture. Located in the heart of Rotterdam, our team is driven by innovation, collaboration, and a passion for AI's potential to change the world.

Freeday is looking for a motivated Machine Learning Engineer to join our fast-growing AI team. This is an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level by working on innovative machine-learning solutions that power our automated services. You will be involved in the development, deployment, and optimization of machine learning models, all within a supportive environment that encourages growth and learning.


As a Machine Learning Engineer at Freeday, you'll be surrounded by forward-thinking, innovative minds and cutting-edge AI technologies. Whether you’ve had 1 or 3 years of experience, we want someone who’s eager to learn, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and contribute to the projects that will shape the future of automation.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to drive our automated services.
  • Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to define project objectives and align machine learning efforts with business goals.
  • Optimize machine learning algorithms for scalability and performance.
  • Contribute to the deployment of machine learning models in production environments using MLOps practices.
  • Continuously learn and adapt to new machine learning techniques and tools.
  • Take ownership of your projects while working in close collaboration with more senior team members for guidance and support.


What We Offer:

  • A dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative work environment.
  • A competitive salary and pension plan.
  • Opportunities for professional development, including learning new machine learning techniques and tools.
  • A fun, inclusive, and collaborative team culture with regular social events, sports activities, and team-building opportunities.
  • The chance to work on impactful projects that automate workflows and unlock human potential.
  • A company laptop to support your work effectively.
  • Room for growth, initiative, and the chance to make a real difference within the team


Our Culture:


At Freeday, we’re not just about the work—we’re about you. We embrace a collaborative and innovative culture where ideas flow freely, and everyone is encouraged to take ownership. Whether you’re developing machine learning models or learning new skills, you’ll be part of a supportive environment where growth and personal development are key.


Requirements:

  • 1-3 years of experience in machine learning or a related role, preferably in the tech sector.
  • Strong programming skills in Python and a good understanding of popular ML frameworks (such as TensorFlow, PyTorch).
  • Basic familiarity with cloud technologies like AWS or Google Cloud.
  • Some experience or familiarity with MLOps tools like MLflow or Kubeflow is a plus.
  • You enjoy tackling challenges, are not afraid to take initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
  • Passionate about automation, AI, and the potential of technology to solve real-world problems.
  • Great communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.


***

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
My client is a pioneering medical device and AI company who are seeking an expert machine learning engineer with expertise in medical imaging and diagnosis to join their dynamic team. They will assist with pushing the company forward with cutting edge research and development.




Job Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning models for medical imaging applications, including classification, segmentation, and anomaly detection.
Preprocess and analyse large-scale medical imaging datasets (e.g., MRI, CT, X-ray, ultrasound) to optimize data quality and model performance.
Create deep learning architectures such as CNNs, GANs and Transformers, specifically for medical image analysis.
Deploy and optimize machine learning models for applications, ensuring efficiency and scalability.
Apply the best practices to improve existing solutions and keep up to date with the latest research in AI, machine learning and medical imaging.
Keep track of model development, system integration processes and experimental results.




Requirements:

Master’s degree and/or Phd in related field – i.e: Biomedical Engineering, Electrical engineering, computer science.
3+ years of experience in Machine learning and/or deep learning, specifically focussing on medical imaging.
Experience in medical imaging formats ( DICOM, NIfTI) and related processing tools ( ITK, Simple ITK, OpenCV).
Familiarity with Python Libraries ( Pandas, NymPy, SciPy Etc).
Proficiency with cloud computing platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and MLOPS practices.
Excellent collaborative mindset, communicational skills as well as problem solving skills.




Desirable Qualifications:

Hands-on experience with explainable AI (XAI) methods for medical applications.
Experience with regulatory considerations in medical AI ( FDA, CE Marking)
Prior knowledge and exposure to federated learning and privacy-preserving AI techniques.







Following your application Sophie Batt, a specialist AI Medical Device Recruiter will discuss the opportunity with you in detail.

She will be more than happy to answer any questions relating to the industry and the potential for your career growth. The conversation can also progress further to discussing other opportunities, which are also available right now or will be imminently becoming available

This position has been highly popular, and it is likely that it will close prematurely. We recommend applying as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.

sbatt@barringtonjames.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist Contract - 80-85 euros per hour– Retail




Hybrid/Amsterdam X2 days onsite




We are looking for a Data Scientist to design models and optimize how small-format stores integrate with an existing logistics and distribution network. You'll focus on solving real-world challenges such as demand forecasting, delivery planning, and store replenishment — supporting smooth expansion while improving overall efficiency.




What you’ll do:

Work with operations and logistics teams to understand goals and constraints.
Build mathematical models to solve real-world supply chain and fulfilment problems.
Develop optimization solutions using Python
Balance coding, modeling, and communication




What we’d like you to have:

Experience building mathematical models for optimization.
Good programming skills in Python (bonus if you know C++).
Comfortable working with technical and non-technical teams.




This is an exciting greenfield project and an opportunity to develop a solution from ground zero. We are looking to onboard someone the 1st of May.







Please apply to be considered.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Data Scientist – Rotterdam, Netherlands

Contract Length: 4 months (with potential extension)

Hours: 32 hours/week (2 days-onsite)

Start Date: ASAP

Contract Type: Freelance (ZZP/KVK)




Role Overview:

We are looking for a freelance Data Scientist to join our team in Rotterdam. You will analyse data, develop models, and generate insights to help drive business decisions. The ideal candidate has a strong analytical mindset and can translate complex data into actionable results




Key Responsibilities

Develop and refine predictive models to support business objectives.
Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Build and optimise machine learning models using PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data solutions.
Create clear and meaningful visualisations to communicate findings effectively.
Ensure models and insights are accurate, reliable, and actionable




Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data science or a related field.
Strong skills in Python and SQL (experience with R is a plus).
Hands-on experience with PyTorch or TensorFlow for machine learning and deep learning models.
Solid understanding of statistical techniques and machine learning concepts.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or PowerBI.
Ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner.




Preferred

Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Understanding of basic MLOps principles and model deployment.

Title: AI Specialist
Description:
Als Generatieve AI-specialist maak je onze chatbots slimmer en persoonlijker, zodat ze klanten vriendelijker en efficiënter helpen. Je verbetert de klantervaring door chatbots nog beter te laten reageren op vragen en sneller met de juiste oplossingen te komen. Met jouw analytisch denkvermogen en pragmatische aanpak maak je onze chatbots elke dag een beetje beter.

Wat doe je als AI Specialist bij Coolblue?

Als Generatieve AI Specialist werk je aan chatbots voor klanten om een conversationele klantreis te creëren. Je schrijft de prompt, test het prototype en evalueert op grote schaal de uitkomsten. Bij Coolblue bouwen we onze applicaties direct op de modellen van OpenAI, Google en Anthropic. Met diepe kennis van deze nieuwe technologie kunnen we innovatieve geïntegreerde oplossingen bouwen in onze huidige processen.

Als toekomstig prompt engineer schrijf jij je motivatiebrief natuurlijk met AI. Upload daarom geen motivatiebrief, maar juist het prompt waarmee je deze brief zou genereren.

Dit vind je leuk om te doen


Nieuwe kennis opdoen over Generatieve AI door trainingen en ontwikkelingen te volgen.
Best practices opzetten voor het gebruik van Generatieve AI binnen Coolblue.
Intensief samenwerken met diverse domeinen om AI-toepassingen in hun vakgebied te ontdekken.
Waarde aantonen door prototypes te maken in Langchain.
Systematisch uitkomsten evalueren door prompts niet 1 keer, maar 1000 keer automatisch te testen.
Je kennis delen via demo’s, trainingen en als sparringpartner binnen Coolblue.


Hier herken jij jezelf in


Een afgeronde hbo- of wo- opleiding.
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met het schrijven van Python code.
Onstilbare honger naar nieuws over Generative AI, ervaring in Langchain is een pré.
Weet ChatGPT om de tuin te leiden met je prompts. Nieuwe (technische) kennis maak jij je snel eigen.
Analytisch en Pragmatisch en niet vies van een hacky oplossing.
Communicatief ijzersterk in het Nederlands én in het Engels


Dit zoek jij verder in een baan


Geld.
Meer dan 30 trainingen in onze eigen Studiefabriek.
Korting op alle spullen die we verkopen.
25 vakantiedagen. Als je belooft dat je terugkomt.
Reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling.
Een kantoor waar je foto's van wilt maken op een toplocatie. Vanaf Rotterdam Centraal is het 3 keer vallen voor je er bent. Oké, het is 2 minuten lopen.
Ongekend goede werksfeer. Met versbereide happen, maandelijkse borrels, legendarische Coolblue-feesten, de leukste teamactiviteiten en een informele, speelse afdeling.
Ruimte voor nieuwe initiatieven en ideeën. Daar staan we altijd voor open. Of je nu een week, maand of een jaar bij ons werkt.
Uitdagend werk om helemaal in op te gaan, zodat je af en toe vergeet dat je aan het werk bent.
Een platte organisatie in de breedste zin van het woord. Zo kun je gewoon een biertje drinken met de baas.
Show more

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Are you an AI & ML Engineer who thrives on building intelligent systems and developing cutting-edge machine learning models?







This is your chance to join an innovative organization where your expertise will shape the future of AI-driven solutions! You’ll have the freedom to experiment, deploy, and optimize models while working alongside top-tier engineers and business leaders.







What You’ll Be Doing:




Designing and implementing machine learning models and AI algorithms.
Developing scalable, production-ready AI/ML solutions.
Working with large datasets to build predictive analytics and automation.
Optimizing model performance, deployment, and monitoring in real-world applications.




Essential Skills:




✅ 3+ years of experience in AI & ML Engineering

✅ Strong proficiency in Python

✅ Strong proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn

✅ Experience with data pipelines and MLOps

✅ Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

✅ Proven ability to develop and deploy ML models at scale

✅ Professional proficiency in Dutch (native not required)




Bonus Skills:




Knowledge of NLP, Computer Vision, or Generative AI.
Experience with Big Data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, or Kafka).







Flexible working: Hybrid setup – 2 days in-office, the rest remote!




Fantastic opportunities for career growth in a booming industry.




Work on high-impact AI projects with real-world applications.




Don’t miss this opportunity! Apply now to be at the forefront of AI & ML innovation.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Over ons

Sinds onze oprichting verbinden wij als IT-dienstverlener onze consultants met uitdagende softwareprojecten bij interessante opdrachtgevers door heel Nederland. We dienen als een thuisbasis voor software testers, developers, business analisten, scrummasters en DevOps engineers.




Jouw rol als Data Scientist:

Als Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen, implementeren en onderhouden van schaalbare en betrouwbare applicaties. Je werkt nauw samen met een ervaren team binnen een DevOps-methodologie om hoogwaardige en veilige oplossingen te realiseren.




Dit heb jij:

Minstens 5 jaar ervaring met programmeertalen als Python, Typescript/Javascript
Minimaal 5 jaar aantoonbare relevante werkervaring
Ervaring met het ontwerpen van Full Stack Applicaties
Ervaring met het schrijven van kwalitatieve code
Je kunt technische knelpunten makkelijk signaleren en oplossen
Continue leergierigheid naar de nieuwste trends en innovaties binnen softwareontwikkeling
Je bent in het bezit van een Bachelor diploma
Je hebt een vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal (Minimaal B2-niveau)




Wat wij jou bieden:

Vast contract vanaf dag één: We geloven in jouw talent en bieden je direct een contract voor onbepaalde tijd
Een goed salaris: Jouw salaris stemmen we af op jouw ervaring en kennis, volgens ons transparante salarismodel
28 vakantiedagen: Genoeg tijd om te ontspannen! Heb je er meer nodig? Geen probleem, je kunt er tot 5 extra dagen bijkopen
Pensioenregeling: Samen bouwen we aan jouw toekomst met een solide pensioenregeling.
Mobiliteitsbudget: Of je nu kiest voor een (lease)auto, ov of een fiets – jij bepaalt hoe je reist
De cafetariaregeling: Geniet van 50% belastingvoordeel op nieuwe devices zoals een telefoon of laptop
Onbeperkt opleidingsbudget: Investeren in jouw ontwikkeling staat bij ons voorop. Elke opleiding of training die jouw groei ondersteunt, wordt vergoed




Salarismeter

Wil je alvast een indicatie van jouw salaris? Gebruik onze salarismeter via: salarismeter.




Wie zijn wij? (Regio Oost)

Ons regiokantoor bevindt zich in Apeldoorn, waar onze Business Unit Managers elke dag klaarstaan om jouw carrière naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Zij bieden persoonlijke begeleiding en ondersteunen je in je ontwikkeling, zodat jij je ambities kunt waarmaken en de juiste uitdagingen kunt aangaan.

In regio Oost werken we samen met meer dan 15 klanten in Gelderland, Overijssel en Drenthe. Deze samenwerking biedt volop mogelijkheden bij toonaangevende organisaties in verschillende sectoren. Ons kantoor in Apeldoorn fungeert daarbij als een warme thuisbasis voor onze consultants. Hier kun je terecht voor overleg, inspiratie of gewoon een goed gesprek met collega’s.

Show more
HTML:
Over ons

Sinds onze oprichting verbinden wij als IT-dienstverlener onze consultants met uitdagende softwareprojecten bij interessante opdrachtgevers door heel Nederland. We dienen als een thuisbasis voor software testers, developers, business analisten, scrummasters en DevOps engineers.


Jouw rol als Data Scientist:

Als Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen, implementeren en onderhouden van schaalbare en betrouwbare applicaties. Je werkt nauw samen met een ervaren team binnen een DevOps-methodologie om hoogwaardige en veilige oplossingen te realiseren.


Dit heb jij:

  • Minstens 5 jaar ervaring met programmeertalen als Python, Typescript/Javascript
  • Minimaal 5 jaar aantoonbare relevante werkervaring
  • Ervaring met het ontwerpen van Full Stack Applicaties
  • Ervaring met het schrijven van kwalitatieve code
  • Je kunt technische knelpunten makkelijk signaleren en oplossen
  • Continue leergierigheid naar de nieuwste trends en innovaties binnen softwareontwikkeling
  • Je bent in het bezit van een Bachelor diploma
  • Je hebt een vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal (Minimaal B2-niveau)


Wat wij jou bieden:

  • Vast contract vanaf dag één: We geloven in jouw talent en bieden je direct een contract voor onbepaalde tijd
  • Een goed salaris: Jouw salaris stemmen we af op jouw ervaring en kennis, volgens ons transparante salarismodel
  • 28 vakantiedagen: Genoeg tijd om te ontspannen! Heb je er meer nodig? Geen probleem, je kunt er tot 5 extra dagen bijkopen
  • Pensioenregeling: Samen bouwen we aan jouw toekomst met een solide pensioenregeling.
  • Mobiliteitsbudget: Of je nu kiest voor een (lease)auto, ov of een fiets – jij bepaalt hoe je reist
  • De cafetariaregeling: Geniet van 50% belastingvoordeel op nieuwe devices zoals een telefoon of laptop
  • Onbeperkt opleidingsbudget: Investeren in jouw ontwikkeling staat bij ons voorop. Elke opleiding of training die jouw groei ondersteunt, wordt vergoed

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Overview / About Us

Lumanity is dedicated to improving patient health by accelerating and optimizing access to medical advances. We partner with life sciences companies around the world to generate evidence to demonstrate the value of their product, translate the science and data into compelling product narratives, and enable commercial decisions that position these products for success in the market. We do this through strategic and complimentary areas of focus: Asset Optimization and Commercialization, Value, Access, and Outcomes, Medical Strategy and Communications, and Real-World Evidence.

Responsibilities / Position Overview

Do you want to contribute to innovation in healthcare? And do you think big data can help personalize care?

The Data Management & Analytics team of Lumanity is looking for a (senior) data scientist to join our growing team. Do you have an affinity with data from healthcare and do you like to unlock insights from real world data on a daily basis? Do you see patterns in data and do you like to make them transparent to others? Are you highly analytical and would you like to develop further as a data scientist?

The Data Management & Analytics team works together to improve patient care by optimizing patient data and conducting scientific research.

Together with other employees of Data Management & Analytics you are responsible for analyzing, modeling and visualizing data for the disclosure of information for customers. You develop algorithms using the latest Azure technology, design reports in PowerBI, optimize performance for near real time delivery and monitor data quality through data mining and natural language processing.

This role offers the unique opportunity to combine you programming knowledge, passion for data, commercial craftsmanship, and social involvement.

Qualifications


Education in the the field of exact sciences
Knowledge and experience with programming preferably SQL and/or Python and/or R, and databases (experience with the Azure platform is an advantage)
Experience in transforming, analyzing, and visualizing big data;
Strong analytical and statistical skills and is creative in finding solutions;
Can think along with and has a substantive eye for the developments within his/her field;
Customer-oriented, communicative and business-oriented attitude;
Recognizes themselves in the following qualities: committed, go-getter, creative, honest and clear, flexible.


Benefits

We offer our employees a comprehensive benefits package that focuses on what matters to you – health and well-being, personal finances, professional development, and a healthy work/life balance:


Competitive salary
Attractive pension scheme
Positive working atmosphere with committed colleagues and an enthusiastic management team.
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work partly from home
a role in which you can combine your programming knowledge, passion for data, commercial craftsmanship and social involvement

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

Location: Groningen

About XPAR Vision

An ice-cold beer or a fine glass of wine every now and then – we’re all for it! But have you ever thought about how a glass bottle is made? We do, every single day. At XPAR Vision, we are dedicated to optimizing the production process of glass bottles and jars for clients in the global glass packaging industry. XPAR Vision develops, installs, and implements cutting-edge sensor and robot technology, enabling glass manufacturers—such as those producing for Heineken and Coca-Cola— to produce more good bottles with less energy/materials/people skills. With over 600 systems installed in more than 35 countries, we are the specialist and market leader in our field. We firmly believe that glass is the best packaging material in terms of experience, quality, health, and, most importantly, sustainability. Our mission is to encourage more food and beverage manufacturers to choose glass, directly contributing to a greener future by reducing the carbon footprint and minimizing the impact on our environment.

XPAR Vision is the global leader in advanced monitoring, control, and optimization solutions for the glass manufacturing industry. To make our systems smarter and more autonomous so they can support our customers—operators and specialists in the factory—by, for example, automatically generating recommendations for adjusting the production process, we are looking for a new colleague for the role of Data Scientist.




What will you do?

You will work in a multidisciplinary team of developers on innovative products.

As a Data Scientist, your main tasks will include:

Analyzing and exploring correlations in data streams from our systems and external sources. Examples include (infrared) images, temperatures, timing information from production machines, the number and types of detected defects, etc.
Developing mathematical models based on fundamental (physical) knowledge and available empirical knowledge of the production process.
Collecting (labeled) datasets and contributing to the development of tools/methods for this purpose.
Applying and developing Machine Learning / AI techniques to fully automate an increasing number of intelligent decisions regarding the production process or the adjustment of equipment, reducing the reliance on operators.




What do we ask?

A completed HBO+/WO degree in Data Science or a related technical field. We welcome recent graduates to apply.
Experience or affinity with Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence, including tools such as scripting languages (Python) and databases (MySQL, GraphQL).
Affinity with process industries.
Residency in (or near) Groningen, the Netherlands.
Good English language skills.
Strong communication skills, an entrepreneurial mindset, and a result- and customer-oriented attitude.




What do we offer?

A diverse role in an organization with short communication lines and an informal work atmosphere. This position comes with a competitive salary (€3.600 - €4.800) and excellent secondary benefits, including 30 vacation days per year.

You will become part of an enthusiastic, informal, and driven team of 15+ developers who support each other to achieve the best results and ensure customer satisfaction. You will have the opportunity to further develop and expand your talents by participating in different phases of product development (from research and feasibility studies to the completion and delivery of a final product). You might work with new technologies, take on a project leadership role, or interact more with customers and suppliers.

During the onboarding period, we will introduce you to our products, tools, and techniques. From day one, you will participate in development projects, and soon, you will see your work being used by our customers worldwide.




Want more information?

You can find more about our organization at www.xparvision.com, where you will also find a video demonstrating the implementation and application of XPAR Vision products in the glass industry. Our products can be found at XPAR Vision Products.




Apply now!

Send your motivation letter and CV to hrm@xparvision.com, addressed to Antonella Quaranta. For more information, contact us at +31 (0)6-552 255 04.
