Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
WAT VERBINDT JOU & BRINK?

Welke kansen zie jij op het vlak van data science voor het innoveren van de bouw-, infra- en vastgoedsector? Wanneer jij deze vraag voorgeschoteld krijgt, beginnen je handen te jeuken. Jij ziet hoe data het verschil kan maken en zet jouw analytische vaardigheden in om complexe vraagstukken op te lossen.

Geïnteresseerd in het datateam, maar liever als Software Engineer? Bekijk onze vacature!

Van data gaat jouw hart sneller kloppen. Je hebt een scherp oog voor patronen en kansen en weet deze te vertalen naar slimme, innovatieve oplossingen. Bovendien ben jij in staat om anderen te enthousiasmeren over de mogelijkheden die data biedt. Jij krijgt mensen mee, hoe vaak je daar soms ook voor op pad moet. Jij bent een specialist op het gebied van data science en een sparringpartner voor collega’s. Dat is waar jij energie van krijgt.

Ons datateam ontwikkelt software- en dataoplossingen. Denk aan geavanceerde (geo)data-analyse, het bouwen van GIS-viewers en het inzetten van AI-toepassingen om besluitvorming en werkprocessen te verbeteren. Wij kijken naar een Data Scientist met een sterke focus op data-analyse en data-gedreven modellering, die deze kennis ook direct in projecten toepast om impactvolle resultaten te behalen.

WAT VERBIND JIJ IN JE ROL BIJ BRINK?

Met data valt een wereld te winnen. En jij weet precies hoe. Je herkent de behoeften in de markt en vertaalt deze door naar data-gedreven oplossingen met impact. Samen met het Brink datateam bouw je aan slimme tools en zorg je voor efficiëntere, innovatievere processen. Je werkt aan projecten voor o.a. woningcorporaties, gemeenten, de Rijksoverheid en grote bedrijven.

Jouw Werk Bestaat Uit

– Data verzamelen, verwerken en analyseren met Python en SQL.

– Ontwikkelen en implementeren van data-gedreven oplossingen met maatschappelijke impact.

– Vertalen van analyses naar strategische en operationele adviezen voor opdrachtgevers. Dit doe je in teamverband, samen met collega’s die meer van de inhoud en minder datagedreven zijn.

– Toepassen van Machine Learning en statistiek.

– Werken met Azure OpenAI, Azure Pipelines en PostgreSQL. Heb je hier minder ervaring mee? Geen probleem, wij helpen je groeien!

WAAROM WIL JIJ JE AAN ONS VERBINDEN?

Binnen onze dynamische, compacte netwerkorganisatie met een informele sfeer krijg jij alle ruimte om je kennis en ervaring te delen. Samen met jou bouwen we onze positie in de markt nog verder uit. Hierbij kun je collegialiteit verwachten van zo’n 150 gedreven ‘vakidioten’, die in het hart staan van bouw, vastgoed en infra. Ze zetten altijd net even een stapje extra en leggen de lat steeds weer hoger.

Binnen Brink Werk Je In Een Klein En Gedreven Team Waarin Je Veel Verantwoordelijkheid Krijgt. Je Hebt De Vrijheid Om Te Experimenteren En Nieuwe Technologieën Toe Te Passen. Daarnaast Bieden Wij

– Een inspirerende en dynamische werkomgeving met ruimte voor innovatie.

– De kans om data science toe te passen in projecten met maatschappelijke impact.

– Veel mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontwikkelen en met de nieuwste technieken te werken.

– Een moderne werkplek in Rotterdam, Eindhoven of Groningen.

Wij vinden het belangrijk dat je arbeidsvoorwaarden passen bij jouw persoonlijke situatie. Daarom mag je een deel ervan zelf inrichten met een persoonlijk budget. Daarmee beschik je, naast je salaris, over een vrij besteedbaar bedrag dat je kunt inzetten voor verschillende doelen. Koop er extra vrije dagen mee, bovenop de 20 standaard vrije dagen die je al krijgt. Of zet het weg voor je pensioen. Als je situatie thuis verandert, kun je de condities op het werk vanzelfsprekend zelf weer mee laten veranderen.

Verder gaan we voor een samenwerking voor de lange termijn. Daarom bestaat de mogelijkheid om (bij een vast dienstverband) certificaten te kopen waarmee je mede-eigenaar wordt van Brink.

WAT ZIEN WIJ GRAAG TERUG IN JOU?

– Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in een relevante richting (bijv. (Technische) Informatica, Data Science, Geomatics, Computer Science of Wiskunde).

– Minimaal twee jaar relevante werkervaring.

– Ervaring met programmeren in Python en SQL.

– Het vermogen om complexe vraagstukken te vertalen naar praktische data-oplossingen.

– Communicatieve vaardigheden en de drive om met verschillende disciplines samen te werken.

– Affiniteit met de gebouwde omgeving (vastgoed, infrastructuur, stadsontwikkeling, etc.) is een plus.

WAAR WACHT JE NOG OP?

Heb je nog vragen? Neem contact op met Franklin Brandsma, (Recruiter), via f.brandsma@brink.nl, 0683090678, of solliciteer direct.

Wil je eerst meer weten over deze baan? Van iemand die er alles van weet? Neem dan contact op met Gerard van Dijk, Partner, via g.van.dijk@brink.nl of bel 06 22307871.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

OVER BRINK

Wij zijn een management-, advies- en softwarebedrijf in het middelpunt van bouw, infra en vastgoed. Ons hart gaat sneller kloppen van complexe vraagstukken en kansen om relevante en maatschappelijke impact te maken. Met programma’s, projecten en producten waarmee we bijdragen aan een leefbare, duurzame wereld.

We willen zelf iedere dag beter worden én onze producten en diensten continu verbeteren. We helpen onze klanten steeds een stap verder én jagen vernieuwing aan. Want wij willen de bouw-, infra- en vastgoedsector in beweging brengen. Samen. Met Brinkers, klanten en partners.

pijl klein/paars praktische informatie

Geinteresseerd in deze vacature?

Reageer dan eenvoudig via de solliciteer-button! Of ken je iemand voor wie deze vacature op het lijf is geschreven? Tip hem of haar dan. Je maakt diegene én ons erg blij. Alvast bedankt.

pijl klein/paars solliciteer

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Up to 70k annually




Are you looking to join a company where you can apply advanced data science in a focused, intellectually curious environment?




The Company

This is a globally active organization working at the forefront of leadership development, organizational advisory, and strategic talent solutions. Our multidisciplinary team brings together experts in psychology, business strategy, analytics, and technology to unlock the potential of leaders and organizations around the world. We value deep thinking, purposeful innovation, and meaningful outcomes over public recognition.




The role

As a Data Scientist you’ll work at the intersection of machine learning, organizational psychology, and leadership science. You´ll collaborate closely to develop impactful solutions leveraging AI, NLP, and predictive analytics. Your work will inform executive decisions, shape leadership strategies, and support complex organizational transformations.




Identify high-impact opportunities for ML/AI across internal tools and client-facing products
Design, test, and deploy advanced models (especially NLP and AI-based) to address nuanced leadership and organizational challenges
Collaborate cross-functionally to embed data-driven insights into products and services
Contribute thought leadership and subject-matter expertise across data science, leadership strategy, and analytics innovation
Stay current with advances in ML, AI, and behavioral science to guide best practices
Bring an entrepreneurial mind set to the table and define new AI opportunities within the business.




Skills and Experience

Strong track record in machine learning, NLP, and AI application—Bayesian modeling is a plus
Proficient in Python (preferred), R, or similar languages and ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills; meticulous attention to detail
Experience or interest in leadership science, organizational psychology, or social science research
Able to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders with clarity and empathy




Think this could be the right fit? We’d love to hear from you. Apply now via the button on this page.

Title: Data Scientist - Spectral data analysis
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist – Spectral Data Analysis (Microwave Sensors & Fresh Fruit Quality)

Location: Delft, Netherlands

Employment Type: Full-time




About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist with expertise in spectral data analysis to join our team in Delft, the Netherlands. This position focuses on the analysis of spectral data from microwave sensors used for the non-destructive assessment of internal quality in fresh fruit. The ideal candidate will develop innovative data-driven solutions to enhance sensor performance, extract meaningful insights from complex datasets, and contribute to advancing precision agriculture and food quality assessment.




Key Responsibilities

Analyze and interpret spectral data acquired from microwave sensors to assess fruit quality parameters.
Develop and apply machine learning, signal processing, and statistical models for spectral data analysis.
Design and optimize data pipelines for spectral measurements, ensuring accuracy and reliability.
Collaborate with engineers, agronomists, and food scientists to refine sensor algorithms and improve predictive accuracy.
Conduct feature extraction, data preprocessing, and model validation to enhance the detection of internal fruit quality characteristics.
Work with large datasets, applying advanced data visualization techniques to communicate findings.
Design and implement model deployment on device and through cloud.
Keep up with the latest research in spectral data processing, microwave sensing, and AI-driven agricultural solutions.




Required Qualifications & Skills

Bachelor, Master's or PhD in Data Science, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Agricultural Technology, or a related field.
Expertise in spectral data analysis, preferably in microwave, NIR or hyperspectral imaging.
Strong knowledge of machine learning, signal processing, and statistical analysis applied to sensor data.
Proficiency in Python, MATLAB, R, or similar programming languages for data analysis.
Good programming skills.
Experience with data modeling, predictive analytics, and classification techniques.
Familiarity with spectral sensor technologies and their application in food quality assessment is a plus.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in an interdisciplinary team.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.




What We Offer

A stimulating work environment at the intersection of data science, agriculture, and sensor technology.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and research collaboration.
A workplace in Delft, a hub of innovation and technology in the Netherlands.




How to Apply

If you are passionate about spectral data analysis, sensor technology, and food quality assessment, we would love to hear from you! Please apply to this open position on LinkedIn.
Show more
HTML:
Job Title: Data Scientist – Spectral Data Analysis (Microwave Sensors & Fresh Fruit Quality)

Location: Delft, Netherlands

Employment Type: Full-time


About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist with expertise in spectral data analysis to join our team in Delft, the Netherlands. This position focuses on the analysis of spectral data from microwave sensors used for the non-destructive assessment of internal quality in fresh fruit. The ideal candidate will develop innovative data-driven solutions to enhance sensor performance, extract meaningful insights from complex datasets, and contribute to advancing precision agriculture and food quality assessment.


Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze and interpret spectral data acquired from microwave sensors to assess fruit quality parameters.
  • Develop and apply machine learning, signal processing, and statistical models for spectral data analysis.
  • Design and optimize data pipelines for spectral measurements, ensuring accuracy and reliability.
  • Collaborate with engineers, agronomists, and food scientists to refine sensor algorithms and improve predictive accuracy.
  • Conduct feature extraction, data preprocessing, and model validation to enhance the detection of internal fruit quality characteristics.
  • Work with large datasets, applying advanced data visualization techniques to communicate findings.
  • Design and implement model deployment on device and through cloud.
  • Keep up with the latest research in spectral data processing, microwave sensing, and AI-driven agricultural solutions.


Required Qualifications & Skills

  • Bachelor, Master's or PhD in Data Science, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Agricultural Technology, or a related field.
  • Expertise in spectral data analysis, preferably in microwave, NIR or hyperspectral imaging.
  • Strong knowledge of machine learning, signal processing, and statistical analysis applied to sensor data.
  • Proficiency in Python, MATLAB, R, or similar programming languages for data analysis.
  • Good programming skills.
  • Experience with data modeling, predictive analytics, and classification techniques.
  • Familiarity with spectral sensor technologies and their application in food quality assessment is a plus.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in an interdisciplinary team.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.


What We Offer

  • A stimulating work environment at the intersection of data science, agriculture, and sensor technology.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and research collaboration.
  • A workplace in Delft, a hub of innovation and technology in the Netherlands.


How to Apply

  • If you are passionate about spectral data analysis, sensor technology, and food quality assessment, we would love to hear from you! Please apply to this open position on LinkedIn.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Up to 60k annually




Are you looking to join a company where you can apply advanced data science in a focused, intellectually curious environment?




The Company

This is a globally active organization working at the forefront of leadership development, organizational advisory, and strategic talent solutions. Our multidisciplinary team brings together experts in psychology, business strategy, analytics, and technology to unlock the potential of leaders and organizations around the world. We value deep thinking, purposeful innovation, and meaningful outcomes over public recognition.




The role

As a Data Scientist you’ll work at the intersection of machine learning, organizational psychology, and leadership science. You´ll collaborate closely to develop impactful solutions leveraging AI, NLP, and predictive analytics. Your work will inform executive decisions, shape leadership strategies, and support complex organizational transformations.




Identify high-impact opportunities for ML/AI across internal tools and client-facing products
Design, test, and deploy advanced models (especially NLP and AI-based) to address nuanced leadership and organizational challenges
Collaborate cross-functionally to embed data-driven insights into products and services
Contribute thought leadership and subject-matter expertise across data science, leadership strategy, and analytics innovation
Stay current with advances in ML, AI, and behavioral science to guide best practices
Bring an entrepreneurial mind set to the table and define new AI opportunities within the business.




Skills and Experience

Strong track record in machine learning, NLP, and AI application—Bayesian modeling is a plus
Proficient in Python (preferred), R, or similar languages and ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills; meticulous attention to detail
Experience or interest in leadership science, organizational psychology, or social science research
Able to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders with clarity and empathy




Think this could be the right fit? We’d love to hear from you. Apply now via the button on this page.

Title: AI/ML specialist Edge AI
Description:
AI/ML specialist Edge AI Eindhoven the Netherlands

Your Profile

• University degree: MSc, PhD or PDEng in a technical specialism, like Computer Science or equally relevant.

• 5+ years of experience in (software) engineering, with significant exposure/involvement with Machine Learning / AI required

• Affinity and experience with embedded processors, software and NN accelerators required.

• Broad experience with embedded software architectures, build systems, version control systems required.

• Broad experience with Operating systems GNU/Linux, embedded systems, development boards, and processors, and SW competencies as listed below required.

• Excellent communication skills in English (verbal /written) required. Experience in working in/with multi-site and multi-cultural projects/teams preferred.

• An (active) Github account (pref).




Your Competencies

• To give you a feeling for the types of competences, some examples are:

• Flexibility in working with AI frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch), preferably via Python and C++ interfaces required.

• Understanding of AI toolchains, deployment, portability and inference engines (CUDA, TensorRT, TFLite, ONNX, etc.) preferred.

• Familiarity with setting up and maintaining related development environments (docker, TensorBoard, performance profiling, ClearML, etc.) required.

• Knowledge of build systems (YOCTO, OpenEmbedded, etc.) beneficial, working with cross-compilation toolchains for ARM preferred.

• Solid programming experience of C, C++, Python and Bash programming languages on Linux systems required.

• Experience with on-device learning and federated learning appreciated.

• Familiarity with future technologies for extreme efficiency such as in-memory, analog, and neuromorphic computing beneficial.

• Experience with Edge AI.




Department

We drive innovation on system level for the Automotive, Consumer / Internet of Things, Industrial and Medical/Health businesses in applications like highly automated and safe driving , radar systems, electrification, mobile robotics, industry 4.0, and personal health. We foresee that artificial intelligence through embedded neural networks will often provide a significant part of the ‘smartness’ in the products for these markets.

We innovate by combining technologies, IPs and products from different entities of our client and by participating in collaboration projects with customers, universities and research institutes. Together with the other departments, we anticipate future technology trends and gather innovative system and application insights for the roadmaps by developing innovative system prototypes, often in co-operation with external partners and customers. Where possible, we support new business development / new markets across departments, leveraging the companies technologies and competences. We also created and maintain a lab which showcases all the latest inventions to visitors of our headquarters.

The work is performed in a team of AI-experts, embedded in our clients world-wide AI-activities. The team’s current scope in research and advanced development is to research and evaluate methods for efficient machine learning (ML) inference while fully exploiting the HW/SW characteristics of all of our clients AI platforms, targeting multi-objective optimization. We support the departments with deep know-how to embed these ML-methodologies in the clients HW/SW AI products. We stay on top of and utilize today’s state of the art developments in the academic and open source communities, and participate there-in through partnerships, PhD- and master-student programs, publications etc. We seek to expand the team with ambitious embedded AI architects/engineers.

Our responsibilities are in the areas described below; where the exact responsibility of the candidate is determined taking his capabilities in mind:

• Automatic joint design and optimization for neural networks through Scalable and Collaborative Neural Architecture Search

• Innovating Transformer models, architectures and training methodologies to deployment on the Edge

• Domain generalization over sensors, configurations and datasets

• The methods are applied to vision, radar, audio and other time-series-data for above-mentioned industries

• Integration of the investigated methods and neural networks in larger applications, open source frameworks and compelling demonstrators

• Executing the above in co-operative and EU-supported projects with external partners (universities, companies), and in our clients long term innovation program (“research”)

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
The assignment is for the Passenger Information product team for Business Platform Commercial. As a Data Scientist, you will develop and maintain a number of products that are on the Commercial roadmap for the duration of the assignment.




The assignment consists of the following components:

Expanding our Customer Care LLM chatbot with functionalities to share real-time insights of flight information, baggage systems, and waiting times with passengers.
Setting up an API to summarize and categorize video conversations with passengers based on audio files.
Monitoring and maintaining our LLM chatbot, baggage predictions and security waiting time predictions.




Required experience:

5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist within a large (complex) organization, preferably semi-government
Knowledge of & experience with Python, Git, Machine Learning Frameworks, Generative AI, API Frameworks
Must be able to communicate in Dutch & English




For this assignment, work is also done at the client location in connection with coordination with relevant stakeholders. Work can also be done from home or another location, preferably in consultation with stakeholders. Preference is given to carrying out the assignment on Monday to Thursday due to stakeholders within the project who are present on these days.




ZZP or BV is allowed.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What it’s about

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you collaborate with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to develop scalable, production-ready applications powered by data and AI. You are a Scientist or Engineer who embraces mathematics and understands the process of taking models from development to production. You possess the necessary skills and courage to bring ideas from your laptop to a cluster.




How you will help in creating value with Data & AI

At Xebia, we establish robust Data & AI practices to bring value to our clients and their customers. Our team of data professionals has successfully predicted daily bread demand, implemented energy-saving algorithms at a national scale, and established data innovation labs in large multinational corporations. By joining our team, you can contribute to even greater achievements in making top companies AI-driven.

As a machine learning engineer, your responsibility is to take AI solutions into production to generate value. You ensure that applications are scalable, testable, robust, and extendable through your expertise in engineering and machine learning.




What you will do to make AI-driven applications

You collaborate closely with data scientists on your team to understand the problem being addressed and their approach. You review their code, modularise it, identify areas for testing, and even challenge their solutions to enhance their effectiveness. Your proficiency in Python enables you to improve code quality or potentially translate it to other languages like Scala or Java.

During on-site client engagements, you may encounter challenging problems. Fortunately, Xebia organizes regular remote work sessions where you can discuss and find solutions with the collective intelligence of the entire team. If immediate assistance is needed, every Xebia member is just a quick message away, always ready to provide support.




THIS IS YOUR DREAM JOB IF…

✅ You like working on the overlap between AI and software or data engineering.

✅ You like building your solutions with services on public clouds or want to learn how to do that.

✅ You like working for different clients and enjoy the excitement of regularly getting to learn new environments and know new people.

✅ You speak Dutch fluently.




THIS IS NOT YOUR DREAM JOB IF…

❌ You only want to build models from data and are not interested in doing the work involved in taking these models into production.

❌ You are just fine with spaghetti code or do not understand what that is.

❌ You do not like coding, scripting, or templating.

❌ You do not live in the North Brabant province.




WHAT IT IS LIKE TO BE A CONSULTANT AT XEBIA DATA

As a consultant at Xebia Data, you will have projects of varying lengths. Some are 2 weeks, some are 1 year, most are in between. Every project is different, as is every client. We, however, always deliver the best quality possible. It is not always easy, but it is always rewarding. You will be exposed to different companies, problems, systems, and solutions. Join our dynamic team and collaborate with industry leaders such as Ahold, ASML, and Sligro! Explore the exciting projects we've undertaken by diving into our inspiring customer stories.




You will be surrounded by experts in different fields, and you will learn so many new things in a short time. Xebia Data offers the perfect environment to shine as a data professional.

You will never be alone on this journey. We have all experienced imposter syndrome, had a difficult project, or felt down at times. We know what it takes, we know it is difficult sometimes, and we will be there for you when you need it. We say People First, and we mean it.




Xebia Data offers you great benefits too, of course!

You can enjoy, for free, healthy lunches and not-so-healthy drinks/snacks at our offices.
You can use the great benefits we offer for your physical and mental well-being.
You get a generous tech budget.
You can build/test/experiment anything you want in our sandbox environments in GCP, AWS and Azure.
You can work on that innovative idea of yours during the monthly Xebia Data Fridays.
You have 5.000 Euros and 6 days of development budget per year which you can spend on anything that will make you a better data professional.
You also have a monthly mobility budget to spend on leasing a car, leasing the e-bike of your dreams, or getting an NS Business Card.







📍Please note we don't provide relocation at the moment.

Title: Internship in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (AI)
HTML:
Europol is looking to establish a reserve list of successful candidates for the internship profile “Travel Risk Management Process”. Following the selection procedure, the successful candidate will be allocated to the team of Security and Facilities Services within the Governance Directorate.


This internship project will focus on supporting the implementation of the Travel Risk Management Process leaded by the Security Intelligence and Travel Security Office within Security and Services Team.


The intern will assist the team by:


  • Creating a list of accommodations in non-EU countries visited by Europol staff;
  • Gathering feedback from staff members regarding security challenges faced and/or observed during last trips;
  • Contributing to the travel risk management process;
  • Contributing to updating security briefings;
  • Monitoring and identifying relevant topics on social media;
  • Providing assistance in processing and assessing frantic communication to identify threats towards the organisation;


The successful candidate will join the internship project for a minimum period of 6 months and a maximum period of 12 months, including any possibility of extension based on the performance of the intern, the interest of the service and budget availability, with a work schedule of 40 hours a week. The internship will take place at the Europol premises in The Hague, The Netherlands.


During the period of internship, interns currently receive a MONTHLY MAINTENANCE GRANT of 1.500 EUR, serving the purpose to cover the costs of living in The Netherlands.


Please refer to the internship announcement on our website for additional details regarding the qualifications and duties. Europol accepts applications submitted only via the Europol website.


Deadline: 6 May 2025

Title: Data Scientist - Product Insights
Description:
At Catawiki, every day brings the extraordinary! Whether it’s , a , or , we encounter exceptional objects every day.




We're a one-of-a-kind marketplace for buying and selling special objects! Each week we offer over 75,000 unique items in auction, carefully curated by our passionate in-house experts.




Having sold over 20 million unique objects to date, we’re on a mission to become the world’s most popular destination for special objects. As a growing, diverse and sustainable scale-up, we proudly live by our core values:





Taking ownership and driving impact


Being open to change and feedback


Being passionate about our mission and our customers.





If these values resonate with you, we’d love to explore how you can join us on this exciting journey!


About the role and team


With thousands of active lots every day, hundreds of thousands of daily bids, millions of users, and billions of events, the Catawiki platform generates vast amounts of data every day. All this data is being collected and stored, and used extensively by our team of 19 data scientists and engineers that want to build a better company by using data in a smart way. At Catawiki, we believe in using data for making decisions, and the Data Science & Analytics team plays a central role in that.




We are looking for a Data Scientist - Product Insights to work with our Product teams and leverage data to identify user journey opportunities and measure success of our product features and teams.




You will be part of the Data Science Product Insights Team helping us make sense of our data, finding actionable insights and creating self-service opportunities by combining data from multiple sources and working closely together with your colleagues in other departments.




In this role no two days will be the same: you will build dashboards, design robust A/B tests, uncover trends in user behaviour, collaborate with your Data colleagues on discovery for a new ML model, or enhance the reliability of our data pipelines. Whatever the task, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping Catawiki’s product solutions and deliver real impact.


What You'll Do



Own analytics for a broad product area – Unlike at larger companies where analytics roles are more specialized, at Catawiki, you’ll take full ownership of a major part of the platform. This could mean leading analytics for all buyer-facing features, all seller-facing experiences, or everything related to fulfillment. You’ll build strong relationships with stakeholders and proactively identify opportunities by deeply understanding Catawiki’s user behavior.


Turn data into insights and recommendations – You’ll go beyond tracking metrics—you’ll define and refine key success measures, uncover trends, and translate data into clear recommendations. Your insights will help shape Product decisions, flag opportunities, and drive the strategy forward. Through dashboards and reports, you’ll make sure the right information is always at hand to guide the business.


Leverage advanced analytics – Using techniques like regression analysis, causal inference, and A/B testing, you’ll analyze user behavior, identify actionable insights, and evaluate the effectiveness of new features to ensure continuous improvement.


Enable data-driven decision-making at scale – You’ll identify and implement self-service data solutions that empower Product teams to make informed decisions faster. Beyond Product analytics, you’ll contribute to foundational data projects like building scalable data pipelines, improving data accessibility, and expanding our A/B Experimentation program.



Who You Are



Experienced data professional – You have a strong quantitative background and 3+ years of experience in data science or analytics, ideally in an online company.


Technical skills – You're proficient in SQL and comfortable writing code to transform data into insights, whether in Python, R, or another language. You can handle large datasets, manage complex data pipelines, and work with tools like Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, and data transformation tools like dbt or Dataform.


Statistical expertise – You have a solid understanding of statistics and can apply techniques like regression analysis, causal inference, and hypothesis testing to extract meaningful insights from data.


Web and app analytics – You have experience with tracking tools like Google Analytics (GA) and Google Tag Manager (GTM), helping to measure and optimize user behavior.


Data-driven experimentation – You understand A/B testing principles and how to apply them to drive meaningful insights.


Turning data into action – You don’t just analyze data—you extract insights that drive business decisions, even with minimal engineering support.


Strong communicator – You work effectively with business owners, engineers, and leadership, translating data insights into clear recommendations.



Where You’ll Be


This role is based in our Amsterdam office, in the Netherlands.


Why You'll Love Working with Us



Create a Visible Impact by working at scale in a global organisation that serves millions of customers across 80+ categories. In our flat structure, every role has a broad scope that directly impacts both our customers and the business.


Learn and Grow with Us through our Learning & Development initiatives, which include clear development plans and mentorship programmes designed to support your career progression.


A Culture of Connection defines us. We’re a passionate, diverse and collaborative team of 800+ Catawikains and 60+ nationalities, all coming together to build a one-of-a-kind marketplace. We foster an inclusive and queer-friendly work environment, committed to making every Catawikian feel welcomed and empowered. Whatever your story, we encourage you to bring your unique perspective to our team.


Celebrate Life’s Moments with us at Catawiki. When you join us, you’ll receive a €100 Catavoucher, and on each birthday, you'll get a €50 Catavoucher to celebrate. Enjoy an extra day off each year to "Pursue Your Passion". We also recognise significant work anniversaries (3, 5, 8, 10 years) with additional time off, plus extra leave for life’s big moments like marriage, engagements, or moving house.





Please note that benefits can vary by location. For specific information regarding what’s available in your country, please consult your recruiter.


Our Offices and Way of Working


Our vibrant offices in Amsterdam, Paris and Lisbon are designed to inspire and connect. Most Catawikians are within commuting distance of one of our offices and enjoy the flexibility of a hybrid work model. This means we typically ask you to be in the office 2 out of 5 days, roughly 40% of your working time, to collaborate and connect with your colleagues. Of course, if the job description specifies that the role is 100% remote—such as for certain expert or sales positions—then that arrangement will apply.


Interested?


Apply directly with an English CV and cover letter by submitting your information at the bottom of this page. By submitting your application you agree to .

HTML:
At Catawiki, every day brings the extraordinary! Whether it’s , a , or , we encounter exceptional objects every day.


We're a one-of-a-kind marketplace for buying and selling special objects! Each week we offer over 75,000 unique items in auction, carefully curated by our passionate in-house experts.


Having sold over 20 million unique objects to date, we’re on a mission to become the world’s most popular destination for special objects. As a growing, diverse and sustainable scale-up, we proudly live by our core values:



  • Taking ownership and driving impact

  • Being open to change and feedback

  • Being passionate about our mission and our customers.


If these values resonate with you, we’d love to explore how you can join us on this exciting journey!


About the role and team

With thousands of active lots every day, hundreds of thousands of daily bids, millions of users, and billions of events, the Catawiki platform generates vast amounts of data every day. All this data is being collected and stored, and used extensively by our team of 19 data scientists and engineers that want to build a better company by using data in a smart way. At Catawiki, we believe in using data for making decisions, and the Data Science & Analytics team plays a central role in that.


We are looking for a Data Scientist - Product Insights to work with our Product teams and leverage data to identify user journey opportunities and measure success of our product features and teams.


You will be part of the Data Science Product Insights Team helping us make sense of our data, finding actionable insights and creating self-service opportunities by combining data from multiple sources and working closely together with your colleagues in other departments.


In this role no two days will be the same: you will build dashboards, design robust A/B tests, uncover trends in user behaviour, collaborate with your Data colleagues on discovery for a new ML model, or enhance the reliability of our data pipelines. Whatever the task, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping Catawiki’s product solutions and deliver real impact.


What You'll Do

  • Own analytics for a broad product area – Unlike at larger companies where analytics roles are more specialized, at Catawiki, you’ll take full ownership of a major part of the platform. This could mean leading analytics for all buyer-facing features, all seller-facing experiences, or everything related to fulfillment. You’ll build strong relationships with stakeholders and proactively identify opportunities by deeply understanding Catawiki’s user behavior.

  • Turn data into insights and recommendations – You’ll go beyond tracking metrics—you’ll define and refine key success measures, uncover trends, and translate data into clear recommendations. Your insights will help shape Product decisions, flag opportunities, and drive the strategy forward. Through dashboards and reports, you’ll make sure the right information is always at hand to guide the business.

  • Leverage advanced analytics – Using techniques like regression analysis, causal inference, and A/B testing, you’ll analyze user behavior, identify actionable insights, and evaluate the effectiveness of new features to ensure continuous improvement.

  • Enable data-driven decision-making at scale – You’ll identify and implement self-service data solutions that empower Product teams to make informed decisions faster. Beyond Product analytics, you’ll contribute to foundational data projects like building scalable data pipelines, improving data accessibility, and expanding our A/B Experimentation program.


Who You Are

  • Experienced data professional – You have a strong quantitative background and 3+ years of experience in data science or analytics, ideally in an online company.

  • Technical skills – You're proficient in SQL and comfortable writing code to transform data into insights, whether in Python, R, or another language. You can handle large datasets, manage complex data pipelines, and work with tools like Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, and data transformation tools like dbt or Dataform.

  • Statistical expertise – You have a solid understanding of statistics and can apply techniques like regression analysis, causal inference, and hypothesis testing to extract meaningful insights from data.

  • Web and app analytics – You have experience with tracking tools like Google Analytics (GA) and Google Tag Manager (GTM), helping to measure and optimize user behavior.

  • Data-driven experimentation – You understand A/B testing principles and how to apply them to drive meaningful insights.

  • Turning data into action – You don’t just analyze data—you extract insights that drive business decisions, even with minimal engineering support.

  • Strong communicator – You work effectively with business owners, engineers, and leadership, translating data insights into clear recommendations.


Where You’ll Be

This role is based in our Amsterdam office, in the Netherlands.


Why You'll Love Working with Us

  • Create a Visible Impact by working at scale in a global organisation that serves millions of customers across 80+ categories. In our flat structure, every role has a broad scope that directly impacts both our customers and the business.

  • Learn and Grow with Us through our Learning & Development initiatives, which include clear development plans and mentorship programmes designed to support your career progression.

  • A Culture of Connection defines us. We’re a passionate, diverse and collaborative team of 800+ Catawikains and 60+ nationalities, all coming together to build a one-of-a-kind marketplace. We foster an inclusive and queer-friendly work environment, committed to making every Catawikian feel welcomed and empowered. Whatever your story, we encourage you to bring your unique perspective to our team.

  • Celebrate Life’s Moments with us at Catawiki. When you join us, you’ll receive a €100 Catavoucher, and on each birthday, you'll get a €50 Catavoucher to celebrate. Enjoy an extra day off each year to "Pursue Your Passion". We also recognise significant work anniversaries (3, 5, 8, 10 years) with additional time off, plus extra leave for life’s big moments like marriage, engagements, or moving house.


Please note that benefits can vary by location. For specific information regarding what’s available in your country, please consult your recruiter.


Our Offices and Way of Working

Our vibrant offices in Amsterdam, Paris and Lisbon are designed to inspire and connect. Most Catawikians are within commuting distance of one of our offices and enjoy the flexibility of a hybrid work model. This means we typically ask you to be in the office 2 out of 5 days, roughly 40% of your working time, to collaborate and connect with your colleagues. Of course, if the job description specifies that the role is 100% remote—such as for certain expert or sales positions—then that arrangement will apply.


Interested?

Apply directly with an English CV and cover letter by submitting your information at the bottom of this page. By submitting your application you agree to .


If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

Location: Groningen

About XPAR Vision

An ice-cold beer or a fine glass of wine every now and then – we’re all for it! But have you ever thought about how a glass bottle is made? We do, every single day. At XPAR Vision, we are dedicated to optimizing the production process of glass bottles and jars for clients in the global glass packaging industry. XPAR Vision develops, installs, and implements cutting-edge sensor and robot technology, enabling glass manufacturers—such as those producing for Heineken and Coca-Cola— to produce more good bottles with less energy/materials/people skills. With over 600 systems installed in more than 35 countries, we are the specialist and market leader in our field. We firmly believe that glass is the best packaging material in terms of experience, quality, health, and, most importantly, sustainability. Our mission is to encourage more food and beverage manufacturers to choose glass, directly contributing to a greener future by reducing the carbon footprint and minimizing the impact on our environment.

XPAR Vision is the global leader in advanced monitoring, control, and optimization solutions for the glass manufacturing industry. To make our systems smarter and more autonomous so they can support our customers—operators and specialists in the factory—by, for example, automatically generating recommendations for adjusting the production process, we are looking for a new colleague for the role of Data Scientist.




What will you do?

You will work in a multidisciplinary team of developers on innovative products.

As a Data Scientist, your main tasks will include:

Analyzing and exploring correlations in data streams from our systems and external sources. Examples include (infrared) images, temperatures, timing information from production machines, the number and types of detected defects, etc.
Developing mathematical models based on fundamental (physical) knowledge and available empirical knowledge of the production process.
Collecting (labeled) datasets and contributing to the development of tools/methods for this purpose.
Applying and developing Machine Learning / AI techniques to fully automate an increasing number of intelligent decisions regarding the production process or the adjustment of equipment, reducing the reliance on operators.




What do we ask?

A completed HBO+/WO degree in Data Science or a related technical field. We welcome recent graduates to apply.
Experience or affinity with Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence, including tools such as scripting languages (Python) and databases (MySQL, GraphQL).
Affinity with process industries.
Residency in (or near) Groningen, the Netherlands.
Good English language skills.
Strong communication skills, an entrepreneurial mindset, and a result- and customer-oriented attitude.




What do we offer?

A diverse role in an organization with short communication lines and an informal work atmosphere. This position comes with a competitive salary (€3.600 - €4.800) and excellent secondary benefits, including 30 vacation days per year.

You will become part of an enthusiastic, informal, and driven team of 15+ developers who support each other to achieve the best results and ensure customer satisfaction. You will have the opportunity to further develop and expand your talents by participating in different phases of product development (from research and feasibility studies to the completion and delivery of a final product). You might work with new technologies, take on a project leadership role, or interact more with customers and suppliers.

During the onboarding period, we will introduce you to our products, tools, and techniques. From day one, you will participate in development projects, and soon, you will see your work being used by our customers worldwide.




Want more information?

You can find more about our organization at www.xparvision.com, where you will also find a video demonstrating the implementation and application of XPAR Vision products in the glass industry. Our products can be found at XPAR Vision Products.




Apply now!

Send your motivation letter and CV to hrm@xparvision.com, addressed to Antonella Quaranta. For more information, contact us at +31 (0)6-552 255 04.

Title: Data Science Specialist
Description:
Namens een toonaangevend Nederlands IT-consultancybedrijf zijn we op zoek naar een ambitieuze Data Scientist.




Ben jij klaar voor de volgende stap in je carrière als Data Scientist?

Wij bieden jou deze kans! Wij zoeken een Data Scientist die comfortabel is met het ontwikkelen van machine learning-modellen die klaar zijn voor productie. Iemand die data science-projecten kan leiden vanaf de conceptfase tot aan de implementatie en deployment.




Wat ga je doen?

Als Data Scientist werk je samen met ervaren analytics engineers, data scientists en data engineers aan uitdagende AI-projecten. Je gaat aan de slag met complexe business vraagstukken binnen diverse domeinen, zoals:

Fraude- en anomalie detectie
Tijdreeksmodellen
Recommender systemen

Je weet hoe je grote hoeveelheden data moet verwerken en past de juiste algoritmes toe op het juiste domein. We zoeken iemand met een "can and will do"-mentaliteit en iemand die leidt door het goede voorbeeld te geven. Daarnaast ben je gedreven om jezelf continu te blijven ontwikkelen en samen met je team impactvolle oplossingen te creëren.




Wat breng je mee?

Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer of een vergelijkbare rol
Bachelors en/of Masters in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Econometrie of een vergelijkbaar vakgebied
Expert in coden met Python
Ervaring met Docker containerisation
Cloud ervaring (Azure, GCP of AWS)
Een teamspeler met sterke communicatieve vaardigheden
Enthousiast over kennisdeling en continue ontwikkeling
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels




Wat bieden wij?

Een uitdagende en dynamische werkomgeving met innovatieve AI-projecten
Samenwerking met een team van ervaren en gedreven professionals
Ruimte en ondersteuning om je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen
Een informele werksfeer waarin successen samen gevierd worden




Let op: Voor deze functie zoeken wij kandidaten die gerechtigd zijn om in Nederland te werken. Wij bieden geen visumsponsoring aan.




Interesse? Wil jij impact maken als Data Scientist binnen verschillende grote en complexe bedrijven? Solliciteer dan nu!

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Are you a Machine Learning Engineer passionate about building and deploying predictive models that shape business decisions? This is your chance to join a dynamic media organisation in Amsterdam, where your expertise will drive innovation and transform data into actionable insights.







What You’ll Be Doing:




Designing, developing, and deploying predictive ML models to enhance business strategy and customer engagement.
Building and optimising data pipelines for model training, evaluation, and deployment.
Working with time-series forecasting, recommendation systems, and audience behaviour analysis.
Managing large-scale datasets, ensuring data quality and accessibility.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, and product managers.
Implementing CI/CD workflows and containerisation using Docker and Kubernetes.
Leveraging cloud-based infrastructure (AWS, Azure, or GCP) to deploy scalable ML solutions.
Mentoring junior engineers and guiding interns in best ML practices.




Essential Skills:




✅ Dutch

✅ Machine Learning Development – End-to-end ML solution development

✅ Python Programming – Proficiency in Python/ ML model development.

✅ Data Engineering – Experience with data pipelines.

✅ AI & Deep Learning – Proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow/ PyTorch.

✅ Cloud Platforms – Hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP.

✅ CI/CD & DevOps – Experience with continuous integration/ deployment.

✅ Containerisation & Orchestration – Docker/ Kubernetes.




Bonus Skills:




Experience in media analytics, recommendation engines, or personalised content models.
Knowledge of real-time data processing and streaming technologies.
Familiarity with A/B testing and experimentation frameworks.







Work on cutting-edge ML projects that directly impact millions of users.




A hybrid working model – 2 days in-office, the rest remote.




A great culture that fosters innovation, learning, and career growth.










If you’re ready to push the boundaries of AI, apply now and be part of something extraordinary!

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Ben jij de nieuwe Data Scientist die wij zoeken?  

Als Junior Data Scientist speel je een centrale rol binnen het team dat verantwoordelijk is voor het verkrijgen van waardevolle inzichten uit complexe datasets om strategische beslissingen te ondersteunen. Jouw analytische en statistische expertise, samen met je programmeervaardigheden, worden ingezet om voorspellende modellen te ontwikkelen, patronen te ontdekken en bruikbare aanbevelingen te doen die bijdragen aan en het succes van onze klanten bevorderen.




Werken bij MarketResponse is werken in een inspirerende en dynamische omgeving. Nieuwe mensen zijn bij ons altijd meer dan welkom, ze brengen nieuwe inzichten en ervaringen mee en helpen ons daarmee vooruit. De werksfeer is informeel. Naast hard werken staan een fijne samenwerking en plezier hebben centraal. Wij zijn ervan overtuigd dat mensen die zich prettig voelen, beter presteren. Onze werkplekken vind je in de Urban Hub Creative Valley, direct aan het Stationsplein van Utrecht Centraal Station. Met Hoog Catharijne en de binnenstad op loopafstand is er ook tussen de bedrijven door genoeg te beleven.




Wat ga je doen?  

·      Je werkt samen met het team om relevante databronnen te ontsluiten, te prepareren en te analyseren. Je maakt hiervoor gebruikt van tools zoals Python, SQL en Excel.

·      Je gaat verkennende gegevensanalyses uitvoeren om trends, patronen en outliers te identificeren.

·      Je ontwikkelt voorspellende modellen en past supervised en unsupervised machine learning technieken toe. Modeltraining, validatie en verfijning implementeren om optimale prestaties te bereiken vind je leuk om te doen.

·      Je vertaalt bevindingen uit complexe analyses naar duidelijke en bruikbare inzichten. Je helpt bij het creëren van visuele representaties van data, zodat de bevindingen gemakkelijk te begrijpen zijn voor de rest van het team en voor klanten.

·      Je werkt nauw samen in cross-functionele teams om de data-gedreven strategieën van onze klanten te verbeteren en hen te helpen bij het nemen van datagestuurde beslissingen.

·      Je vindt het van nature leuk om op de hoogte blijven van opkomende trends en ontwikkelingen op het gebied van data science en AI.

·      Je hebt een brede interesse die goed aansluit bij onze relatief kleine organisatie, waarin je een afwisselende rol hebt met de mogelijkheid om je op meerdere gebieden te ontwikkelen.

·      Het verbeteren van je skills om jezelf te blijven ontwikkelen en het bijdragen aan kennisdeling binnen het team is iets waar je continue mee bezig bent.

 

Ons aanbod

·      Een inspirerende en dynamische werkomgeving waar je veel kunt leren en jezelf kunt ontwikkelen

·      Veel ruimte voor eigen initiatief en inbreng terwijl je werkt voor aansprekende merken en organisaties

·      Een kantoor midden in het bruisend stationsgebied van Utrecht CS dat optimaal ingericht is voor een combinatie van thuiswerken en kantoordagen

·      Een salaris en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden die je van een eigentijds bedrijf mag verwachten

 

Wat heb jij in huis?  

·      Je bent analytisch en houdt van het oplossen van complexe vraagstukken

·      Je herkent je in meerdere van de volgende competenties en vaardigheden: can-do mentaliteit, analytisch, communicatief, flexibel/tactisch schakelen, initiatief nemen, innovatie, klantgericht, plannen en organiseren, resultaatgericht, nauwkeurig, samenwerken en stressbestendig

·      Je hebt een HBO- of WO-opleiding in een analytisch vakgebied, zoals econometrie of data science

·      Je hebt ervaring met Python, SQL en natuurlijk Excel. Kennis van het werken met Azure, OpenAI en/of Power BI is een pre.

·      Je bent net afgestudeerd of hebt tot 3 jaar werkervaring als Data Scientist 

·      Je beheerst de Nederlands en Engels goed

·      Je bent minimaal 32 uur beschikbaar




Geïnteresseerd? Wij ook in jou!

Stuur je motivatie en je cv naar floor.vergunst@marketresponse.nl. Je mag natuurlijk altijd eerst even bellen (033–330 33 33) als je meer wilt weten.

Tot slot, we hechten waarde aan diversiteit. We verwelkomen graag ook kandidaten die voor ons nieuwe perspectieven met zich meebrengen.

Show more
HTML:
Ben jij de nieuwe Data Scientist die wij zoeken?  

Als Junior Data Scientist speel je een centrale rol binnen het team dat verantwoordelijk is voor het verkrijgen van waardevolle inzichten uit complexe datasets om strategische beslissingen te ondersteunen. Jouw analytische en statistische expertise, samen met je programmeervaardigheden, worden ingezet om voorspellende modellen te ontwikkelen, patronen te ontdekken en bruikbare aanbevelingen te doen die bijdragen aan en het succes van onze klanten bevorderen.


Werken bij MarketResponse is werken in een inspirerende en dynamische omgeving. Nieuwe mensen zijn bij ons altijd meer dan welkom, ze brengen nieuwe inzichten en ervaringen mee en helpen ons daarmee vooruit. De werksfeer is informeel. Naast hard werken staan een fijne samenwerking en plezier hebben centraal. Wij zijn ervan overtuigd dat mensen die zich prettig voelen, beter presteren. Onze werkplekken vind je in de Urban Hub Creative Valley, direct aan het Stationsplein van Utrecht Centraal Station. Met Hoog Catharijne en de binnenstad op loopafstand is er ook tussen de bedrijven door genoeg te beleven.


Wat ga je doen?  

·      Je werkt samen met het team om relevante databronnen te ontsluiten, te prepareren en te analyseren. Je maakt hiervoor gebruikt van tools zoals Python, SQL en Excel.

·      Je gaat verkennende gegevensanalyses uitvoeren om trends, patronen en outliers te identificeren.

·      Je ontwikkelt voorspellende modellen en past supervised en unsupervised machine learning technieken toe. Modeltraining, validatie en verfijning implementeren om optimale prestaties te bereiken vind je leuk om te doen.

·      Je vertaalt bevindingen uit complexe analyses naar duidelijke en bruikbare inzichten. Je helpt bij het creëren van visuele representaties van data, zodat de bevindingen gemakkelijk te begrijpen zijn voor de rest van het team en voor klanten.

·      Je werkt nauw samen in cross-functionele teams om de data-gedreven strategieën van onze klanten te verbeteren en hen te helpen bij het nemen van datagestuurde beslissingen.

·      Je vindt het van nature leuk om op de hoogte blijven van opkomende trends en ontwikkelingen op het gebied van data science en AI.

·      Je hebt een brede interesse die goed aansluit bij onze relatief kleine organisatie, waarin je een afwisselende rol hebt met de mogelijkheid om je op meerdere gebieden te ontwikkelen.

·      Het verbeteren van je skills om jezelf te blijven ontwikkelen en het bijdragen aan kennisdeling binnen het team is iets waar je continue mee bezig bent.

 

Ons aanbod

·      Een inspirerende en dynamische werkomgeving waar je veel kunt leren en jezelf kunt ontwikkelen

·      Veel ruimte voor eigen initiatief en inbreng terwijl je werkt voor aansprekende merken en organisaties

·      Een kantoor midden in het bruisend stationsgebied van Utrecht CS dat optimaal ingericht is voor een combinatie van thuiswerken en kantoordagen

·      Een salaris en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden die je van een eigentijds bedrijf mag verwachten

 

Wat heb jij in huis?  

·      Je bent analytisch en houdt van het oplossen van complexe vraagstukken

·      Je herkent je in meerdere van de volgende competenties en vaardigheden: can-do mentaliteit, analytisch, communicatief, flexibel/tactisch schakelen, initiatief nemen, innovatie, klantgericht, plannen en organiseren, resultaatgericht, nauwkeurig, samenwerken en stressbestendig

·      Je hebt een HBO- of WO-opleiding in een analytisch vakgebied, zoals econometrie of data science

·      Je hebt ervaring met Python, SQL en natuurlijk Excel. Kennis van het werken met Azure, OpenAI en/of Power BI is een pre.

·      Je bent net afgestudeerd of hebt tot 3 jaar werkervaring als Data Scientist 

·      Je beheerst de Nederlands en Engels goed

·      Je bent minimaal 32 uur beschikbaar


Geïnteresseerd? Wij ook in jou!

Stuur je motivatie en je cv naar floor.vergunst@marketresponse.nl. Je mag natuurlijk altijd eerst even bellen (033–330 33 33) als je meer wilt weten.

Tot slot, we hechten waarde aan diversiteit. We verwelkomen graag ook kandidaten die voor ons nieuwe perspectieven met zich meebrengen.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a Machine Learning Engineer who thrives on designing and deploying scalable ML solutions?




This is your opportunity to join an innovative organization where your expertise will drive data-driven decision-making and business success! You’ll work with cutting-edge technologies, build robust ML pipelines, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to transform data into actionable insights.







What You’ll Be Doing:




Developing and maintaining data pipelines using Python and tools like Apache Airflow and Kafka.
Building, training, and deploying machine learning models for production environments.
Conducting software testing and ensuring the reliability of ML solutions.
Managing relational and NoSQL databases for efficient data storage and querying.
Implementing CI/CD pipelines and using Docker/Kubernetes for deployment.
Utilizing cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud) for infrastructure management.
Documenting workflows and best practices for data engineering and ML processes.




Essential Skills:




✅ 5+ years of experience in data engineering and machine learning roles

✅ Strong proficiency in Python

✅ Experience with Pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Airflow, and Kafka

✅ Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

✅ Strong understanding of Agile, Scrum, and DevOps methodologies

✅ Experience with CI/CD pipeline management and Docker/Kubernetes




Bonus Skills:




Knowledge of simulations, optimization algorithms
Knowledge of real-time data streaming.







Flexible working: Hybrid setup – 2 days in-office, the rest remote!




Work on high-impact ML projects with real-world applications.




Don’t miss this opportunity! Apply now to be at the forefront of AI & ML innovation.

Title: Data Scientist – LLMs, Vector Search & Semantic Retrieval
Description:
Help structure the data brain of legal AI. As our Data Scientist, you’ll design search pipelines, classification models and context-aware retrieval systems that power intelligent legal workflows.




About Zeno

Zeno is a legal AI startup building the next generation of intelligent software for legal professionals. The legal world runs on documents, context, and nuance — and we’re building AI tools that deeply understand that. Our end-to-end platform combines advanced language models, retrieval systems, and document intelligence to support the full legal workflow: from research and drafting to bulk contract review.




We’re not just building features — we’re rethinking how legal knowledge work is done. Our clients include top-tier law firms (50+ FTE), and we’ve secured €2M in funding. Everything we build is hosted securely in Europe, fully ISO 27001 certified.




What makes us unique is our approach: no shallow AI integrations, but agentic systems designed for real-world performance and legal-grade reliability. Everything is built in-house by a small team of highly technical founders (backgrounds in AI, theoretical physics, infra), based in Rotterdam.

You’ll join us at a pivotal moment. The foundation is there, the traction is real, and we’re scaling. As engineer #5 or #6, you’ll shape what Zeno becomes — in data models, retrieval pipelines, and product intelligence.




Design the data systems that make AI actually useful in legal practice

Zeno’s platform depends on clean, structured, and context-rich data to deliver meaningful results. As our Data Scientist, you’ll build the pipelines, retrieval models and semantic layers that allow our AI agents to understand and reason over legal content. From intelligent search to document classification, your work makes the product smarter — and lawyers faster.

This role combines deep NLP and search thinking with hands-on model design and deployment — perfect for engineers who want to shape the intelligence layer of an AI-first platform.




What you’ll do

Structure, clean and prepare legal datasets for NLP/LLM pipelines
Improve hybrid and vector-based retrieval systems for legal search
Train and evaluate models for summarization, classification and context analysis
Build and maintain internal data tools for evaluation and tuning
Collaborate with backend and AI engineers to ship models into production
Contribute to the reasoning layer of our AI agents and document flows




What we’re looking for

3+ years experience with data science and NLP in Python (e.g. spaCy, Hugging Face)
Experience with semantic/vector search and tools like FAISS or Pinecone
Understanding of data structures, model evaluation and search ranking
Familiarity with hybrid retrieval (BM25 + vectors) or retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Bonus: Langchain, Elasticsearch, GraphDB, or prior work in legal/enterprise data




What we offer:

A unique opportunity to work at a startup that is shaping the future of legal tech
An inspiring place to work in an office located at the heart of Rotterdam
Collaboration with a top-tier team of engineers, researchers, and entrepreneurs
Competitive compensation, including growth and equity opportunities within the company




Recruitment process via Haystack People

Zeno works exclusively with Haystack People to fill these key roles. Haystack helps us connect with engineers who can build exceptional systems and thrive in a culture of autonomy, focus, and momentum. You’ll be supported throughout the process — from first intro to final offer — by an experienced consultant who understands both the role and the team behind it. Interested or have questions? Contact s.jouseiph@haystackpeople.nl




Keywords: Python, FastAPI, REST APIs, LLMs, AI Agents, Langchain, Vector Search, GraphDB, Postgres, Backend Architecture

Title: Data Scientist Forecaster, Eindhoven
Description:
Jij bent een echte data wizard met een passie voor forecasting! In onze snel groeiende organisatie help jij door middel van slimme voorspelalgoritmes ons energieverbruik en opwek te voorspellen. Jij bent onderzoekend ingesteld, maar kan details van hoofdzaak onderscheiden. Elke week bespreken we de forecasting resultaten en proberen we onze algoritmes samen met jou te verbeteren.




Wie zijn wij?




Hezelaer Energy is een vooruitstrevend energiebedrijf dat een leidende rol speelt in de energietransitie. Naast onze activiteit als innovatief energieleverancier, werken we aan het verslimmen van energiesystemen. Dat doen we door het integreren, automatiseren en optimaliseren van diverse energie assets, waaronder batterijen, zonnepanelen, windmolens en oplaadpunten voor elektrische voertuigen. We maximaliseren bovendien de waarde van de energieportfolio’s van onze klanten door zelfstandig handelstransacties uit te voeren. Zo dragen we bij aan een kostenefficiënt, energiezuinig en duurzaam energiesysteem.




Onze gezonde groeiambitie hebben we de afgelopen jaren waargemaakt dankzij voortdurende innovatie en actieve aanpassing aan de veranderende markt. Met een snel groeiend en enthousiast team bouwen we samen aan het energiebedrijf van de toekomst.


Taken



Je ontwikkelt mee aan het voorspelalgoritme voor ons e-programma.


Je schrijft in nauwe samenwerking met het team robuuste code om ervoor te zorgen dat het algoritme altijd blijft werk, ongeacht de omstandigheden.


Wekelijks zitten we samen om nieuwe verbetermogelijkheden te onderzoeken en toe te passen.


Jij hebt directe impact op de bedrijfsresultaten van Hezelaer.



Vereisten



Afgeronde technische WO opleiding zoals Econometrie, (Technische) Wiskunde of Natuurkunde.


Ervaring met time series forecasting.


Ervaring met programmeertalen zoals SQL, R en/of Python.


Werkervaring in de energiemarkt is een plus.


Bekend met GIT is een plus



Benefits



Samen kijken we welk groeipad bij je past en je krijgt volop kansen om te groeien en ontwikkelen. We bieden begeleiding op maat!


Naast een marktconform salaris, reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling is er een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling


Een creatieve, dynamische en informele bedrijfscultuur


Standplaats is ons nieuwe kantoor op Strijp-T in Eindhoven





Nieuwsgierig? We leren je graag kennen!

Title: Lead Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Your New Career

Are you a technical leader and outstanding expert in the field of AI? Are you looking for a new challenge in an exciting environment working on cutting-edge AI on petabytes of highvelocity sensor data? As technical lead of a highly motivated data science team you will work with interdisciplinary teams and push the boundary of AI in a fascinating industry having a wide range of demanding applications.




Your Responsibilities

In a technical leadership role, you will be further strengthening our sizeable and well-rounded Data Science team.

Drive hands-on the development of innovative and highly impactful AI products ensuring their successful market launch
Provide technical leadership, guidance and mentorship to a high-performing and highly impactful data science team fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.
Define and implement Deep Learning architectures and strategies creating synergies across data science projects aligned with AP Sensing’s business needs.
Stay ahead of emerging trends and best practices in data science, AI, and advanced analytics, introducing innovative ideas to the team.
Engage with engineering, product, domain experts and business to align with products and organizational goals.
Report to and co-ordinate with the Data Science Manager.




Your Profile

7+ years of hands-on experience in applied data science, with at least 2 years in a technical leadership role.
Proven track record of delivering impactful data science solutions in a business environment.
Outstanding ability in proactively developing high performing data science solutions in short time frames.
Strong Python programming skills and expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).​
Deep understanding of latest deep learning architectures and how to apply them on complex sensor data.
Hands-on mentality being deeply involved in all stages of the MLOps Lifecylce.
Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related field. A PhD is a plus.
Ability to present complex machine learning outcomes in simple narratives to non-technical stakeholders. English is must. German is a plus.




Our Company

WE ARE AGAIN AWARDED AS TOP ARBEITGEBER 2024!

At AP Sensing, we’re building on a success story that began in the garage of Bill Hewlett and Dave Packard. As an independent HP spin-off, we combine over 40 years of technological expertise with a passion for innovation.

Together we’ll continue to enhance infrastructure, protect people, and safeguard our planet. With a commitment to fiber optic sensing, we value every voice and empower growth. Join us in thinking ahead to create a smarter, safer world.




Our Offer

half-yearly bonus distribution
(depending on company performance)
annual salary increases
holiday bonus
christmas bonus
AP Sensing Card with 50 Euro credit per month
permanent employment contract with job security
company pension scheme
participation in the Corporate Benefits Program
meal subsidy for in-house canteen
free drinks and fresh fruit
job-bike offer
career opportunities due to steady, healthy company growth
flat hierarchies and very collegial relationship with managers
very positive and appreciative working atmosphere
international and intercultural team
flexible working hours and home office options
company laptop for everyone
ideal work-life balance
regular company and team events
employee training and education
new and fully equipped kitchen with high-tech coffee machine
kiosk in the building
large, bright and air-conditioned offices
modern office equipment with creative spaces
height-adjustable desks for ergonomic working
2 minutes to the S-Bahn and motorway
free parking spaces
sports facilities: weekly jogging group and fitness coach
showers available (for cyclists or "lunch break joggers")




Are you ready to play a BIG role in a small team instead of a SMALL role in a big team?

Then you are spot-on with us…




hr@apsensing.com

71034 Böblingen
