Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist, App and Content Team

Nine years after the launch, BookBeat has grown to more than 1 million paying users - and this is just the beginning of our journey! To continue delivering the best user experience and staying at the forefront of understanding and serving our users’ needs, we’re expanding our team with a talented Data Scientist.




Are you looking for an opportunity to work with a skilled team in a dynamic, fast-paced organisation? Do you thrive on using data to shape product development, enhance user experiences, and drive business growth? Then we might have the job for you!




About the Team

A BookBeat-user on average spends an incredible 24 hours per month in our app. Two key factors of the success are that the app experience is user-friendly and that books provided to the users are relevant and inspiring. To maintain and elevate this, our team works with data driven projects and provides actionable insights that guide both our app and content teams.




As part of our data analytics and science team, you’ll have a central role of our mission. Your work will directly support the development of the app and its content, ensuring that we continue to provide users with a world-class listening and reading experience.




Your Role

In your day to day work you’ll be working with a variety of tasks that all aim at understanding our users, make data driven decisions and help in making the app and its content as great as possible. Some tasks involved in the role include:

Designing and analyzing A/B tests to optimize new app features
Leveraging large-scale user data to generate insights and propose actionable improvements
Creating and sharing clear reports and visualizations to track and understand user behavior
Building and refining models to help our users discover their next favorite book




You’ll be involved in the entire lifecycle of a project, from defining business questions and analyzing data to presenting insights and driving actions. Strong communication skills are essential, as you’ll play a key role in fostering a data-driven culture across the organization.




We’re looking for someone that:

has at least 4 years experience working in an equivalent role in tech or similar industry
has an education within a quantitative field such as statistics, engineering, economy or similar
has a business perspective of things and a genuine interest in books and understanding our users
enjoy transforming data to actionable insights
take ownership of projects and enjoy seeing them through from start to finish
likes inventing new and helpful ways of visualizing data and might have experience within tools such as Power BI or similar
likes working cross functionally in a fast-moving organization
is skilled in tools like SQL and Python
understands Swedish and can communicate in English in both writing and speaking. Other language skills (e.g. German, Finnish, Polish, French, Dutch or Danish) are a bonus!




If you have any questions, please contact Hannah Wolfson, Head of People Operations, Hannah.wolfson@bookbeat.com.




As an employee of BookBeat AB, you can enjoy a benefit package that includes the following:

🌴 30 days of vacation each year

💰 ITP1 occupational pension

💌 Occupational group life insurance, work injury insurance & business travel insurance

🎾 Yearly wellness allowance

🤸‍♂️ Weekly wellness hour

💻 Working equipment (computer and phone) as well as phone subscription

🎧 BookBeat subscription




In addition to our benefits, we’ll also provide you with:

💜 A stable and sustainable work-life balance. We use flex time and work 37,9 hours a week

🏢 An office located in the heart of Stockholm

🏃‍♀️ … including access to a full gym complete with a sauna! We also arrange other fun wellness activities, such as our own running club

🏡 Flexibility in terms of e.g. flexible working hours and our hybrid work policy

🚀 The opportunity to grow in your role and career, including challenging & educational work tasks as well as opportunities for education

✨ Fun activities together with colleagues! At BookBeat you’ll enjoy weekly Friday afternoon mingles, monthly company breakfasts and other work events such as Holiday & summer parties, and frequent company wide events.

🧪 The opportunity to explore projects that you might not have time to do in your day-to-day work during Hack Days

🧠 Knowledge sharing opportunities, e.g. during our weekly Friday demo where different teams share what they’ve been or will be working on. Knowledge sharing is also an integral part of our everyday work

🐶 The opportunity to bring your furry dog friend to work (and cuddle with dogs at work)! We have recently introduced a dog room at our Stockholm office

🤛 (Last but definitely not least) A wonderful and skilled team and manager that will support you throughout your employment.




About us

In 2015, we began our journey towards the goal of offering Europe’s leading service for digital books and in 2016, we launched to the public. Now, about 9 years since our broad launch, BookBeat is used by over 900 000 users every month. We are an ever-growing company within the Bonnier Group and all members who join our journey have the possibility to make an impact on our development – both in the short and long run.

Today, Team BookBeat consists of 160 curious and committed doers. Are you interested in becoming part of our team? Wonderful! While our employees are experts at many different areas, we have four core values uniting all of us:




🚀 Be great at what you do

📣 Share what you know

🔎 Curiosity for our users and us

🤝 Build Team BookBeat




In other words: we want our employees to continuously deep dive into and develop within their area(s) of expertise, but also to share that knowledge with their colleagues – we’re all in this together and cooperate (most often a lot) on a daily basis! We’re also looking for employees who are genuinely curious about our users, journey and organization, a curiosity that drives us to always test out new things in our service and to let our users show us if we’re on the right track. Last but definitely not least we want all our employees to contribute to the everyday cooperations and the wellbeing of Team BookBeat – as already mentioned, we’re in this together and we want our team to be healthy and happy at work, and we all contribute to this in different ways.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist II - Client Platform
Description:
The Platform team creates the technology that enables Spotify to learn quickly and scale easily, enabling rapid growth in our users and our business around the globe. Spanning many disciplines, we work to make the business work; creating the frameworks, capabilities and tools needed to welcome a billion customers. Join us and help to amplify productivity, quality and innovation across Spotify.

We are an insights team supporting across the domains of Developer Experience, Client Platform and Core Infrastructure. As a member of the team, you’ll work closely with a cross functional team of data scientists, data engineers, user researchers, and product managers who are all passionate about creating scalable products for our developers and customers. Your focus will be in the Client Platform domain which strives to bring a great experience for client developers at Spotify, and through this deliver stable and reliable products for people to enjoy.

What You’ll Do


Work closely with cross-functional teams of skilled engineers, data scientists, user researchers, designers, and product managers who are all passionate about providing an outstanding product experience
Define metrics, build dashboards and create reports and key datasets to empower data-informed product development
Perform exploratory analysis to understand who our users are, how they get value out of our offering and where we can further develop our product to bring greater value
Communicate insights and recommendations to key partners, helping activate data best practices


Who You Are


You have a 4+ years work experience with an emphasis on programmatic data analysis, reporting, and visualization/ dashboarding with Tableau or similar BI solution
You have proven experience using coding skills such as Python, SQL and/or R to analyze complex data
You have experience or a strong interest in internal tooling and highly complex technical domains such as cloud infrastructure, continuous integration, observability, and software architecture.
You are curious and not afraid of exploring new domains; you enjoy partnering with others to define and develop new opportunities
You are able to communicate technical information clearly and concisely.


Where You´ll Be


This role is based in London or Stockholm.
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Turn complex data into smart, scalable solutions that fuel growth, optimize customer journeys, and deliver real impact for top-tier brands.




What we are looking for:

We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist to join our team and drive real impact for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels, such as online, email, and commerce, to analyze and model information that optimizes customer journeys and boosts digital performance. You’re someone who loves working with complex data, productionalizing systems, and econometric modeling to help brands grow and improve efficiency.




Your background in data science and statistics enables you to spot trends, devise strategies, and directly influence client success. In this role, you’ll design predictive models, develop algorithms, and deliver end-to-end solutions. You stay on top of evolving technologies like AI, always exploring new ways to push your work forward.




You’ll be joining a supportive environment where collaboration is key. While you bring solid experience, we’re committed to your ongoing professional growth in the ever-changing worlds of data science and digital marketing.




What you'll be doing:




Take e-commerce problems into solutions using statistical and ML models
Develop predictive models and machine learning solutions
Present findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Remain current with the latest data science and digital marketing trends




Qualifications:




Proven experience as a Data Scientist
Familiarity with commerce data
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Hands-on experience deploying and maintaining containerized production-grade ML workloads in production
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) in a deployment context
Fluent in Swedish and English, residing in Sweden




What sets you apart:




Documented experience in marketing mix modeling projects, causal inference, and Bayesian statistics.
Hands-on background in building multi-tenant AI and machine learning systems
Experience with predictive models in commerce.







This is a full-time position with a preferred start date during Q2, based in our office at Birger Jarlsgatan 7, Stockholm.

Show more

  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) in a deployment context
  • Fluent in Swedish and English, residing in Sweden


What sets you apart:


  • Documented experience in marketing mix modeling projects, causal inference, and Bayesian statistics.
  • Hands-on background in building multi-tenant AI and machine learning systems
  • Experience with predictive models in commerce.



This is a full-time position with a preferred start date during Q2, based in our office at Birger Jarlsgatan 7, Stockholm.

Title: Senior ML Engineer
Description:
Role: Machine Learning Engineer

Sector: SaaS / Applied AI / Legal Tech

Location: Sweden

Salary: We have purposely left this open as it varies on experience (rest assured we will not be wasting your time!)




The Opportunity




An established SaaS company operating within the legal tech space is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to play a key role in the evolution of their AI capabilities.




Having moved beyond their initial offering, the business is now focused on delivering AI-powered workflows to support professional users in high-stakes environments. The next chapter of their product journey involves integrating advanced natural language processing and large language model (LLM) technologies into their platform, enabling more intuitive, accurate, and scalable decision-making for users navigating complex information.




This is a rare opportunity to work on applied LLM challenges that demand both innovation and care, in a domain where reliability and long-term outcomes matter.




The Role




This is a hands-on, product-oriented engineering role. You'll be responsible for building, refining, and scaling ML features that sit at the core of a widely used platform. The work will require creativity, autonomy, and an understanding of how to translate ML capabilities into trusted user experiences.




Key areas of focus include structured interaction with unstructured documents, improving the accuracy of AI-generated insights, and helping internal teams balance innovation with domain risk.




What You’ll Be Doing




Developing and deploying machine learning solutions, particularly those that use LLMs for document understanding and user interaction.
Working cross-functionally with product, design, and engineering teams to integrate ML features that are robust, explainable, and valuable to end-users.
Exploring approaches such as retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), few-shot prompting, and domain-specific fine-tuning.
Iterating rapidly while ensuring quality and reliability in a high-trust domain.
Staying current with the evolving landscape of foundation models and bringing forward ideas that could elevate the platform.




Ideal Experience




Strong background in machine learning or NLP, ideally with experience working with LLMs or document-focused AI systems.
Demonstrated ability to move from prototype to production in a product-focused environment.
Fluency in modern ML tooling (e.g., PyTorch, Transformers, Vector DBs, etc.) and a practical grasp of ML ops principles.
Excellent communication skills able to navigate both technical discussions and product-level thinking.
Experience dealing with unstructured, domain-sensitive data (e.g., contracts, legal/financial/technical documents) is highly valued.
Familiarity with collaborative or workflow-based platforms is a bonus, though not essential.




Why This Role Stands Out




A rare chance to work on real-world LLM challenges with meaningful constraints and clear impact.
A mission-driven environment where trust, transparency, and accuracy are non-negotiable and deeply respected.
A product-focused culture that gives ML a seat at the strategy table, not just a bolt-on function.
Access to senior technical advisors and internal advocates who understand how to deliver complex AI features responsibly.




Process




The interview process is structured to ensure alignment and technical depth, with some flexibility around timelines due to availability:




Introductory discussion with the product team
Technical deep dive with the engineering lead
Extended session with members of the technical team




This is a long-term hire for someone looking to grow alongside a product and team that value substance over flash.

Show more

This is a long-term hire for someone looking to grow alongside a product and team that value substance over flash.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Vill du också göra världen lite bättre samtidigt som du får arbeta med den senaste teknikutvecklingen? Då är Sigma Industry Development rätt företag för dig.

Vi söker en erfaren Machine Learning Engineer som ska bygger avancerade AI-lösningar för bl.a. supply chain och demand forecasting. Uppdraget passar dig som vill kombinera data science, backendutveckling och MLOps .




Du kommer att:

Utveckla och produktionssätta maskininlärningsmodeller och ML-pipelines
Bygga robusta backendlösningar i Python, gärna med FastAPI
Arbeta nära verksamheten för att utveckla lösningar inom t.ex. supply chain och demand forecasting
Hantera stora mängder data (batch & stream) och säkra datakvalitet
Jobba med molntjänster, Google Cloud Platform med Vertex AI
Följa och implementera goda principer för DevOps, SRE och MLOps
Samarbeta tvärfunktionellt med utvecklare, data engineers och produktägare




Vi söker dig som har:

5+ års erfarenhet inom ML-engineering eller liknande roll
Erfarenhet och certifiering av GCP (Google Cloud Plattform)
Stark kodvana i moderna språk, särskilt Python (4+ år)
Erfarenhet av att bygga och skala ML-lösningar till produktion
God förståelse för AI/ML-tekniker och olika ramverk
Kunskap om SQL, DBT, och cloud storage-lösningar
Van att jobba med kravställning, designlösningar och teamkommunikation




Språkkunskaper

Svenska och engelska (i tal och skrift)




Om oss

Sigma Industry Development är ett teknik- och konsultbolag inom Sigmagruppen som hjälper både ledande svenska och internationella teknikföretag och innovativa och nytänkande start-ups och scale-ups. Vi verkar inom sektorer så som den gröna energisektorn, fordonsindustrin, transportindustrin, medtech, försvarsbranchen och hållbarhet.




Vår vision är att vara det ledande teknikkonsultbolaget och vår kultur präglas av familjär samhörighet där människan är i centrum. Med över 100 engagerade medarbetare är vi i en stark tillväxtfas. Vår kärnverksamhet ligger i konsultuppdrag ute hos kund, men vi har även ett in-house-team som arbetar uteslutande från kontoret. Precis som vårt namn antyder, är utveckling kärnan i allt vi gör och våra medarbetare engageras av att ta Sigma Industry Development till nästa nivå. Vår tillväxtresa fortsätter och vi behöver bli fler erfarna medarbetare inom projektledning!




Vi erbjuder

Vi är stora nog för att kunna erbjuda en bred kundbas och vi har ett gott rykte i branschen, samtidigt som vi är små nog att se dig som individ. För oss är gemenskap viktigt – här ska alla känna sig sedda och välkomna. Som en följd av detta har vi bland annat gemensamma sektionsaktiviteter, ett nätverk för kvinnor och icke-binära, ett mentorskapsprogam och utbildningar inom olika kompetensområden. Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla kan växa och utvecklas tillsammans. Vår ambition är att tillgodose konsultens önskemål gällande uppdragslängd, sektor och arbetsuppgifter. För oss är en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv en självklarhet och vi är stolta över att vara en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare. Givetvis har vi också kollektivavtal (via Almega).




Om Sigma Group

Sigma Industry Development AB (SID) är ett av sex dotterbolag som ingår i koncernen Sigma Industry East/North Group, vilka i sin tur ingår i Sigma Group (som ägs av familjekoncernen Danir AB). Läs mer om Sigma Industry Development HÄR och om Sigma Group på HÄR.

Utöver att vara del av ett företag som värnar om teknologisk utveckling, arbetar för en bättre miljö och som främjar jämställdhet, så är en viktig del av vår verksamhet socialt ansvarstagande. Mer information om detta hittar du HÄR.




Sista ansökningsdag

2025-04-22




Mer information:

Kristoffer Billqvist, Sektionschef

Sigma Industry Development, Stockholm, 070-810 20 82

kristoffer.billqvist@sigma.se

LinkedIn

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - User Journey
Description:
We in the Machine Learning product area in the Activation, Retention, Conversion studio are focused on building robust and scalable machine learning solutions that can personalize activation, retention and conversion funnels to improve important business metrics like SUBS and MAU. Through our messaging platform as well as other discovery & conversion surfaces, we communicate with users to connect them with valuable audio content and to help the business grow.

We are looking for a passionate Machine Learning Engineer to help us accomplish our mission: Optimize the user journey to drive retention by educating, re-activating, and fostering long-term engagement among free and premium users.

You’ll be working on a set of ML and Data initiatives focused on improving free and premium retention, including:


Premium churn prediction and mitigation
Personalisation of premium education surfaces promoting premium value
Payment failure grace period optimisation


What You'll Do


Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and refining Spotify’s product by hands-on ML development
Collaborate with a multi-functional agile team spanning user research, design, data science, product management, and engineering to build new product features that advance our mission to connect artists and fans in personalized and relevant ways
Prototype new approaches and productionize solutions at scale for our hundreds of millions of active users
Help drive optimisation, testing, and tooling to improve quality
Be part of an active group of machine learning practitioners in your mission and across Spotify


Who You Are


You have a strong background in machine learning, theory, and practice
You are comfortable explaining the intuition and assumptions behind ML concepts
You have hands-on experience implementing and maintaining production ML systems in Python, Scala, or similar languages
Experience with TensorFlow is also a plus
You are experienced with building data pipelines, and you are self-sufficient in getting the data you need to build and evaluate your models
You preferably have experience with cloud platforms like GCP or AWS
You care about agile software processes, data development, reliability, and focused experimentation
You have a desire to drive business impact


Where You'll Be


This role is based in London (UK) or Stockholm (Sweden).
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As a Machine Learning Engineer at Fortum, you will develop cutting-edge AI solutions and contribute to a clean energy future. This is your chance to be part of a dynamic team that is passionate about leveraging data to drive innovations in sustainable energy. You will work on new projects, utilizing advanced analytics to solve complex problems and optimize energy solutions. Your work will directly impact our mission to create a cleaner world, and you will play a key role in shaping the future of energy. Join us and be part of something bigger.

About The Role

At Fortum, we value creativity, collaboration, and the power of data-driven decision-making. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills in a supportive environment, with access to the latest tools and technologies. We offer competitive compensation packages, professional growth opportunities, and the satisfaction of knowing your efforts are contributing to a sustainable future for generations to come. If you are ready to make a difference and embrace the challenge of transforming the energy landscape, Fortum is the place for you. Join Fortum’s Data Science & Optimization team to play a key role in our digitalization and AI journey. Together with a multi-disciplinary team of designers, developers, data scientists and testers, you will work with rapid digital experimentation to prove technical feasibility and usability of new AI use cases.

Main responsibilities will include but not be limited to:



Design and implement AI and ML solutions in Fortum’s cloud environments (both Azure and AWS) that are robust, scalable, secure and cost-efficient
Design and automate stable MLOps pipelines with model re-training
Contribute to best practices development in AI solutions and MLOps
Communicate with diverse stakeholders and understand the business needs
Discuss and design interfaces with backend and frontend teams
Discuss requirements for storage and data maintenance protocols with DevOps, CloudOps, EA architecture and cybersecurity functions
Coach the team and be open to learn about the energy domain



The position can either be based in Sweden and Solna or Finland and Espoo.

About You

To thrive in this role, you should have an MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience. A strong background in Machine Learning and MLOps is essential, with at least three years of solid experience in software engineering using Python. You must also be proficient in statistics and data science, having spent a minimum of two years honing these skills. Experience working with cloud solutions, particularly Azure and/or AWS, for over two years is necessary. You should also have a keen interest in the latest AI developments.



Experience with GenAI, cloud AI services, and different solution concepts (e.g. RAG, model fine-tuning, prompt engineering).
Familiarity with GitHub Actions service deployment, containers and DevOps practices.
Excellent communication skills and interest to learn about the energy domain.
Full professional proficiency in written and oral English.



Preferred additional experience includes:



Data engineering; architecture development and deployment.
IT security, high availability, cybersecurity, maintenance and support.
Data storage and data maintenance methods.
Familiarity with message brokers and microservice architectures.
Basic knowledge of OCPP, MQTT, and IOT devices.
Experience in working in an Agile environment.



We offer you

At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.

More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.

Interested?

Please submit your application by 2025-04-29 at the latest. We will process the applications continually, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found, which may be before the last application deadline, so please apply as soon as possible.If you have any questions regarding the process or the position, please contact Kristofer Jakobsson, Head of Data Science & Optimization, kristofer.jakobson@fortum.com.

To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance, as well as a health examination which may include a drug test.

We are Fortum

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

Please submit your application by 2025-04-29 at the latest. We will process the applications continually, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found, which may be before the last application deadline, so please apply as soon as possible.If you have any questions regarding the process or the position, please contact Kristofer Jakobsson, Head of Data Science & Optimization, kristofer.jakobson@fortum.com.

To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance, as well as a health examination which may include a drug test.

We are Fortum

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

Title: Applied Ai Engineer
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

As the Applied AI Engineer, you will play an important role in unlocking the potential of Gen AI throughout our organisation. Your hands-on approach and focus on applying Gen AI to address real-world challenges will be key in driving innovation and efficiency. This role offers a platform for you to make a significant impact, with the freedom to execute on our Gen AI strategy, discover high-value applications, and take lead on technical implementation.

Role

Imagine building transformative solutions like implementing real-time actions based on rider feedback from the app or creating a diagnosis and repairs co-pilot for mechanics and in-field workers. These are just a glimpse of the exciting and impactful projects you will spearhead in this role, shaping the way we leverage AI technology. This will include:


Developing frameworks and tooling that make it easier for R&D teams to integrate Gen AI into products.
Designing and building pragmatic, production-ready Gen AI solutions for various business use cases.
Working with teams across the company to understand their challenges and apply AI where it creates real value.
Balancing innovation with practicality, ensuring we use the right AI tools for the job rather than chasing the latest trends.
Ensuring solutions are scalable, cost-efficient, and secure, following best practices for deploying AI in production.
Staying up to date with the rapidly evolving AI landscape and helping define our AI adoption strategy.


What You Need To Embark

To have the best possible start with us, we believe you have:


Software engineering background, ideally in backend or ML development and system integration.
Experience using Gen AI/LLM technologies in production (e.g., OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, vector databases, RAG, AI agents).
Curiosity and pragmatism – you focus on delivering value, not just exploring technology.
Experience building AI-powered applications that integrate with real-world systems.
Ability to work autonomously, define your own roadmap, and drive projects forward.
Strong collaboration skills – comfortable working with technical and non-technical teams alike.


WHY VOI?

Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voyage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To


Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
Lead the future product generations of our vehicles and push the company further towards our product vision and overarching mission of providing “safe, affordable and sustainable micromobility for everyone”
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.

Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med 2-5 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

Rollbeskrivning:

Bakgrund

Sedan maj 2024 så finns en enhet hos kund som sysslar specifikt med s.k. Anläggningsanalys: datadrivet arbete för att besvara förvaltnings- och underhållsfrågor. Enheten jobbar mot flera olika beställare, både inom och utanför kund. Leveranserna som enheten producerar utgörs exempelvis av sammanställd statistik, analysmaterial eller dataverktyg.

För att få den tänkta utvecklingstakten behövs resurser som både kan utföra analyser tillsammans med sakkunniga och öka tillgängligheten för data för verksamheten i stort. Här är enheten Anläggningsanalys och även du som konsult väldigt viktig genom drivandet av diverse utvecklingsprojekt för verksamheten.

Arbetsuppgifter


Arbete med kodning och dataframställning i Power BI DAX och SQL
Att skapa intuitiva och tydliga visualisering i Power BI som besvarar beställarens frågor
Att samla in, tolka och skapa verktyg genom dialog med olika intressenter av data i verksamheten
Att välja lämpliga statistiska eller ML-algoritmer för de byggda modellerna
Kodning i Python kan förekomma i vissa projekt
Kunna redogöra för begränsningar och val som gjorts i de datamodeller som skapas
Att noggrant dokumentera det arbete som gjorts


Arbete sker typiskt sett i små grupper om 2 - 3 personer som driver ett visst utvecklingsprojekt.

Målet för många utvecklingsprojekt är att skapa Power BI rapporter som skickas för produktionssättning i kundens system och därigenom göra det tillgängligt för många intressenter samt beställare samtidigt.

Obligatoriska krav

Utbildning:


Masterexamen från högskola/universitet (120 hp) inom data- och systemvetenskap. Alternativt en masterexamen (120 hp) inom matematik, elkraft eller energi med minst 30 hp inom data och programmering.


Kompetens och erfarenhet:


Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Power BI
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av SQL
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom projekt med dataanalys och datavisualisering
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att planera, leda och samordna framtagning av krav på system eller data för systemutveckling.


Mervärdeskrav


Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från energibranschen.
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbetsorderhantering, anläggningsförvaltning eller annan relevant erfarenhet av IFS eller UBW eller liknande affärssystem.
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av kodning i Python
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet med versionshantering


Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

Arbetsplats och kultur

Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.

Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Om tjänsten

Som AI Engineer kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att designa och utveckla AI-lösningar baserade på verksamhetens krav.

Du blir en del av Cloud Platform-teamet, som hanterar AI-lösningar främst i det publika molnet. Här kommer du att stötta och guida våra utvecklingsteam och verksamheten med din expertis inom AI. Teamet strävar efter ständig förbättring, och du kommer att ha stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.

Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:



Designa, utveckla och driftsätta gen-AI drivna applikationer och lösningar.
Samarbeta med olika intressenter för att förstå verksamhetens behov.
Stödja utvecklingsteam och verksamheten med AI-drivna lösningar.
Utveckla och upprätthålla AI-verktyg och infrastruktur.
Utvärdera effektiviteten av gen-AI drivna applikationer.
Hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste framstegen inom AI och maskininlärning.
Förklara komplexa tekniska idéer för icke-tekniska intressenter.


Vem vi sökerVi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:



Gedigen erfarenhet av arbete med Azure-tjänster, särskilt inom AI.
Gedigen kunskap om Generativ AI.
Stark programmeringsförmåga i språk som Python & .NET.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en DevOps-kultur och med verktyg som AzureDevOps och GitHub.
Högskoleutbildning inom datavetenskap, teknik, matematik eller motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
Goda kunskaper i svenska OCH engelska.


Det är meriterande om du även:



Är certifierad inom AI.
Har praktisk erfarenhet av AI Assistenter.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med vektordatabaser och retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).
Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med Azure AI Studio för utveckling av AI-lösningar.
Har erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt.


Vi erbjuder

Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i framkanten av AI-teknologi och vara en del av vår spännande resa mot att bli ett ännu mer datadrivet och AI-fokuserat företag. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där din expertis kommer att vara avgörande för vår framgång.

Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet till en intern karriär. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete mellan de nordiska länderna för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning.

Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!

Ansök nu och var med och forma framtiden för AI i vår organisation!

Övrigt

Urval sker löpande, så vi välkomnar din ansökan så snart som möjlig.

I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett opartiskt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Om du uppfyller grundkraven hos oss kommer du att få testerna skickade till dig och även mer information om dessa, men om du är nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer om dem hos Alva Labs .

Vill du veta mer om tjänsten kontakta Carlos Cederfeldt (carlos cederfeldt@nltg.com).

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernen Nordic Leisure Travel Group. I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Globetrotter, Ving Norge, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.

Vi är ett företag där vi har roligt och bryr oss om varandra med vårt people promise "it should be fun, developing and rewarding doing a good job".

Arbetsområde

IT

Roll: Technology Services

Platser: Stockholm

Distansarbete: Hybridarbete

Anställningsform: Heltid

Startdatum

Enligt överenskommelse

Kontaktperson: Carlos Cederfeldt (carlos.cederfeldt@nltg.com)

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
What we do

At Helicon, we build digital products that matter. As a digital product development & innovation agency specializing in cleantech, we partner with forward-thinking businesses to build breakthrough digital products, platforms, and capabilities that drive sustainability and efficiency.

Who we are

Our journey has taken us from developing one of Sweden’s largest virtual power plants by connecting over 15,000 buildings, to using AI to optimize energy, water, and resource management around the world. We have also helped launch award-winning cleantech startups and SaaS solutions for the energy sector.

But we don’t just measure success by the impact we have on our customers. We measure it by the real-world sustainability gains our solutions create. When our customers tell us that our solutions helped shut down a coal and oil power plant, integrate more renewables into their portfolio, or cut 36,000 tons of CO₂ emissions annually, we take immense pride in that.

What truly drives us is our passion for solving complex challenges together by combining strategy, design, engineering, and data science. At Helicon, speed, curiosity, collaboration, and continuous learning are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re passionate about technology and in using it to make a positive impact on our planet, you’ll fit right in with our team.

About the role

As a Data Science consultant, you are expected to have one or several assignments for our clients, be part of the Helicon team, and work closely with developers
Your main task will be to build and maintain machine learning models and pipelines for our clients
The focus will be models for time series forecasting, as part of a bigger system/application: build and test new models ranging from basic statistical models to cutting-edge deep learning models
Evaluate and maintain models throughout their life cycle
Be an integral part of the data science team, be a team player, and have a passion for building and sharing knowledge, especially knowledge that adds value to our clients

About you;

You are structured and self-going as a person and curious about the latest developments in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. You want to dig deeper into the field and apply the tools of data science to real client challenges. At the same time, you keep a strong business mindset while working to make sure we are always one step ahead.


What you’ll bring to the table;

Background from a quantitative field, such as Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering etc
+3 years of experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer, including expertise in Machine Learning and Deep Learning modeling
+3 years of experience working with the Python data science stack (Pandas, Dask Numpy, PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow, Pyspark/Spark)
Experience working with time series analysis and forecasting
Knowledge of, and experience with, building pipelines for machine-learning models
Experience with developing and maintaining machine learning models
Experience using different databases and/or building data engineering pipelines
Experience with developing infrastructure and/or applications, preferably in relation to machine learning (MLOps)
Based in Stockholm with a valid work permit
Able to work in a hybrid setup and fluent in Swedish and English

What we offer

At Helicon, you can expect to work alongside truly tech-passionate people every day. What we do has a big impact on building a more efficient future, which gives us pride in our work. We foster a culture of humble collaboration, where we are always eager to learn and innovate. We prioritize balance between your job and private life and regularly host social activities like hackathons, after-work gatherings, yearly conferences, shuffleboard comps, and more!

Application

Even if you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to apply, as our number one priority is to hire the right people instead of nitty-gritty tech.

Our recruitment process usually consists of a first interview, a technical step followed by a business and culture-focused interview.

Show more

What we do

At Helicon, we build digital products that matter. As a digital product development & innovation agency specializing in cleantech, we partner with forward-thinking businesses to build breakthrough digital products, platforms, and capabilities that drive sustainability and efficiency.

Who we are

Our journey has taken us from developing one of Sweden’s largest virtual power plants by connecting over 15,000 buildings, to using AI to optimize energy, water, and resource management around the world. We have also helped launch award-winning cleantech startups and SaaS solutions for the energy sector.

But we don’t just measure success by the impact we have on our customers. We measure it by the real-world sustainability gains our solutions create. When our customers tell us that our solutions helped shut down a coal and oil power plant, integrate more renewables into their portfolio, or cut 36,000 tons of CO₂ emissions annually, we take immense pride in that.

What truly drives us is our passion for solving complex challenges together by combining strategy, design, engineering, and data science.   • Be an integral part of the data science team, be a team player, and have a passion for building and sharing knowledge, especially knowledge that adds value to our clients

About you;

You are structured and self-going as a person and curious about the latest developments in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. You want to dig deeper into the field and apply the tools of data science to real client challenges. At the same time, you keep a strong business mindset while working to make sure we are always one step ahead.

What you’ll bring to the table;

    • Background from a quantitative field, such as Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering etc
    • +3 years of experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer, including expertise in Machine Learning and Deep Learning modeling
    • +3 years of experience working with the Python data science stack (Pandas, Dask Numpy, PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow, Pyspark/Spark)
    • Experience working with time series analysis and forecasting
    • Knowledge of, and experience with, building pipelines for machine-learning models
    • Experience with developing and maintaining machine learning models
    • Experience using different databases and/or building data engineering pipelines
    • Experience with developing infrastructure and/or applications, preferably in relation to machine learning (MLOps)
    • Based in Stockholm with a valid work permit
    • Able to work in a hybrid setup and fluent in Swedish and English

What we offer

At Helicon, you can expect to work alongside truly tech-passionate people every day. What we do has a big impact on building a more efficient future, which gives us pride in our work. We foster a culture of humble collaboration, where we are always eager to learn and innovate. We prioritize balance between your job and private life and regularly host social activities like hackathons, after-work gatherings, yearly conferences, shuffleboard comps, and more!

Application

Even if you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to apply, as our number one priority is to hire the right people instead of nitty-gritty tech.

Our recruitment process usually consists of a first interview, a technical step followed by a business and culture-focused interview.

Title: AI Developer – Machine Learning & Image Analysis
Description:
Company Description

Ecobloom is at the forefront of AI-driven agricultural innovation. We develop intelligent monitoring solutions for controlled-environment agriculture, empowering growers with real-time insights into crop health, climate conditions, and predictive analytics. Our flagship product, EcoSense, leverages AI, machine learning, and advanced data processing to optimize yields and resource efficiency.




As we scale our technology, we are looking for an AI Developer to join our team and help drive innovation in predictive modeling, data analysis, and image-based crop monitoring. If you have a passion for AI and sustainable agriculture, this role is for you!




Role & Responsibilities

As an AI Developer at Ecobloom, you will:




✅ Develop and optimize machine learning models for predictive analytics in controlled-environment agriculture.

✅ Work on image processing and computer vision models to analyze plant health, growth patterns, and environmental conditions.

✅ Design and implement scalable data pipelines for collecting and processing sensor data from greenhouses.

✅ Deploy and maintain AI models using cloud platforms and cloud-based infrastructure.

✅ Collaborate with our software and hardware teams to integrate AI solutions into our core platform.

✅ Stay updated on the latest advancements in AI and agritech, ensuring we leverage state-of-the-art techniques.




Qualifications & Skills

We are looking for someone with:




🔹 Strong proficiency in Python and experience with Django for backend development.

🔹 Extensive experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.

🔹 Hands-on experience with image analysis and computer vision (e.g., OpenCV, CNNs, segmentation models).

🔹 Solid knowledge of data science principles, predictive modeling, and time-series forecasting.

🔹 Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and cloud-based AI deployments.

🔹 Experience with database management (PostgreSQL, Firebase, or similar).

🔹 Bonus: Knowledge of IoT, sensor data processing, or reinforcement learning is a plus.




Why Join Ecobloom?




🌍 Impact: Work on cutting-edge AI solutions that improve sustainability in food production.

🚀 Innovation: Be part of a fast-growing company shaping the future of AI in agriculture.

🤝 Collaboration: Join a passionate and driven team working at the intersection of AI and agritech.

🏡 Flexibility: Hybrid/remote-friendly work culture.

Show more

Title: Online Data Scientist
Description:
Are you a data scientist with a passion for online optimization and insights? Then you should join our B2B Analytics, Martech & AI team, where you will play a key role in analyzing user behaviors, optimizing the digital customer journey, and supporting our stakeholders with actionable insights. You love to provide insights that improve the user experience and drive increased conversion.

My name is Åsa Boffardi, Head of Analytics, Martech & AI within Telia SE B2B. Our mission is to leverage cutting-edge digital technologies and advanced analytics to empower informed decision-making and world-class user experiences. We strive to drive innovation and deliver actionable insights, ensuring our organization remains at the forefront of analytics, Martech, and AI, committed to excellence and data-driven success.

Is this your new opportunity?

You will be responsible for using various statistical techniques and tools to analyze online and omnichannel data and identify patterns that can provide insights to drive decision-making mainly for the online teams. The work duties consist of but are not limited to:


Analyse our online sales flows and give clear actionable customer and channel insights, sales trends, projections, and growth opportunities
Use statistical techniques and tools to analyze data and identify patterns that can provide insights to drive decision-making
Collaborate in cross-functional teams to understand analysis needs and act on them.
Base your work on our measurement plan to ensure effective data collection with high quality and relevance.
Optimize online conversion and sales based on data-driven insights in combination with an omnichannel approach.
Ensure data collection to enable accurate analysis in Google Analytics.
Implement and manage tags in Google Tag Manager.
Stay updated with industry trends and practices in data science, digital analysis and measurement.


The position is based at our headquarters in Solna, in modern and pleasant premises near the Mall of Scandinavia.

Is this you?

The key component to succeed in this role is that you are a forceful changemaker. We want someone who lives to analyse, optimize and predict sales online. What is needed here is a proactive, communicative and deeply curious person.

You need in-depth knowledge in data science, digital analysis and a thourough understanding of measurement and data collection. You enjoy working both independently and in teams.

Your experience:


Skills in Looker Studio, Google Tag Manager, and Google Analytics or equivalent web analysis tools are needed
Skills in SQL/Python are needed, as well as worked with A/B testing
Skills in SAS and Qlik is a plus
At least 3 years of work experience in similar roles is a requirement
Performed high-quality digital analysis within sales, and creating understanding of customer behaviors
Ability to accurately assess the quality and relevance of measurement points and collected data
Excellent communications skills, and highly skilled in making data understandable and useable for our stakeholders
Develop and maintained dashboards and reports
Experience with Big Query and Optimizely is a big plus
A commitment to stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and evolving analytics methodologies.
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Finance or equivalent


Telia is more than a workplace!

With us you will learn from skilled colleagues across international borders, joining a team that makes each other stronger and the world better by solving challenges. We are proud of our friendly atmosphere where people are excited about their work. We thrive on our diversity and ambition to deliver great products and extraordinary experiences for our customers. In a world where choices are endless, if you want to make a real impact, this is a place where you belong. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we offer flexibility and a wide range of benefits.

Interested? Apply today!

If you find this position interesting and want to join our team, don’t hesitate to apply! If you want to know more about the job, you are welcome to contact Talent Partner Christine Wilén, christine.wilen@teliacompany.com.

We look forward to receiving your application and to making sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. During the process, required background controls will be performed.

Welcome to Telia – Join us and make better happen!

Title: DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT STOCKHOLM
Description:
Seeking candidates for a September start date.




FUNCTIONS:




You will be working in key projects for leading organizations in data mining & knowledge Discovery, predictive modeling, trend modeling, Simulation models (Monte Carlo), Review of credit rating and scoring models and quant support to the business and R&D projects.




REQUIREMENTS:

Recent graduates or final year students.
Should desirably have knowledge of modeling techniques (logit, GLM, time series, decision trees, random forests, clustering), statistical programming languages (SAS, R, Python, Matlab) and big data tools and platforms (Hadoop, Hive, etc.).
Solid academic record.
Strong computer skills.
Postgraduate studies and/or specialized courses are an asset, especially in Data Science, Quantitative Finance or similar.
Knowledge of other languages is desirable.
Get up and go attitude, maturity, responsibility and strong work ethic.
Strong ability to learn quickly.
Able to integrate easily into multidisciplinary teams.




We offer you the possibility to join a firm that provides all you need to develop your talent to the fullest:

Working in the highest-profile consulting projects in the industry,
for the largest companies, leaders of their respective markets,
alongside top industry management as they face challenges at the national and global level,
as part of an extraordinary team of professionals whose values and corporate culture are a benchmark for the industry




TRAINING:

Ongoing training plan, with approximately 10% of business turnover spent in training
Specialist knowledge courses, external expert courses, professional skills courses and language courses.
Last year our staff as a whole received over 330,000 hours of training spanning more than 150 courses.




CAREER PLAN:

Internal promotion based solely on merit.
Partnership-based management model offers all professionals the opportunity to become part of the Firm’s group of partners.




OTHER EXPERIENCES:

University: we maintain a close relationship with the world’s most prestigious universities
Social Action: we organize more than 30 community support activities.
Sports Club: internal and external tournaments.




At Management Solutions we believe in equal opportunities. In our selection process, all qualified applicants are equally considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, and any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Energy Management – ML Engineer
Description:
Om tjänsten

You will work as part of a team responsible for developing production ready solutions in control, steering and optimisation of flex assets; and in bringing these solutions to successful business implementation and customer operation.

In broad terms this position is responsible for core feature maintenance, monitoring and development of predictive algorithms, as well as data modelling, feature testing and performance evaluation, dashboard creations, data cleaning and insights generations.

Your primary responsibilities are to;


Maintain & develop architecture for processing data in Azure data pipelines via Azure Databricks; Develop models & versioning using ML.
Manage & deploy Azure Databricks inference notebooks and infrastructure for continuous retraining of machine learning models.
Maintain & backup Databricks workspace and associated Data Lake environment.
Second line support i.e. monitoring of forecast models and alarm/ dashboard development & integration into existing Platform Dashboards.
Report & manage workload via Azure DevOps environment.
Monitoring of operational costs, performance and computational requirements via Azure, to ensure a scalable and reliable system.


Din bakgrund

We are looking for an outstanding candidate to join our Energy Management team to secure our in-house competence as a Machine Learning Engineer. To suceed in this role a few years of relevant work experience are required.

Education;


Master of science degree in a quantitative field, e.g., applied engineering; computer science; data science (or similar).


Work experience;

Key techniques, methods & processes that you must be grounded in include;


Azure Cloud Services; Azure Functions; Azure DevOps
Data Engineering
Git
ML algorithms
MLOps
Python Programming


Experience and demonstrable knowledge in the following would be a benefit,


Electrical engineering, power electronics, power systems
Optimisation theory (especially linear programming) & applied methods
Azure Databricks Delta Lake with Spark; Unity Catalogue
Building Azure pipelines for automatic deployments
Creating Azure functions with APIs for callable endpoints.
Experience in creating installable Python packages
Automatic deployments of GIT repos to Azure Functions
OpenAPI specification & Swagger; FastAPI web framework
MongoDB


Meritorious;


Certified or Accredited professional qualifications
A portfolio of developer work


Language;

Fluent in English; proficiency in Swedish is considered a plus

Personal profile;


As a person you are analytical, inquisitive, committed and self-driven with proven communication and interpersonal skills; You take ownership and pride in successful customer implementation and support in first commercial operation; You innovate regarding new ways of working and in developing our technical frameworks.


Mer information

We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as ‘Ask and Share’ concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good-work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.

Location: Stockholm, Solna

For more information about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager Dag Wästlund Data Science & AI, +46 725 67 84 92. For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Johanna Kollander +46 70 220 92 88

Trade Union representatives in Sweden via Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.

Christer Gustafsson,ledarna, christer.gustafsson2@vattenfall.com,

Juha Siipilehto juha.siipilehto@vattenfall.com,

Christel Karlsson christel.karlsson@vattenfall.com.

We welcome your application in English no later than 27:th of april. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website and that you refrain from submitting a cover letter with your application. You apply quickly and easily by answering screening questions and attaching your CV.

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.

The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall.

Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Om oss

Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21 000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years.

Do you want to be a key player in taking Vattenfall forward in the emerging energy landscape?

The energy sector is undergoing revolutionary change. Digitalization and the Internet of Things opens business opportunities in new Flex solutions, such as integration of customer flex assets e.g., stationary batteries, EV charging infrastructure, facility heating, PV inverters; as well as interaction with assets on the distribution grid.

Using innovative solutions, Vattenfall R&D has group-wide responsibility for conducting business driven technical development that supports the company’s strategic focus areas.

We offer you a flexible work environment where you will have the freedom to be creative, work and develop in an exciting and rapidly changing technical field of strategic importance to the company.

Christel Karlsson christel.karlsson@vattenfall.com.

We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website and that you refrain from submitting a cover letter with your application. You apply quickly and easily by answering screening questions and attaching your CV.

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.

The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall.

Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Om oss

Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21 000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years.

Do you want to be a key player in taking Vattenfall forward in the emerging energy landscape?

The energy sector is undergoing revolutionary change. Digitalization and the Internet of Things opens business opportunities in new Flex solutions, such as integration of customer flex assets e.g., stationary batteries, EV charging infrastructure, facility heating, PV inverters; as well as interaction with assets on the distribution grid.

Using innovative solutions, Vattenfall R&D has group-wide responsibility for conducting business driven technical development that supports the company’s strategic focus areas.

We offer you a flexible work environment where you will have the freedom to be creative, work and develop in an exciting and rapidly changing technical field of strategic importance to the company.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer & Data Engineer
Description:
Drivs du av att arbeta med data och utveckla lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom machine learning och data engineering för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.

Din kompetens & profil

Machine Learning Engineer

Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller och som trivs med att analysera stora mängder data för att skapa insikter och affärsvärde.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:


Programmering: Stark kompetens inom Python, Java eller Scala.
ML-ramverk: Erfarenhet av verktyg som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn eller Keras.
Modellutveckling: Kompetens inom modellträning, optimering och hyperparameter-tuning.
Prediktiv modellering: Erfarenhet av regression, klassificering, klustring och djupinlärning.
Databehandling: Vana vid dataförbehandling och analys, gärna med verktyg som Pandas, NumPy och Dask.
Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av ML-pipelines på AWS SageMaker, Azure ML eller Google Cloud AI.
MLOps: Erfarenhet av CI/CD-principer för ML och verktyg som MLflow, Kubeflow, eller TensorFlow Extended (TFX).
Analytisk förmåga: Förmåga att tolka och kommunicera resultat till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter



Data Engineer

Vi söker även dig som är erfaren inom data engineering och kan bygga skalbara dataplattformar, pipelines och integrationer som möjliggör analys och avancerad datamodellering.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:


Programmering och scripting: Erfarenhet av Python, Java, Scala, eller SQL.
Dataplattformar och pipelines: Kunskap om verktyg som Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Airflow, eller DBT.
Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera dataflöden i molnmiljöer som AWS (Glue, Redshift), Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) eller Google Cloud (BigQuery, Dataflow).
Data Lakes och Data Warehouses: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataarkitektur och lagringslösningar för att hantera stora datamängder.
ETL/ELT-processer: Erfarenhet av att utveckla effektiva och robusta ETL/ELT-pipelines.
Big Data-ramverk: Kunskap inom hantering och bearbetning av stora datamängder med exempelvis Hadoop, Hive, eller Snowflake.
Versionshantering och samarbete: God förståelse för versionshantering i Git och vana att arbeta i agila team.
Data Governance och säkerhet: Förståelse för datahanteringsprinciper, GDPR och dataetik.



Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.

Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.

Om Amendo Tech

Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.

Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!

Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.

Frågor och kontakt

Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
B3 Link, som är en del av B3-koncernen, är bland annat unika genom vår expertis inom AI-tillämpningar och förmåga att leverera projekt till våra kunder. Vi kombinerar teknik och affärsbehov, och tar ansvar för hela projektcykeln – från business case till implementering av AI-lösningar.

Om rollen

Nu söker vi dig som har erfarenhet inom maskininlärning! Att vara anställd på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi ser gärna att du har vana att arbeta såväl självständigt som kundnära och är van vid ett agilt teambaserat arbetssätt.

Vi letar efter dig som har:


Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet inom maskininlärning eller liknande område
Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller
Gedigen erfarenhet inom minst ett programmeringsspråk (te.x. Python, Scala eller R)
Erfarenhet av SQL och databashantering
Erfarenhet av dataanalys- och visualiseringsverktyg så som Pandas, Matplotlib
Kunskap om maskininlärningsbibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
Behärskar god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Vad vi erbjuder:

Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på kompetensutveckling, där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:


Generös kompetensutveckling
Attraktiv lönemodell
En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning


Om B3

B3 Link är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!

Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Lidia, för denna tjänst på lidia.hagos@b3.se.
