Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Turn complex data into smart, scalable solutions that fuel growth, optimize customer journeys, and deliver real impact for top-tier brands.




What we are looking for:

We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist to join our team and drive real impact for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels, such as online, email, and commerce, to analyze and model information that optimizes customer journeys and boosts digital performance. You’re someone who loves working with complex data, productionalizing systems, and econometric modeling to help brands grow and improve efficiency.




Your background in data science and statistics enables you to spot trends, devise strategies, and directly influence client success. In this role, you’ll design predictive models, develop algorithms, and deliver end-to-end solutions. You stay on top of evolving technologies like AI, always exploring new ways to push your work forward.




You’ll be joining a supportive environment where collaboration is key. While you bring solid experience, we’re committed to your ongoing professional growth in the ever-changing worlds of data science and digital marketing.




What you'll be doing:




Take e-commerce problems into solutions using statistical and ML models
Develop predictive models and machine learning solutions
Present findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Remain current with the latest data science and digital marketing trends




Qualifications:




Proven experience as a Data Scientist
Familiarity with commerce data
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Hands-on experience deploying and maintaining containerized production-grade ML workloads in production
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) in a deployment context
Fluent in Swedish and English, residing in Sweden




What sets you apart:




Documented experience in marketing mix modeling projects, causal inference, and Bayesian statistics.
Hands-on background in building multi-tenant AI and machine learning systems
Experience with predictive models in commerce.







This is a full-time position with a preferred start date during Q2, based in our office at Birger Jarlsgatan 7, Stockholm.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer & Data Engineer
Description:
Drivs du av att arbeta med data och utveckla lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom machine learning och data engineering för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.

Din kompetens & profil

Machine Learning Engineer

Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller och som trivs med att analysera stora mängder data för att skapa insikter och affärsvärde.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:


Programmering: Stark kompetens inom Python, Java eller Scala.
ML-ramverk: Erfarenhet av verktyg som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn eller Keras.
Modellutveckling: Kompetens inom modellträning, optimering och hyperparameter-tuning.
Prediktiv modellering: Erfarenhet av regression, klassificering, klustring och djupinlärning.
Databehandling: Vana vid dataförbehandling och analys, gärna med verktyg som Pandas, NumPy och Dask.
Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av ML-pipelines på AWS SageMaker, Azure ML eller Google Cloud AI.
MLOps: Erfarenhet av CI/CD-principer för ML och verktyg som MLflow, Kubeflow, eller TensorFlow Extended (TFX).
Analytisk förmåga: Förmåga att tolka och kommunicera resultat till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter



Data Engineer

Vi söker även dig som är erfaren inom data engineering och kan bygga skalbara dataplattformar, pipelines och integrationer som möjliggör analys och avancerad datamodellering.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:


Programmering och scripting: Erfarenhet av Python, Java, Scala, eller SQL.
Dataplattformar och pipelines: Kunskap om verktyg som Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Airflow, eller DBT.
Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera dataflöden i molnmiljöer som AWS (Glue, Redshift), Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) eller Google Cloud (BigQuery, Dataflow).
Data Lakes och Data Warehouses: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataarkitektur och lagringslösningar för att hantera stora datamängder.
ETL/ELT-processer: Erfarenhet av att utveckla effektiva och robusta ETL/ELT-pipelines.
Big Data-ramverk: Kunskap inom hantering och bearbetning av stora datamängder med exempelvis Hadoop, Hive, eller Snowflake.
Versionshantering och samarbete: God förståelse för versionshantering i Git och vana att arbeta i agila team.
Data Governance och säkerhet: Förståelse för datahanteringsprinciper, GDPR och dataetik.



Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.

Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.

Om Amendo Tech

Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.

Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!

Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.

Frågor och kontakt

Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

#IT


Show more
HTML:
Drivs du av att arbeta med data och utveckla lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom machine learning och data engineering för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.

Din kompetens & profil

Machine Learning Engineer

Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller och som trivs med att analysera stora mängder data för att skapa insikter och affärsvärde.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:

  • Programmering: Stark kompetens inom Python, Java eller Scala.
  • ML-ramverk: Erfarenhet av verktyg som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn eller Keras.
  • Modellutveckling: Kompetens inom modellträning, optimering och hyperparameter-tuning.
  • Prediktiv modellering: Erfarenhet av regression, klassificering, klustring och djupinlärning.
  • Databehandling: Vana vid dataförbehandling och analys, gärna med verktyg som Pandas, NumPy och Dask.
  • Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av ML-pipelines på AWS SageMaker, Azure ML eller Google Cloud AI.
  • MLOps: Erfarenhet av CI/CD-principer för ML och verktyg som MLflow, Kubeflow, eller TensorFlow Extended (TFX).
  • Analytisk förmåga: Förmåga att tolka och kommunicera resultat till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter


Data Engineer

Vi söker även dig som är erfaren inom data engineering och kan bygga skalbara dataplattformar, pipelines och integrationer som möjliggör analys och avancerad datamodellering.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:

  • Programmering och scripting: Erfarenhet av Python, Java, Scala, eller SQL.
  • Dataplattformar och pipelines: Kunskap om verktyg som Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Airflow, eller DBT.
  • Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera dataflöden i molnmiljöer som AWS (Glue, Redshift), Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) eller Google Cloud (BigQuery, Dataflow).
  • Data Lakes och Data Warehouses: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataarkitektur och lagringslösningar för att hantera stora datamängder.
  • ETL/ELT-processer: Erfarenhet av att utveckla effektiva och robusta ETL/ELT-pipelines.
  • Big Data-ramverk: Kunskap inom hantering och bearbetning av stora datamängder med exempelvis Hadoop, Hive, eller Snowflake.
  • Versionshantering och samarbete: God förståelse för versionshantering i Git och vana att arbeta i agila team.
  • Data Governance och säkerhet: Förståelse för datahanteringsprinciper, GDPR och dataetik.


Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.

Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.

Om Amendo Tech

Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.

Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!

Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.

Frågor och kontakt

Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

#IT

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Craft:

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description:

Senior AI/ML Engineer – Operable Level Ecosystem

Job Description

Do you have a dynamic approach to solving Machine Learning problems at scale? Are you passionate about building machine learning (ML) tools for level designers? Do you believe machine learning (ML) can have a material impact on how we do business and want to be a part of the journey to help teams, company wide, enhance our players’ experiences? Then you could be our new, shiny, Senior AI/ML Engineer!

Your role within our Kingdom

You´ll be part of a team in Shared Tech Game Operations department. Working alongside Level Designers and Game Developers to develop and scale ML models that enhance level creation and optimization across multiple games. Our mission? To drive innovation in AI-powered level design, automate playtesting, and advance procedural content generation, enabling faster, smarter, and more engaging game experiences. As part of this, you will contribute empowering game teams with targeted AI-driven automation tools, real-time analytics, and workflow optimization to improve efficiency and enhance game design processes.

As a Senior AI/ML Engineer at King, you will be using the latest technologies to build ML products that empowers game design workflows across the company. With over 250+ million monthly active users and 50 billion events being uploaded daily, it’s key that you care about ML methodologies and latest ML advancements. You’ll be working with both tabular and non-tabular data, directly integrated in our products, in a highly ambitious technical environment.

Skills To Create Thrills

So, what about you? You are part of a Shared Tech Levels team, and you’re an advocate of data storytelling. You’re also passionate for building ML-powered features that accelerates the level creation and operations ecosystem. You also have experience in some of the following areas:


Statistical Analysis
Building data pipelines and ML pipelines
GCP data products (VertexAI, BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Dataflow, to name a few) or products from other cloud providers
Familiar with TensorFlow or PyTorch
ML model and ML product Monitoring
Software Engineering skills
Development in or exposure to environments/software products in Python
Able to showcase your ML work in small demos to validate feedback from our users (e.g. Streamlit, FastAPI, Jupyter notebook)
Collaborate closely with MLOps to ensure scalable, production-ready ML solutions—go beyond prototypes and build robust, maintainable models


Tasty Bonus Skills

Have any sweet experience with one or some of the following areas? Then we sure like to hear about them!


End-to-end integration of ML in a Product
Development in or exposure to environments/software products in Java
Contributions to open source projects
We know that you are into games on some level (casual, console, board-games, Uno etc.)


About King

With a mission of Making the World Playful, King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as Farm Heroes Saga. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king_games on X.

Title: Data Scientist / AI Expert
Description:
Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of generative AI and eager to work with cutting-edge technologies like Large Language Models (LLMs), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and multimodal data systems? Join our innovative team at ASSA ABLOY Entrance Systems and contribute to building intelligent, AI-powered solutions that make a real difference. Based in Stockholm, Sweden, this position offers an exciting opportunity to work hands-on with innovative tools and collaborate with cross-functional teams, all while growing your career in a dynamic and supportive environment. In this role, you'll thrive in a collaborative, innovative culture that empowers you to build a career to be proud of.

This is a 6-month position with the possibility to continue as a permanent employee.

What you will do as our Data Scientist / AI Expert

As a Data Scientist / AI Expert, you will Develop and optimize Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines using Python, integrating databases, APIs, and knowledge graphs into scalable AI systems.

You would also:


Work with multimodal datasets—including text, images, and relational data—embedding them effectively into advanced AI frameworks
Fine-tune Large Language Models (LLMs) for specific business tasks and domains using prompt engineering and performance evaluation techniques
Create and orchestrate intelligent AI agents to support advanced reasoning, decision-making, and strategic prompting
Implement and execute testing protocols to evaluate model effectiveness, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and contextual relevance
Stay up to date with advancements in generative AI, integrating new techniques to enhance business capabilities


The Skills And Experience You Need

We are looking for someone who:


Has 3+ years of hands-on experience in machine learning and AI, including experience acquired through relevant academic studies or a PhD
Has a solid experience in Python programming, with a strong understanding of software development and AI/ML technologies
Is proficient in Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture and fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs)
Is proficient in English, other languages are advantageous
Has a strong capabilities in building and deploying intelligent agents and managing AI workflows


The ideal candidate is a strong analytical thinker with a creative approach to solving complex AI challenges. They are adaptable, continuously learning and applying the latest AI techniques, and capable of balancing independent initiative with effective collaboration. Clear and confident in communication, they can present complex technical concepts to diverse audiences. Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS is a plus.

What We Offer

We are passionate about providing opportunities and benefits, so that you can continue a lifelong career with us. Here is what we have to offer:


Learning and career development opportunities, whether it is online learning, management training or enhancing your skills
A competitive salary
The opportunity to work with a great group of people in a dynamic and cooperative environment


We review applications regularly, so don't wait

We are building diverse and inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who can envision themselves working with us.

To ensure that your personal information is secure, we do not review any applications sent via email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, please send an email to Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.

Let's together create a safer and more open world!

To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.co

We are the ASSA ABLOY Group

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.

As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.

As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.


Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Analytics), Pricing
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About The Pricing & Incentives Domain

The Consumer Pricing & Incentives Data Science team is committed to consumer-first pricing that's fair, transparent, and compliant. We create innovative pricing & incentives solutions that offer clear value for our consumers with a focus on affordability. We collaborate cross-functionally to achieve both short-term and long-term business goals, balancing topline impact with bottom-line profitability tradeoff. Our team of Data Scientists and partners closely with the Strategy & Operations business team as well as Product & Engineering, conducting experiments, advanced analytical data exploration, and operational reporting to enhance our consumer pricing & incentives strategies.

About The Data Science Team At Wolt

Our Analytics teams comprise a cross-section of Data Scientists and Analytics Engineers. We work closely with the Data Engineering and Machine Learning teams who help ensure we have the right platform to deliver our insights at scale. We partner with Product, Engineering, and Strategy & Operations teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

About The Role

As a Senior Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using analytics to affect Pricing, we're looking for someone like you.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of experience in an analytics or data science position within an industry or research setting.
Expertise in customer segmentation, statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing and experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach
Nice to have: prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.


Notice to Applicants for Jobs Located in NYC or Remote Jobs Associated With Office in NYC Only

We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional process for jobs in NYC and certain features may qualify it as an AEDT in NYC. As part of the hiring and/or promotion process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate submitted applications. We began using Covey Scout for Inbound from August 21, 2023, through December 21, 2023, and resumed using Covey Scout for Inbound again on June 29, 2024.

The Covey tool has been reviewed by an independent auditor. Results of the audit may be viewed here: Covey

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: AI Solutions Engineer
Description:
Do you want to apply cutting-edge AI to improve medical imaging and patient outcomes? We’re seeking an AI Solutions Engineer to design and deploy AI systems that empower radiologists and healthcare providers worldwide. In this role, you’ll build and scale AI solutions for our global medical imaging platform, from prototyping to production, working alongside Commercial, Product, and Customer Success teams.







In this role, you will develop, implement, and optimize AI-powered systems for our global medical imaging platform and our customer facing functions. You’ll be responsible for creating end-to-end solutions - from proof-of-concept (POC) prototypes to production-ready applications - working closely with our Commercial, Customer Success, Integration and Product Engineering teams. The ideal candidate brings strong technical skills, an entrepreneurial mindset, and an understanding of B2B SaaS and Healthcare/Life Science workflows.




At Collective Minds, you’ll be part of a fast-moving, international team that is transforming how healthcare professionals work with cutting-edge tools that improve both efficiency and patient care. You’ll have the opportunity to build solutions that make a real impact in healthcare delivery globally. Are you ready to embark on this journey?




Responsibilies:

Partner with Product, Commercial, and Customer Success teams to integrate AI tools into clinical workflows and customer-facing processes
Design and develop AI-powered solutions for medical imaging applications, integrating LLMs, Agentic frameworks, computer vision, and traditional ML approaches
Build full-stack AI prototypes and production systems, including backend APIs, frontend interfaces, and data pipelines
Create and optimize data processing workflows for AI model training, fine-tuning, and evaluation
Develop high-throughput DICOM pipelines for ingesting, preprocessing, and analyzing medical
images
Apply MCP (Model Context Protocol) to improve AI model interoperability and performance
Research and prototype emerging AI/ML techniques (e.g., multimodal LLMs) to keep our platform at the forefront of innovation
Own end-to-end AI project execution, from scoping requirements to deployment in clinical environments
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for AI systems and processes
Continuously evaluate and improve AI model performance based on user feedback and metrics




Desired Skills And Qualifications:

BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent technical field
Strong Python programming skills and software development best practices
Experience with containerization technologies like Docker
Familiarity with Agentic frameworks, LLMs, prompt engineering, vector databases, and embedding technologies
Understanding of data processing pipelines and workflows
Ability to build end-to-end AI solutions, from concept to production
Demonstrated experience with full-stack development (frontend, backend, data integration)
Knowledge of AI ethics principles, particularly in healthcare applications
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills for explaining technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Self-motivated with ability to work independently and as part of a team
Ability to drive all work in English




Extra points:

DICOM expertise and medical data standards (e.g., HL7,FHIR)
Healthcare compliance knowledge (HIPAA, GDPR,GxP)
UI/UX design for clinical tools
Radiology / Medical imaging hands on experience
Startup/scrappy prototyping mindset
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to apply cutting-edge AI to improve medical imaging and patient outcomes? We’re seeking an AI Solutions Engineer to design and deploy AI systems that empower radiologists and healthcare providers worldwide. In this role, you’ll build and scale AI solutions for our global medical imaging platform, from prototyping to production, working alongside Commercial, Product, and Customer Success teams.



In this role, you will develop, implement, and optimize AI-powered systems for our global medical imaging platform and our customer facing functions. You’ll be responsible for creating end-to-end solutions - from proof-of-concept (POC) prototypes to production-ready applications - working closely with our Commercial, Customer Success, Integration and Product Engineering teams. The ideal candidate brings strong technical skills, an entrepreneurial mindset, and an understanding of B2B SaaS and Healthcare/Life Science workflows.


At Collective Minds, you’ll be part of a fast-moving, international team that is transforming how healthcare professionals work with cutting-edge tools that improve both efficiency and patient care. You’ll have the opportunity to build solutions that make a real impact in healthcare delivery globally. Are you ready to embark on this journey?


Responsibilies:

  • Partner with Product, Commercial, and Customer Success teams to integrate AI tools into clinical workflows and customer-facing processes
  • Design and develop AI-powered solutions for medical imaging applications, integrating LLMs, Agentic frameworks, computer vision, and traditional ML approaches
  • Build full-stack AI prototypes and production systems, including backend APIs, frontend interfaces, and data pipelines
  • Create and optimize data processing workflows for AI model training, fine-tuning, and evaluation
  • Develop high-throughput DICOM pipelines for ingesting, preprocessing, and analyzing medical
  • images
  • Apply MCP (Model Context Protocol) to improve AI model interoperability and performance
  • Research and prototype emerging AI/ML techniques (e.g., multimodal LLMs) to keep our platform at the forefront of innovation
  • Own end-to-end AI project execution, from scoping requirements to deployment in clinical environments
  • Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for AI systems and processes
  • Continuously evaluate and improve AI model performance based on user feedback and metrics


Desired Skills And Qualifications:

  • BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent technical field
  • Strong Python programming skills and software development best practices
  • Experience with containerization technologies like Docker
  • Familiarity with Agentic frameworks, LLMs, prompt engineering, vector databases, and embedding technologies
  • Understanding of data processing pipelines and workflows
  • Ability to build end-to-end AI solutions, from concept to production
  • Demonstrated experience with full-stack development (frontend, backend, data integration)
  • Knowledge of AI ethics principles, particularly in healthcare applications
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills for explaining technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
  • Self-motivated with ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to drive all work in English


Extra points:

  • DICOM expertise and medical data standards (e.g., HL7,FHIR)
  • Healthcare compliance knowledge (HIPAA, GDPR,GxP)
  • UI/UX design for clinical tools
  • Radiology / Medical imaging hands on experience
  • Startup/scrappy prototyping mindset

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist, Consumer, Core Experience
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About Consumer Analytics At Wolt

As the name Consumer Analytics implies, this team aims to provide reliable data insights that drive informed decision-making, empower Wolt's product organization, and foster a data-driven culture through collaboration and education, ultimately inspiring teams and building value for the Consumer group.

About The Core Experience Team

Core Consumer Experience Analytics team takes care of the core customer journey at Wolt from opening the app to placing the order, including all of the steps in between: browsing, search, in-venue experience, cart and checkout. Data Scientists in this team collaborate closely with product teams, supporting decision-making with insights and experimentation.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using analytics to affect the customer journey at Wolt, we're looking for someone like you!

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 3 years of experience in a Data Analyst or Data Scientist position.
Experience working with product funnels and user journeys.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing (A/B testing), and experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.


Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com) or Jaksa Marojevic (jaksa.marojevic@external.wotl.com)

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
Show more

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: AI Engineer
Company: BTR Group🟣 EOR, PEO & Accounting in the Nordics
Description:
What We’re Looking For


3–6 years of experience in machine learning, with hands-on experience in time-series analysis, signal processing, or physiological data (audio, wearables, etc.).
Solid understanding of statistics and the ability to validate and tune models using real-world, often noisy data.
Strong Python skills and experience with NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Experience working with biometric, medical, or audio data is a big plus.
Familiarity with GCP or cloud-based ML workflows (Vertex AI, BigQuery, etc.) is nice to have.
Bonus: Knowledge of sleep science, DSP, or personalization systems.
Strong communication skills — you’ll be working across domains with product and audio experts.


What You’ll Do


Design and implement machine learning models to detect and predict sleep states (REM, NREM, awake) and biometric signals (like breathing rate) from audio or sensor data.
Work with time-series data, including signal preprocessing, noise suppression, and real-time analysis.
Collaborate closely with the CTO (ex-Microsoft ML lead) and a multidisciplinary team to shape the product's intelligence layer.
Translate scientific insights into production-ready pipelines that personalize audio feedback in real time.
Contribute to research and experimentation with adaptive audio response systems.
Help shape a strong engineering culture that balances technical excellence with user empathy.
Show more
HTML:
What We’re Looking For

  • 3–6 years of experience in machine learning, with hands-on experience in time-series analysis, signal processing, or physiological data (audio, wearables, etc.).
  • Solid understanding of statistics and the ability to validate and tune models using real-world, often noisy data.
  • Strong Python skills and experience with NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch or TensorFlow.
  • Experience working with biometric, medical, or audio data is a big plus.
  • Familiarity with GCP or cloud-based ML workflows (Vertex AI, BigQuery, etc.) is nice to have.
  • Bonus: Knowledge of sleep science, DSP, or personalization systems.
  • Strong communication skills — you’ll be working across domains with product and audio experts.

What You’ll Do

  • Design and implement machine learning models to detect and predict sleep states (REM, NREM, awake) and biometric signals (like breathing rate) from audio or sensor data.
  • Work with time-series data, including signal preprocessing, noise suppression, and real-time analysis.
  • Collaborate closely with the CTO (ex-Microsoft ML lead) and a multidisciplinary team to shape the product's intelligence layer.
  • Translate scientific insights into production-ready pipelines that personalize audio feedback in real time.
  • Contribute to research and experimentation with adaptive audio response systems.
  • Help shape a strong engineering culture that balances technical excellence with user empathy.

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Description:
🚀 Ready to Redefine the Future of Investing?




Want to be part of building the future of market trading for everyone? Where AI guides you from novice trader to expert $$$ maker!




We're on a mission to transform how people make financial decisions—by building an AI-native investment platform that makes sophisticated investing accessible to everyone.

Our product combines real-time data, machine learning, and intuitive design to let users invest with confidence—whether they're beginners or pros. We're creating the kind of financial product we’d want to use ourselves: smart, seamless, and empowering.

To bring this vision to life, we’re looking for a Senior AI Engineer to join our small but mighty team of engineers, data scientists, and designers.




The Opportunity 🌍




As a Senior AI Engineer, you’ll play a foundational role in building the infrastructure that powers our AI-driven investment insights. From designing robust APIs to ensuring lightning-fast data pipelines, your work will touch every corner of the platform.

You’ll work side-by-side with a high-caliber team, where your code ships fast, your voice shapes the roadmap, and your ideas have real impact.




What You’ll Do 🎯




Design and build scalable APIs and microservices (we use FastAPI) that support real-time investment analytics
Develop secure and performant data pipelines to power AI-driven insights
Ensure the stability, scalability, and security of our cloud infrastructure (hosted on GCP)
Work closely with frontend engineers and product stakeholders to deliver delightful user experiences
Contribute to key architectural decisions and help define backend best practices
Bring new tools, ideas, and energy to the table—we’re building this together




Who You Are 💡




You're not just an experienced engineer—you’re a creative problem-solver who’s excited to shape the future of fintech.




We’re looking for someone who:




Has 3 years of AI engineering experience
Is passionate about AI, investing, or both
Has hands-on experience deploying ML models and building AI-first platforms
Thrives in a fast-paced startup environment
Communicates clearly, collaborates effortlessly, and loves a good challenge
Wants ownership, autonomy, and a voice in the product




Your Tech Toolkit 🧰




Python (FastAPI), and cloud platforms (preferably GCP)
Deep experience with databases (PostgreSQL, advanced SQL, data modeling)
Familiar with large language models (LLMs), prompt engineering, and evaluation techniques
Comfortable working with AI agent frameworks, orchestration tools, and MLOps workflows
Docker and containerized environments
A plus: Familiarity with real-time data systems or financial APIs




What You’ll Get 🏆




A key role in a tight-knit team solving meaningful problems with cutting-edge tech
The chance to build the foundation of a next-gen fintech product
True ownership and influence on both the product and the tech stack
A hybrid work setup: 2–3 days/week in our Stockholm HQ
A fast-moving environment where learning is constant and impact is real
Competitive salary, equity, and benefits package




Why Join Us? 🤝




We're not here to build “just another app.” We're building something bold: a smarter, fairer, more empowering way for people to take control of their financial futures.




If you're excited about AI, investing, and solving hard problems with a world-class team—we want to hear from you!

Show more

Title: ML Tech Lead
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description


Lead technical planning and execution of ML engineering work, ensuring models and


systems are delivered reliably and at scale.


Translate data science outputs into production-grade machine learning pipelines using


Python and AWS.


Collaborate closely with the Lead Data Scientist to ensure handoff from modeling to


deployment is smooth and robust.


Design and maintain ML infrastructure using AWS SageMaker, S3, Lambda, Step


Functions, etc.


Define and own technical architecture for model deployment, monitoring, and retraining


workflows.


Manage technical sprint planning, task assignment, and capacity planning for the ML


engineering team.

Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


5+ years of experience in ML development, with at least 1-2 years in a leadership or


planning role.


Proven experience with Python, including common ML libraries (e.g., scikit-learn,


pandas, PyTorch/TensorFlow).


Experience planning, assigning, and following up work using Linear (or similar tools like


Jira), with a structured approach to sprint planning and progress tracking.


Experience managing backlogs, sprint planning, and resource allocation for technical


teams.


Strong knowledge of AWS services, especially SageMaker, S3, Lambda, and Step


Functions.


Experience in building, deploying, and maintaining ML models in production


environments.


Comfortable working with CI/CD pipelines, version control (Git), and containerized


environments (e.g., Docker).


Strong communication skills and ability to align cross-functional teams.


Application deadline: 23-04-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.
Show more

Title: AI Developer – Stockholm
Description:
Vi har nyligen startat en systemutvecklingsenhet i Sverige med ett starkt fokus på data och AI, där vi önskar växa med ett gäng framåtlutade AI Developers.

AI Developer – Bygg AI-lösningar som skapar värde!

Hos oss kommer du ta en ledande roll i vår resa att skapa framtidens tekniska lösningar där möjliggörande av data och införandet av AI kommer spela en central roll. 

Så här säger Rebecca Hammel, Head of Software Development, om visionen för enheten: 

”Jag är oerhört entusiastisk över att få leda detta nya team och bidra till Solitas fortsatta tillväxt. Vi skapar en miljö där Software Designers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists och slutanvändare arbetar nära tillsammans för att snabbt leverera affärsvärde med hjälp av den senaste tekniken inom Cloud och AI”. 

Vad rollen innebär

I denna nya roll som AI Developer får du arbeta nära affärs- och teknikteam för att utveckla AI-lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att fatta smartare beslut och automatisera processer på ett intelligent sätt. Du får en unik möjlighet att delta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från idé till produktionssättning – där du inte bara bygger AI-lösningar utan även bidrar med kreativa idéer och strategier för att optimera deras effekt. Vi arbetar agnostiskt när det gäller teknikstackar men förväntar oss att du är bekväm med moderna ramverk och plattformar lämpliga för AI-tjänster. Erfarenhet av att sätta AI-lösningar som RAGs eller Agenter i produktion samt kunskap kring etisk AI är en central del av rollen. Du kommer att ha stor frihet att forma både teknikval och arkitektur för att möta affärsbehov och du kommer arbeta nära Data/AI Engineers/Scientists för att utveckla de bästa AI-lösningarna.

Vad vi erbjuder


Meningsfulla projekt: Utveckla AI-lösningar som gör verklig skillnad för våra kunder inom en rad olika branscher.
Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete – läs mer från vår blogg.
Ständig utveckling: Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling för att säkerställa att våra utvecklare ligger längst fram i teknikutvecklingen.
Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med några av de främsta experterna inom AI och data och öppna dörren till nya arbetssätt som CollabAI.
Bra villkor och sociala aktiviteter! Generösa förmåner som konkurrenskraftig fast lön, pension, 30 semesterdagar och mycket mer samt ett öppet och inkluderande arbetsklimat där vi värnar om både din personliga och professionella utveckling.



Förmågor och erfarenheter för att lyckas i rollen


Bred kunskap gällande AI & maskininlärning i allmänhet och GenAI i synnerhet.
God förståelse för RAG-arkitektur och/eller AI Agent-arkitektur och erfarenhet av att implementera molnbaserade AI-tjänster för att möjliggöra högkvalitativa AI-lösningar.
Förmågan att skriva tydlig, enkel och skalbar kod med fokus på kvalitet samt djup kunskap om designmönster, utvecklingsprinciper och moderna AI-ramverk.
Erfarenhet av att sätta AI-lösningar i produktion med hjälp av DevSecOps och IaC.
God kunskap kring databaser och datadesign.
En nyfiken och lösningsorienterad lagspelare som trivs med att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team.



Intresserad av att höra mer?

Låter det som en spännande utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team som ligger i framkant av AI-utveckling! Om du har några frågor, chatta gärna med Nils på LinkedIn eller skicka ett mail till honom nils.larsen(at)solita.se. Du kan också kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Sebastian på LinkedIn eller maila sebastian.laine(at)solita.se. 

Om Solita

Vi är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med över 2000 medarbetare i 8 länder, varav 200 i Sverige. Vår storlek gör oss tillräckligt stora för att vara en stabil och innovativ arbetsgivare, men samtidigt tillräckligt små för att värna om våra medarbetare och kunder. Med bred kompetens inom digital transformation erbjuder vi en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du friheten att utvecklas, både professionellt och personligt.

Placeringsort för denna roll är i Stockholm, Sverige
Show more
HTML:
Vi har nyligen startat en systemutvecklingsenhet i Sverige med ett starkt fokus på data och AI, där vi önskar växa med ett gäng framåtlutade AI Developers.

AI Developer – Bygg AI-lösningar som skapar värde!

Hos oss kommer du ta en ledande roll i vår resa att skapa framtidens tekniska lösningar där möjliggörande av data och införandet av AI kommer spela en central roll. 

Så här säger Rebecca Hammel, Head of Software Development, om visionen för enheten: 

”Jag är oerhört entusiastisk över att få leda detta nya team och bidra till Solitas fortsatta tillväxt. Vi skapar en miljö där Software Designers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists och slutanvändare arbetar nära tillsammans för att snabbt leverera affärsvärde med hjälp av den senaste tekniken inom Cloud och AI”. 

Vad rollen innebär

I denna nya roll som AI Developer får du arbeta nära affärs- och teknikteam för att utveckla AI-lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att fatta smartare beslut och automatisera processer på ett intelligent sätt. Du får en unik möjlighet att delta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från idé till produktionssättning – där du inte bara bygger AI-lösningar utan även bidrar med kreativa idéer och strategier för att optimera deras effekt. Vi arbetar agnostiskt när det gäller teknikstackar men förväntar oss att du är bekväm med moderna ramverk och plattformar lämpliga för AI-tjänster. Erfarenhet av att sätta AI-lösningar som RAGs eller Agenter i produktion samt kunskap kring etisk AI är en central del av rollen. Du kommer att ha stor frihet att forma både teknikval och arkitektur för att möta affärsbehov och du kommer arbeta nära Data/AI Engineers/Scientists för att utveckla de bästa AI-lösningarna.

Vad vi erbjuder

  • Meningsfulla projekt: Utveckla AI-lösningar som gör verklig skillnad för våra kunder inom en rad olika branscher.
  • Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete – läs mer från vår blogg.
  • Ständig utveckling: Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling för att säkerställa att våra utvecklare ligger längst fram i teknikutvecklingen.
  • Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med några av de främsta experterna inom AI och data och öppna dörren till nya arbetssätt som CollabAI.
  • Bra villkor och sociala aktiviteter! Generösa förmåner som konkurrenskraftig fast lön, pension, 30 semesterdagar och mycket mer samt ett öppet och inkluderande arbetsklimat där vi värnar om både din personliga och professionella utveckling.


Förmågor och erfarenheter för att lyckas i rollen

  • Bred kunskap gällande AI & maskininlärning i allmänhet och GenAI i synnerhet.
  • God förståelse för RAG-arkitektur och/eller AI Agent-arkitektur och erfarenhet av att implementera molnbaserade AI-tjänster för att möjliggöra högkvalitativa AI-lösningar.
  • Förmågan att skriva tydlig, enkel och skalbar kod med fokus på kvalitet samt djup kunskap om designmönster, utvecklingsprinciper och moderna AI-ramverk.
  • Erfarenhet av att sätta AI-lösningar i produktion med hjälp av DevSecOps och IaC.
  • God kunskap kring databaser och datadesign.
  • En nyfiken och lösningsorienterad lagspelare som trivs med att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team.


Intresserad av att höra mer?

Låter det som en spännande utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team som ligger i framkant av AI-utveckling! Om du har några frågor, chatta gärna med Nils på LinkedIn eller skicka ett mail till honom nils.larsen(at)solita.se. Du kan också kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Sebastian på LinkedIn eller maila sebastian.laine(at)solita.se. 

Om Solita

Vi är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med över 2000 medarbetare i 8 länder, varav 200 i Sverige. Vår storlek gör oss tillräckligt stora för att vara en stabil och innovativ arbetsgivare, men samtidigt tillräckligt små för att värna om våra medarbetare och kunder. Med bred kompetens inom digital transformation erbjuder vi en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du friheten att utvecklas, både professionellt och personligt.

Placeringsort för denna roll är i Stockholm, Sverige

Title: Senior Applied AI Engineer
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

As the Senior Applied AI Engineer, you will play an important role in unlocking the potential of Gen AI throughout our organisation. Your hands-on approach and focus on applying Gen AI to address real-world challenges will be key in driving innovation and efficiency. This role offers a platform for you to make a significant impact, with the freedom to execute on our Gen AI strategy, discover high-value applications, and take lead on technical implementation.

Role

Imagine building transformative solutions like implementing real-time actions based on rider feedback from the app or creating a diagnosis and repairs co-pilot for mechanics and in-field workers. These are just a glimpse of the exciting and impactful projects you will spearhead in this role, shaping the way we leverage AI technology. This will include:


Developing frameworks and tooling that make it easier for R&D teams to integrate Gen AI into products.
Designing and building pragmatic, production-ready Gen AI solutions for various business use cases.
Working with teams across the company to understand their challenges and apply AI where it creates real value.
Balancing innovation with practicality, ensuring we use the right AI tools for the job rather than chasing the latest trends.
Ensuring solutions are scalable, cost-efficient, and secure, following best practices for deploying AI in production.
Staying up to date with the rapidly evolving AI landscape and helping define our AI adoption strategy.


What You Need To Embark

To have the best possible start with us, we believe you have:


Strong software engineering background, ideally in backend or ML development and system integration.
Proven experience using Gen AI/LLM technologies in production (e.g., OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, vector databases, RAG, AI agents).
Curiosity and pragmatism – you focus on delivering value, not just exploring technology.
Experience building AI-powered applications that integrate with real-world systems.
Ability to work autonomously, define your own roadmap, and drive projects forward.
Strong collaboration skills – comfortable working with technical and non-technical teams alike.


WHY VOI?

Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voyage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To


Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
Lead the future product generations of our vehicles and push the company further towards our product vision and overarching mission of providing “safe, affordable and sustainable micromobility for everyone”
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.

Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to drive data innovation in the automotive industry, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and big data solutions? Then you might be the Data Scientist we are looking for!




About Us

We are a global company specializing in online car auctions and IT solutions for the automotive industry. With more than 15 years of data across Europe, we are continuously growing and seeking a Data Scientist to help us commercialize our data and create value for our customers.




The Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing and automotive IT solutions, as well as business intelligence solutions for used vehicles and professional fleet management.

Headquartered in Denmark, the Autorola Group currently employs around 850 people and has branches in 19 countries across Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Asia-Pacific region.

Through an extensive network of companies, manufacturers, banks, leasing companies, and fleet managers, Autorola offers dealers worldwide the opportunity to acquire and market vehicles through auctions. Our product portfolio is complemented by our workflow management system, which enables the digital integration of individual customer processes throughout the entire vehicle lifecycle, as well as our artificial intelligence, which provides real-time indicators for developments in the used car market.







Your Role

Reporting to the Head of Data Science in our Business Unit, Indicata, you will play a key role in building and maintaining our big data platform, supporting various markets with data insights, Power BI dashboards, and developing data science solutions that enhance our appraisal engine and forecasting capabilities.




Your key responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining our big data platform, including building out the data lake.
Engaging in platform discussions and collaborating on data architecture.
Utilizing SQL, Python, R, and Power BI for data analysis and dashboard creation.
Working closely with the Data Engineer to prepare datasets for analysis.
Designing and executing complex data analyses across multiple markets.
Commercializing data insights to add value to our customers.
Ensuring data quality and optimizing existing algorithms.
Supporting and potentially developing machine learning solutions over time.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.







Your Profile

We imagine you have at least 2 years of relevant experience, but we are also open to recent graduates with the right motivation and approach. Additionally, we expect you to have:

Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and Power BI.
Experience with Spark and Databricks is a plus.
Strong commercial acumen and the ability to translate data insights into business value.
Experience in creating Power BI dashboards for complex data analysis and forecasting.
A methodological approach to problem-solving and improving data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with the “Team Data Science Process” or similar to be able to work structured and independently on own projects.
The ability to work both independently and collaboratively with stakeholders.
A willingness to learn about the automotive industry and its data ecosystem.







What We Offer

Autorola A/S is a global company with over 850 employees and 19 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific.

You will get the opportunity to work for a fast-growing company that collaborates with some of the strongest brands in the automotive industry. Our environment is characterized by an informal and easygoing communication culture. Our headquarters is located right by the railway station at Skibhusvej 52 A, 5000 Odense C.




You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as have the chance to participate in company social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and a Friday bar to end the week on a high note.




Want to Join the Team and Have an Impact on the Future?

We are looking to fill the position as soon as possible, so if you see yourself thriving in the above-mentioned tasks, we look forward to receiving your application.




Even if you do not meet all the ideal requirements, we encourage you to apply, as we strongly believe in inclusion and diversity.




We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the advertisement once we find the right candidate.




If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, by phone at +45 31624481.

Show more

Title: AI/ML lead
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI/ML lead for fast-moving intelligence company

By leveraging prescriptive intelligence, we aim to proactively showcase emerging business opportunities and recommend actions based on how an organisation’s market is shifting—giving companies foresight and a competitive edge.

Our Mission Is To Collect And Structure The Worlds Information To Enable Professionals To Better Foresee The Future. We Have a Current Focus On E-commerce, Where We Collect And Analyse Data To Forecast And Predict Answers To Questions Such As


Which company is likely to move into a new location within the next 12 months?
Which companies are on track for growth?
How many webshops are delivering certain products in different countries?


Tembi’s vision is realised by a dedicated internal team with expertise in building intelligence-driven SaaS platform. Our team includes data engineers, data scientists, analysts, software engineers, UI/UX designers, and software developers. We are driven by values of innovation, collaboration, and mutual support. We celebrate our successes and continuously seek opportunities to improve and learn. With an agile approach and a start-up mentality, we embrace the fast-paced nature of our work.

We are in the market for a AI/ML Lead wanting to drive predictive analytics and conversational AI in a new type of company.

This role takes responsibility for developing strategy, roadmap and team as a hands-on expert. You will be the mentor that drives your team forward and focus on developing and enhancing data-driven models, with a strong emphasis on predictive intelligence. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to lead our way in how to use AI agents to the growing domain of conversational AI by leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and other advanced machine learning techniques.

If you’re excited to explore how we can understand and predict trends in real-world data and use conversational AI to evolve how our clients interact with the insights we provide, then we’d love to hear from you.

Being part of our tight-knit team means every day is unique. Some days you’ll be deep diving into data, making sense of patterns and anomalies. On other days, you’ll be brainstorming with colleagues to ensure our predictive models and conversational AI tools are in line with the latest trends and customer needs. Agility is our mantra, and your commitment to swift, quality deliveries by cutting only the right corners will resonate deeply with our ethos.

With this comes significant responsibility, as your insights will shape the models and products we present to our clients. We are passionate about individuals with a growth mindset—those who view challenges as intriguing puzzles rather than roadblocks. Our team is on a rapid trajectory of growth and evolution, and adaptability is key. We need people who do not get scared when asked to try new things.

Your Main Responsibilities


You are leading our roadmap and position forward and will be supported by a great team of data engineers & data scientists. You are expected to lead the work but having direct reports depend on motivation and experience.
Drive data science projects forward
Use a variety of machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, including predictive modelling, classification, clustering, and NLP techniques for conversational AI.
Develop, refine, and validate predictive models, creating sound and long-lasting model pipelines in a fashin that is suitable for a true product company.
Lead and execute on our strategy on predicive modelling, conversational and agentic AI initiatives.
Ensure that our ML models and conversational AI systems are running smoothly and transparently in production.
Communicate complex model performances in an understandable and actionable format towards our clients, including visualisations and interpretability methods.


Other Aspects Of The Role


Explore and improve our current setup—be it through introducing new tools, refining methodologies, or streamlining processes.
Collaborate closely with our tech stack, ensuring familiarity with tools like MLflow and practices like data versioning.
Continually research cutting-edge technologies in both predictive analytics and conversational AI, seeding innovation and continuous improvement within the team.
Facilitate the translation of model results into actionable insights, ensuring our customers can leverage them effectively.
Take the team on company outings to your favourite pastime: running, climbing, biking or something completely different.


Qualifications To Shine In This Role


Solid foundation in Python, and familiarity with platforms like Databricks.
Proficiency in predictive modelling, time-series analysis, and other relevant data science techniques, using libraries such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Spark MLlib.
Proven track record of model validation, interpretation, and result presentation for end-users.
Experience with tools like MLflow and practices such as data versioning.
Demonstated experience with NLP tools and methods, including text classification, sentiment analysis, and conversational AI model building.
Understanding of cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, Google).
At least 5 years of relevant experience is our guideline. We value a growth mindset, and encourage less experienced individuals with strong skills and an enthusiasm for the role to apply.


Dive into the data-driven world with us, harnessing the power of predictive analytics and conversational AI to shape the future of businesses. We eagerly await your expertise and fresh perspectives.

What We Offer


A highly entrepreneurial environment with flat hierarchies and short decision paths.
We are 25 colleagues today, have clients in 17 markets, and are building a fast-growing organization. You’ll be part of the ride from nearly the start and learn how to build a software company from the ground up.
Outstanding engineering and product team, shipping high-quality product incredibly fast.
Salary and packages are tailored individually based on experience and fit for the team.
An office full of talented, mission-driven people.
A position with direct feedback from customers.
A strong, collaborative work environment with a history of successful startups.
Enjoyable lunches at our Cantina and a multicultural team that communicates in English.
Office stocked with free snacks, soda, and coffee
Located at Fiolstræde, centrally in Copenhagen near Nørreport. (25 min from Malmö)
Diverse team with members from (Denmark, Sweden, Chile, Iran, Spain, Ukraine, Turkey, UK, US, Lithuania, France, Poland, Venezuela and India)


Application Process

The application process begins with a review by our team. Following this, candidates will undergo interviews conducted via voice or video calls. Successful candidates will then be invited for an in-person interview where they will have the opportunity to meet the team to ensure a good fit. During this process there may be a technical test and personality test. We care about finding the right person for the job with best fit for the team. The final stage includes contract negotiations. The entire hiring process is expected to take anywhere from a few days to a couple of weeks.

This is not a consultant opportunity and we respectfully ask not to be contacted regarding consultancy offers.
