Title: Research Scientist
Place: Måløv, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about development and documentation of analytical methods for future diabetes, bleeding disorders, obesity, and rare disease products? And do you thrive in an open, dynamic, and collaborative environment where scientific expertise and stakeholder management are paramount?

If so, you might be our next Research Scientist in the development teams. Apply today!

The Position
As Research Scientist within the development team, you will be joining a dedicated team of experienced colleagues, including scientists and laboratory technicians. Your role will involve the analytical development and optimization of methods for drug substances and injectable products, with a specific focus on chromatographic methods (HPLC/UHPLC).

As our new Research Scientist, you will:



Plan and coordinate experiments for method development and document the results
Act as the responsible analytical person in the projects, closely collaborating with project managers, scientists and technicians across the organisation
Take responsibility for ensuring that analytical equipment is fully functioning
Troubleshoot analytical equipment and methods
Collaborate with colleagues to contribute to the ongoing optimization, automation, and digitalization of processes and systems




Qualifications

As our ideal candidate, you have:



A Master’s degree in Life Sciences (Pharmacy, Engineering, or related discipline) along with a PhD or equivalent experience
Experience in HPLC/UHPLC and/or LC-MS analytical development within the pharmaceutical industry
Profound knowledge of general protein chemistry and a natural flair for thinking in new digital and automated solutions
Stakeholder management as a part of your DNA




Experience with analysis at CMOs are an advantageFluency in both written and spoken English is required, while proficiency in Danish is a plus. As a person you have a positive and open-minded approach, which is helpful in an ever-changing project environment. You have a natural way of establishing new networks and strong communication skills that allow you to build fruitful relations to both colleagues and stakeholders. Finally, you are a team player and contribute to reaching our team goals.

About The Department

The CMC Analytical Development is an integral part of CMC Analysis and Characterisation, located in Novo Nordisk Park, Måløv, greater Copenhagen. The department comprises four highly skilled analytical teams with a total of 86 employees, divided into two analysis teams and two development teams. The analysis teams are responsible for all GMP activities, including analysing all in-process, drug substance, and drug product samples during development. The development teams, for which the available position is intended, are responsible for all analytical development activities. The analytical platform in department primarily utilizes HPLC/UHPLC, iCIEF, CE-SDS, and LC-MS.

Providing analytical support to all parts of Novo Nordisk, the department acts as link between the Research and Product Supply, spanning from early development to phase 3 clinical trials and registration. The responsibility for the analytical support across the organisation also means that stakeholder management is a key focus in the department.

Working at Novo Nordisk
We are a proud life-science company, and life is our reason to exist. We’re inspired by life in all its forms and shapes, ups and downs, opportunities and challenges. For employees at Novo Nordisk, life means many things – from the building blocks of life that form the basis of ground-breaking scientific research, to our rich personal lives that motivate and energise us to perform our best at work. Ultimately, life is why we’re all here - to ensure that people can lead a life independent of chronic disease.

Contact
For further information, please contact Christina Grønberg +45 30 77 75 64

Deadline
21 April 2025

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth:

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
6 weeks paid vacation
Pension plan contributions
Private health & life insurance
Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
Professional espresso machine
Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).


Show more

We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:


  • Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
  • Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
  • Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
  • Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
  • Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices


Please apply if you have:


  • Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
  • Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
  • Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
  • Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
  • Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
  • Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
  • Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
  • Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
  • Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models


Benefits:


  • Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
  • Focus on mental health and well-being:
    • Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
    • Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
    • Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
    • No meeting Fridays
  • Paid parental leave
  • Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
  • Paid volunteer time
  • Focus on your career growth:
    • Development Dollars
    • Leadership development
    • Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings
  • Travel Discounts
  • Employee Resource Groups
  • 6 weeks paid vacation
  • Pension plan contributions
  • Private health & life insurance
  • Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
  • Professional espresso machine
  • Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
  • Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: Senior Data Scientist i AI & Data Innovation
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Hvem er vi hos AI & Data Innovation

AI & Data Innovation er en del af Operational Excellence i Danica, og vi er dedikeret til at støtte forretningsvækst og effektivitet gennem AI- og datadrevne løsninger. Vi arbejder tæt sammen med forskellige afdelinger for at identificere muligheder for AI og datainnovation og sikre, at vores løsninger opfylder regulatoriske og forretningsmæssige krav. Vores fokus ligger på at levere effektfulde løsninger, der imødekommer behov inden for livs- og pensionssektoren.

Hvordan ser teamet ud

Vores team, AI & Data Innovation, arbejder målrettet på at identificere, udvikle og implementere innovative AI-løsninger, der forbedrer forretningsprocesser og skaber værdi for Danica. Vi spiller en central rolle i at fremme AI-agendaen og samarbejder tæt med teams på tværs af organisationen, herunder kolleger i Indien, for at skabe integrerede løsninger, der understøtter forretningsenheder og kundebehov. Vores team er dynamisk og samarbejdende, hvor erfaringsudveksling og konstant læring er centrale elementer. Vi værdsætter en uformel omgangstone, hvor arbejde kombineres med socialt samvær.

Hvordan ser rollen ud?

Som Data Scientist Hos AI & Data Innovation Vil Du Spille En Central Rolle i At Fremme AI-agendaen. Du Vil Være Med Til At Identificere Og Evaluere Nye AI-muligheder Inden For Forretningsområderne. Dine Primære Ansvarsområder Vil Hertil Inkludere


Udvikle Proof of Concepts (POCs) for at demonstrere værdien af AI i forretningsprocesser, samt udarbejde nødvendig dokumentation og identificere skalerbarhed.
Sikre god datakvalitet i samarbejde med forretningsområderne.
Samarbejde med vores indiske kolleger i udvikling og implementering af vores AI- og dataløsninger i forretningen.
Dyrke stærke relationer med dataspecialister og forretningseksperter på tværs af organisationen.
Kommunikere resultater og fund til interessenter
Holde teamet opdateret med de seneste teknologiske fremskridt inden for AI.


Hvem leder vi efter?

Vi Søger En Motiveret Erfaren Data Scientist, Der Har Relevant Erhvervserfaring Med Anvendelse Af ML-modeller Og Gerne GenAI-modeller i Forretningsprocesser. Du Har En Videregående Uddannelse Inden For Relevante Områder Og En Interesse For De Nyeste Teknologier Inden For ML Og AI. Analytiske Færdigheder Og Nysgerrighed Er Essentielle For At Udforske Nye Tilgange Og Se Tingene Udefra Med Et ML Og AI Perspektiv. Hertil Leder Vi Efter En Kandidat Med Følgende Kvalifikationer


3+ års erfaring inden for advanced analytics eller data science (fordelagtigt indenfor finans- eller forsikringsbranchen).
Erfaring med at udvikle POCs for at demonstrere værdien i AI
Du kan forklare tekniske aspekter for aktører på alle niveauer og er proaktiv og løsningsorienteret, med en stærk interesse for innovation og teknologi.
Du er struktureret og fokuseret på at anvende de rette værktøjer, med evnen til at forstå både detaljen og helheden.
Stærk erfaring med Python og fortrolig med SQL
Tidligere erfaring med cloud-tjenester som AWS vil være en stor fordel
Evne til at kommunikere effektivt på engelsk.


Har vi fanget din interesse?

Send dit CV og ansøgning snarest, da vi løbende afholder interviews. Har du spørgsmål til rollen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Thomas Mogensen Dyerberg, Head of AI & Data Innovation, på telefon +45 31 18 44 48 eller via e-mail på tmd@danicapension.dk .
Show more

Title: Coders - AI Training [Remote]
Description:
Requirements

This is a great opportunity to supplement your income while looking for longer or more full-time work, all while contributing to the development of new AI models using your domain expertise!

Our client has hired over 100 BT Talent and intends to hire hundreds more!

You’ll have the flexibility to work as much or as little as you choose - 20hrs/week is suggested, but not a limit. Start working in as little as 48 hours.




What to expect: If qualified, you’ll complete an ID verification & be invited to complete a 30-minute technical interview, typically scheduled within 48 hours of being invited. The interview will consist of technicals, choosing from: JS, Java, C++, and Python. If you successfully pass the interview, you’ll be approved and able to begin work ASAP. Otherwise, the next step will be to complete an async rating & writing assessment.

In both scenarios, you will be compensated for successfully completing the assessment, up to $175.




Required qualifications:

Complete fluency in the English language is required. You should be able to describe code and abstract information in a clear way.
Proficiency working with any of the the following:
Python, Java, JavaScript / TypeScript, SQL, C/C++/C# and/or HTML

Preferred qualifications:

Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Students are welcome.
Proficiency working with any of the the following (in addition to the languages above):
Swift, Ruby, Rust, Go, NET, Matlab, PHP, HTML, DART, R, Apex, and Shell
Data Science experience

Note: Scale AI is partnering with Remotasks for this opportunity




What You’ll Be Working On

Our client has partnered with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code.

Example projects might include:
Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale
Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code
Optimize code to run at maximum efficiency
Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively
Writing human-readable summaries of coding problems
Writing explanations of how code can solve problems and evaluate various solution approaches

No previous experience with AI necessary! You will receive detailed instructions on what is expected of you after you complete the application and verification process.

Title: Student Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Student Machine Learning Engineer

At MFT Energy, we are at the forefront of energy trading, driving market efficiency, and facilitating the green transition. We are seeking a talented student machine learning engineer to join our ambitious Intraday team trading European power. Collaborate with experienced professionals, who are dedicated to excellence every day.

About The Role

As a Student Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in our dynamic Intraday team. You will work alongside highly skilled quantitative analysts, machine-learning experts, execution-algo developers, system developers, and traders.

Your work will directly influence our critical frameworks, positioning you at the heart of our operations. You will be instrumental in ensuring that the data flows continuously, the frameworks are robust, and general systems are always running. Over time, your responsibilities will grow as we believe in responsibility being a key driver for your success.

Your Key Responsibilities


Maintain and extend machine learning frameworks.
Acquire and maintain data from external sources.


Your Qualifications And Personal Skills


Studying: Computer Science, Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar.
A general interest in technology and systems.
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, etc.
Familiarity with Linux environments and containerization tools such as Docker.
Experience with common software technologies such as Git, SQL, Azure, and general observability tools is considered a plus.
A proactive approach and an eye for detail.
The ability to work independently and structure your workload.
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English.


Above all, we cherish passion and creativity. If yo have made hobby projects, feel free to share them.

Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are more than 190 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Türkiye, Australia, New York City, and Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best—we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.

We Offer


A part-time student position with a high degree of influence and autonomy, requiring on-site presence at our Aarhus C office to foster close collaboration and learning
A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.


Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you believe there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we look forward to receiving your application, accompanied by a CV, a short cover letter, and your transcript. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Deadline: As soon as possible.

Start date: Flexible.

We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

As a global and independent energy trading hub, we specialize in power, gas, and environmentals trading 24/7 in 41 countries. At MFT Energy, we innovate energy trading through our people and technology, supported by our unique partner model. Our belief is that fostering a sense of ownership among employees is the most effective way to advance our business.

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: DATA SCIENTIST TIL AI-DREVET GRØN OMSTILLING
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Vil du være med til at skabe fremtidens AI-løsninger og omsætte banebrydende innovation til værdi for dansk landbrug?

Hos SEGES Innovation søger vi en ambitiøs Data Scientist, som brænder for dataanalyse, AI-udvikling og for at gøre en reel forskel gennem Applied AI.

Et it-job med mening

SEGES Digital er SEGES Innovations digitale forretningsenhed. Vi er en førende organisation inden for udvikling af digitale løsninger til landbrugs- og fødevareområdet, og dedikerede til at forbedre landbrugs- og fødevaresektoren gennem innovative Digital og AI løsninger baseret på vores DataEstate.

Forretningsenheden Digital består af ca. 200 medarbejdere, der sammen med resten af SEGES Innovation er drevet af vores mission om at sikre fremtidens bæredygtige fødevarer. Det gør vi gennem forskning, innovation og digitale værktøjer, der optimerer og transformerer landbrugs- og fødevaresektoren igennem den grønne omstilling af erhvervet.

Om stillingen

I afdelingen Data & Analytics hos SEGES Innovation skaber vi værdi ved at udvikle intelligente løsninger til fremtidens landbrug. Vi overvåger dyrevelfærd i staldene ved hjælp af avanceret computer vision, holder øje med marker via satellitdata og optimerer landmandens beslutninger med præcise prognosemodeller. Vi eksperimenterer også med banebrydende generative AI-teknologier, der automatisk analyserer og håndterer store mængder tekst og dokumentation.

Som Data Scientist hos os får du mulighed for at arbejde med hele data science-livscyklussen – fra indledende analyse og feature-identifikation til avanceret modeludvikling, optimering, implementering og evaluering. Du vil få lejlighed til at arbejde med state-of-the-art teknikker inden for blandt andet computer vision, generative AI samt klassiske prædiktive modeller baseret på tabulære data. Hos os bliver du en del af et engageret team, der arbejder tæt sammen med faglige eksperter om at omsætte data til konkret værdi for landbruget.

Din rolle

Du arbejder med en varieret portefølje af projekter, hvor du anvender din ekspertise inden for dataanalyse, modellering og løsningsudvikling til at omsætte komplekse udfordringer til konkrete, værdiskabende løsninger. Du vil blive en nøgleperson i at sikre, at vores AI-drevne produkter konstant er relevante, effektive og værdiskabende for dansk landbrug.

Din rolle indebærer



Udvikling af AI-løsninger i samarbejde med faglige eksperter fra Innovationsafdelingen.
Selvstændigt ansvar for AI-projekter med fokus på dataanalyse, modeludvikling og dokumentation af resultater.
Arbejde med klassiske AI-principper, såsom supervised og unsupervised machine learning.
Håndtering af forskellige typer data, fx tidsserier, billeder, geospatiale data og tekst.
Løbende dialog, sparring og præsentation af resultater til interne interessenter.
Aktivt bidrag til kompetenceopbygning inden for AI og data science i både projekt- og produktkontekster.



Hvad vi drømmer om...

Vi ser gerne, at du har erfaring inden for data science, men lysten til at lære er vigtigere end nuværende kompetenceniveau.

Faglige kompetencer



Kendskab til datatyper som f.eks. tidsserier, geospatiale data, video/billede eller tekst.
Erfaring med Azure og/eller Databricks.
Solide kompetencer inden for Python.
Kendskab til CI/CD-principper.



Personlige kompetencer



En pragmatisk tilgang til opgaverne.
Evnen til hurtigt at tilegne dig ny viden og omsætte den til praksis.
Stærke samarbejdsevner og lyst til at være en aktiv del af et team.
En naturlig nysgerrighed og interesse for at følge med i AI-udviklingen.



Frem for alt søger vi en person med stort gåpåmod, ægte interesse for området og en stærk vilje til konstant at lære og udvikle sig.

Hvad vi tilbyder

I SEGES Innovation tilbyder vi dig en karriere med mening. Vores innovation og viden gør en stor forskel i at skabe en bæredygtig fødevareproduktion. Vores specialister arbejder med alt fra klima og miljø, planter, husdyr og digitale løsninger til vækst og vidensformidling.

Sammen bidrager vi til de løsninger, der gør landbruget og fødevareproduktionen endnu mere bæredygtig. Vi er 500 kolleger, der brænder for det, vi arbejder med. Vi omsætter for omkring 630 millioner kr. årligt.

I det digitale område af SEGES Innovation arbejder vi agilt med digitale produkt teams, der primært arbejder med SCRUM og hvis vi i al beskedenhed selv skal sige det er hamrende gode, men også kan blive bedre. Du får derfor mulighed for at sætte dit aftryk på organisationens fremtidige udvikling.

Vi tilbyder derudover en attraktiv lønpakke, fleksible arbejdsbetingelser og gode muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling.

Ansøg nu

Lyder det interessant, og kan du se dig selv i stillingen, så upload ansøgning og dit CV via "Søg stillingen".

Vil du vide mere?

Du kan læse mere om SEGES Digital her: https://segesinnovation.dk/landing-pages/et-it-job-med-mening/

Du kan se en tv-serie om, hvordan det er at arbejde i SEGES Digital, her: https://segesinnovation.dk/landing-pages/kodernes-kamp/

Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte Director, Morten Ryberg på 2812 7341 eller på mory@seges.dk

Ved rekruttering hos SEGES Innovation prioriterer vi primært din faglige ekspertise og personlighed. Vi ser mangfoldighed som en styrke, derfor opfordres alle med de rette kompetencer til at søge - uanset etnisk tilhørsforhold, religion, kønsidentitet og alder.

SEGES Innovation er en uafhængig forsknings- og innovationsvirksomhed, der arbejder for en bæredygtig og konkurrencedygtig landbrugs- og fødevareproduktion. Vi kobler faglige indsigter med digitale teknologier, så ny viden kommer ud at virke i stalden, på marken og i hele værdikæden fra jord til bord.

Vores mange forskellige eksperter udgør et unikt fagmiljø i international topklasse med ca. 500 dedikerede kolleger, der arbejder ud fra værdierne Mod, Hjerte og Dybde og i tæt samspil med Danmarks mere end 30.000 landbrug, universiteter og uddannelsesinstitutioner, landbrugsrådgivere, fødevareproducenter, energiselskaber og myndigheder.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Coders - AI Training [Remote]
Description:
Requirements

This is a great opportunity to supplement your income while looking for longer or more full-time work, all while contributing to the development of new AI models using your domain expertise!

Our client has hired over 100 BT Talent and intends to hire hundreds more!

You’ll have the flexibility to work as much or as little as you choose - 20hrs/week is suggested, but not a limit. Start working in as little as 48 hours.




What to expect: If qualified, you’ll complete an ID verification & be invited to complete a 30-minute technical interview, typically scheduled within 48 hours of being invited. The interview will consist of technicals, choosing from: JS, Java, C++, and Python. If you successfully pass the interview, you’ll be approved and able to begin work ASAP. Otherwise, the next step will be to complete an async rating & writing assessment.

In both scenarios, you will be compensated for successfully completing the assessment, up to $175.




Required qualifications:

Complete fluency in the English language is required. You should be able to describe code and abstract information in a clear way.
Proficiency working with any of the the following:
Python, Java, JavaScript / TypeScript, SQL, C/C++/C# and/or HTML

Preferred qualifications:

Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Students are welcome.
Proficiency working with any of the the following (in addition to the languages above):
Swift, Ruby, Rust, Go, NET, Matlab, PHP, HTML, DART, R, Apex, and Shell
Data Science experience

Note: Scale AI is partnering with Remotasks for this opportunity




What You’ll Be Working On

Our client has partnered with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code.

Example projects might include:
Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale
Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code
Optimize code to run at maximum efficiency
Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively
Writing human-readable summaries of coding problems
Writing explanations of how code can solve problems and evaluate various solution approaches

No previous experience with AI necessary! You will receive detailed instructions on what is expected of you after you complete the application and verification process.

Show more

Title: 3D Vision Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

At Teton, we are redefining the role of healthcare workers through cutting-edge AI technology. Facing a global nursing shortage, our solutions offer vital support to overburdened health systems. We distinguish ourselves by focusing relentlessly on product excellence and user experience, rapidly deploying solutions that make a real difference.

At this stage of our company we require a physical presence in our office in Copenhagen, Denmark. We believe this enables the fastest and most efficient iteration cycles to build an impactful product that users love to use.

The Job

We’re looking for a dynamic and innovative 3D Vision Engineer who will transform our AI system outputs into essential tools for healthcare workers. You will play a critical role in developing new features, enhancing the core product, and lifting model detections and reasoning into 3D. Your contributions will directly impact the efficiency and effectiveness of healthcare delivery, providing much-needed support to healthcare professionals.

In this role, you will focus on the following areas of interest.


Computer vision 3D modelling
Training deep learning models for 3D understanding
Camera models, including 360 fisheye
Object detection and tracking in 3D


Qualifications


Experience with 3D modelling and camera geometry
Experience with Structure from Motion / SLAM
Solid deep learning understanding. Trained models for 3D geometry.
Python, PyTorch (experience with TensoRT is a plus)
Minimum 3 years experience
Show evidence of exceptional ability.


What We Offer


Participation in our warrant program (stock options).
Work with state-of-the-art technology in a pioneering field.
A vibrant, learning-focused work environment.
A role where you can make a significant impact on healthcare delivery.


Join Our Team

We're looking for individuals who share our vision and value ownership and entrepreneurship over a conventional job. At Teton, you'll have the chance to make a real impact with your work. If you're ready for more than just a job, come aboard and be part of our mission to transform healthcare.
Show more

  • A role where you can make a significant impact on healthcare delivery.

Join Our Team

We're looking for individuals who share our vision and value ownership and entrepreneurship over a conventional job. At Teton, you'll have the chance to make a real impact with your work. If you're ready for more than just a job, come aboard and be part of our mission to transform healthcare.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
En personlig hilsen til “dig” – vores kommende teammedlem

Lad os spole et år frem: Vi er samlet som team for at fejre de imponerende resultater, vi har skabt sammen. De virksomhedskunder, vi samarbejder med – virksomheder inden for retail, utilities og manufacturing – deler deres historier om, hvordan vores løsninger har transformeret deres forretning, øget effektiviteten og skabt nye vækstmuligheder.




Du har været kernen i disse resultater. Du har leveret projekter med stor effekt, strømlinet komplekse processer og opbygget tillid hos vores kunder. Undervejs har du udviklet dine tekniske og rådgivningsmæssige kompetencer – hvad enten det er gennem avancerede machine learning-teknikker, evnen til at omsætte data til strategiske indsigter eller håndtering af de unikke udfordringer ved vores enterprisekunder.




Dine problemløsningsevner og innovative idéer har ikke kun skabt succes for kunderne, men også bidraget til vækst og inspiration i vores team. I dag fejrer vi ikke kun vores resultater; vi fejrer vores rejse, vores team og den banebrydende forskel, vi har skabt for alle vores kunder – sammen.




English version below




Din hverdag i Inspari

Vi brænder for at drive datadrevet transformation for vores enterprisekunder inden for retail, utilities & manufacturing. Vi fokuserer på at optimere processer og skabe målbare resultater gennem banebrydende AI- og Data Science-løsninger.




Vi tror på at give vores teams ejerskab og ansvar som selvstændige konsulenter. Vores projekter spænder fra at optimere forsyningskæder til at forbedre kundeoplevelser – alle med avancerede Data Science- og AI-teknikker som omdrejningspunkt.




Rollen

Som Senior Data Scientist får du en nøglerolle i at forme og levere avancerede løsninger til vores enterprisekunder. Du vil samarbejde tæt med kundernes interessenter for at forstå deres processer, identificere optimeringsmuligheder og implementere modeller og strategier, der skaber forretningsværdi.




Ansvarsområder og opgaver

Som erfaren konsulent og Data Scientist i Inspari vil din rolle være at drive alle faser i ML-projekter. Det indebærer b.la.:

Samarbejde med vores enterprisekunder om at identificere og forstå deres forretningsmæssige udfordringer.
Designe og implementere machine learning-modeller, algoritmer og datadrevne strategier for at optimere processer og styrke beslutningstagning.
Omsætte komplekse dataindsigter til konkrete anbefalinger for ikke-tekniske interessenter.
Lede projektteams og sikre rettidig levering af løsninger i høj kvalitet.
Agere som betroet rådgiver og guide kunder på deres datadrevne transformationsrejse.
Være mentor for yngre teammedlemmer og fremme en kultur for læring og vækst.
Ansvar for eget budget og bidrage til teamets udvikling og vækst.




Dine kvalifikationer

Vi ønsker os, at du har:

Erfaring: Minimum 5 års erfaring inden for data science eller lignende, gerne fra konsulent- eller enterprisevirksomheder.
Teknisk ekspertise: Solid erfaring med Python-programmering. Kendskab til vores primære biblioteker som Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, scikit-learn og Dash er en fordel. Erfaring med eller grundlæggende viden om Cloud-tjenester som Microsoft Azure, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Data Lake og Blob.
Forretningsforståelse: Evne til at forstå og optimere forretningsprocesser inden for retail, utility eller manufacturing.
Konsulentfærdigheder: Stærke kommunikations- og samarbejdsevner samt erfaring med kundekontakt.
Selvstændighed: Evne til at arbejde selvstændigt og lede projekter fra ide til levering.




Bemærk venligst: Hvis ovenstående lyder interessant, og du kommer med relevant erfaring til at løfte ansvaret og opgaverne, så vil vi meget gerne undersøge dine muligheder hos os.




Din tjekliste

Generelt er du godt på vej, hvis du tilmed kan genkende dig selv i nedenstående linjer:




Du er passioneret omkring nye teknologier orienteret mod Data Science & AI.
Du motiveres af at rådgive og lave tekniske løsninger for vores kunder, der optimerer deres dagligdag.
Du stortrives i arbejdet med at indsamle og klargøre data, som du kan analysere, modellere og formidle.
Du inspirerers af at indgå og bidrage i et fagligt fakultet, hvor vi i fællesskab løfter hinandens kompetenceniveau til fordel for kunder lige så vel vores egen trivsel.
Du er ambitiøs og kan lide en dynamisk arbejdsuge, hvor du får en bred eksponering til kunder og forskellige løsninger.
Du har lyst til at fortælle vidt og bredt om de mange muligheder, der åbner sig inden for DS/AI i disse år.




Hvad vi tilbyder

Et dynamisk og samarbejdsorienteret arbejdsmiljø med fokus på innovation og effekt.
Mulighed for at arbejde på forskellige projekter med stor betydning for førende enterprisevirksomheder.
En stærk kultur for faglig udvikling med adgang til træning, mentorordninger og karriereudvikling.
Konkurrencedygtig løn og attraktive personalegoder.
At blive en del af vores unikke Heartwork kultur hvor ambitioner og forventninger går hånd i hånd med passion og holdånd.




Lokation: Du tilknyttes vores kontor i Lystrup (ved Århus) med en hybrid arbejdsmodel.




Rejseaktivitet: Du skal forvente, at der kan være en vis rejseaktivitet.




Send os dit CV og en ansøgning:

Vi vil gerne høre om et projekt, hvor du har skabt målbar forretningsmæssig indflydelse ved hjælp af data science-teknikker.




Venlig hilsen,

Steffen Krogsgaard (Talent Acquisition Director)

Inspari - en valantic virksomhed




English version:




A personal note to “You?” our future team member

Fast forward a year: We’re gathered as a team, celebrating the remarkable successes we’ve achieved together. The enterprise clients we’ve partnered with—leaders in retail, utilities, and manufacturing—are sharing how our solutions have reshaped their operations, increased efficiency, and unlocked new opportunities for growth.




You’ve been at the heart of these successes. You’ve delivered impactful projects, streamlined complex processes, and built trust with clients. Along the way, you’ve honed your technical and consulting skills—whether mastering advanced machine learning techniques, refining your ability to turn data into strategic insights, or navigating the unique challenges of enterprise-level consulting.




Your problem-solving and innovative ideas have not only driven client success but also inspired growth within our team. And today, we’re not just celebrating results; we’re celebrating our team, the journey and the pioneering difference we’ve have made for all our customers - together.




About Us

We are dedicated to driving data-driven transformation for enterprise clients in retail, utilities, and manufacturing. Our focus is on optimizing processes and delivering measurable impact through cutting-edge AI and Data Science solutions.

We believe in empowering our teams to take ownership and act as self-driven consultants. Our projects range from optimizing supply chains to enhancing customer experiences—all leveraging advanced Data Science and AI techniques.




The Role

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and delivering cutting-edge solutions for our enterprise customers. You’ll work closely with client stakeholders to understand their processes, identify opportunities for optimization, and implement models and strategies that drive business results.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with enterprise customers to identify and understand their business challenges.
Design and implement machine learning models, algorithms, and data-driven strategies to optimize processes and enhance decision-making.
Translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
Lead project teams, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality solutions.
Act as a trusted advisor, guiding clients through their data-driven transformation journey.
Mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of learning and growth.
Your own budget and achieving it, as well as contributing to the involvement and employment of others




What We’re Looking For

Experience: 5+ years in data science or similar, preferably in consultancy or enterprise settings.
Technical Expertise: Extensive experience with Python programming. Familiarity with some of our primary libraries is an advantage: Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, scikit-learn, Dash. Experience with/basic knowledge of Cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Data Lake, and Blob.
Business Acumen: Ability to understand and optimize business processes in retail, utility, or manufacturing.
Consulting Skills: Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with experience in client-facing roles.
Self-Driven: Capable of working independently and leading projects from concept to delivery.




Please note: If the above sounds interesting and you have experience that is relevant (transferable) to take on the responsibilities and tasks, we would be happy to explore your options with us.




What We Offer

A dynamic and collaborative work environment with a focus on innovation and impact.
Opportunities to work on diverse, high-impact projects with leading enterprise clients.
A strong culture of professional growth, with access to training, mentorship, and career development.
Competitive compensation and benefits package.




Location: You will be attached to our office in Lystrup (near Aarhus) with a hybrid work model.




Travel Activity: You should expect that there may be some travel activity.




Send us your CV and a cover letter.

We’d love to hear about a project where you drove measurable business impact using data science techniques.

Show more

Title: Experienced Data Scientist - Generative AI and Machine Learning
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
emagine is seeking an experience Data Scientist to develop Generative AI and Machine Learning (ML) scenarios in the Financial Crime Prevention domain for a client in the financial / banking sector.

Must haves:


Expert-level experience in developing Generative AI (LLM) and/or Machine Learning solutions in the Financial Crime domain
Experience working with rapid development efforts of complex large scale digital products in the Financial Crime domain
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Extensive experience of similar work at other international banks.


Crucial skills:


Change management
Program management
Data science.


Other details:

Location: Høje-Taastrup, Denmark

Workload: Full-time + hybrid

Start date: 28.04.2025

End date: 31.12.2025

Title: Principal Data Scientist
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Som Principal Data Scientist hos Inspari vil du indtage en nøgleposition i teamet, hvor din ekspertise er afgørende for at lede og udvikle vores kunder til at nå deres højeste potentiale gennem komplekse AI- og Data Science-udfordringer.

Du vil være frontløber i at transformere strategiske visioner til håndgribelige AI-løsninger.




English version below




Dine ansvarsområder og opgaver

Din rolle vil centrere sig om ledelse, udvikling og rådgivning på AI og Data Science-projekter for at understøtte værdiskabelse for vores kunder. Fra den indledende idéfase til den endelige implementering og adoption.

Du vil stå i spidsen for at dechifrere og omdanne komplekse data science-udfordringer til klare, værdiskabende løsninger og sikre en klar og overbevisende kommunikation af disse løsninger til både interne og eksterne interessenter.




Hertil vil du:

Være fagligfyrtårn og mentor for teammedlemmer og du vil spille en central rolle i at bidrage til det interne kompetenceniveau i din rolle som Principal Data Scientist og konsulent.
Være med til at forbedre og udvikle vores team, samt strategi inden for AI & Data Science.
Være engageret i presales-aktiviteter, facilitering af workshops og initiativer rettet mod uddannelse inden for AI og Data Science.
Være en aktiv bidragsyder til virksomhedens omfattende produktportefølje.




For at sikre, at du forbliver på forkant med den nyeste viden og teknologi inden for AI og data science, vil du være dedikeret til kontinuerlig selvudvikling.




Dine kvalifikationer

Den ideelle kandidat til denne rolle har dybdegående erfaring med AI og data science samt en stærk track record som teknisk driver.




Dertil har du:

En betydelig mængde konsulenterfaring, og en samlet erfaring på mindst 5-10 år, samt en relevant højere uddannelse.
En robust teknisk erfaring med cloud-tjenester som OpenAI, Microsoft Azure, herunder Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Data Lake og Blob storage, eller lignende platforme som AWS eller Google Cloud.
Erfaring med MLOps, herunder opsætning af CI/CD-pipelines for deployment og vedligeholdelse af analytiske modeller.
Omfattende erfaring med programmering i Python og være velbevandret i biblioteker som Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow og scikit-learn.







Vi forventer, at du kompetencemæssigt:

Har en skarp evne til at omsætte komplekse forretningskrav til ML/AI/GenAI og at du kan tænke i implementering på tværs af forretningsområder.
Besidder stærke analytiske evner som du har bevist bl.a. ved avanceret dataanalyse og anvendt statistik.
Er flydende på både dansk og engelsk, både skriftligt og mundtligt og kendes som en fremragende kommunikator, der kan formidle komplekse koncepter på en forståelig måde for alle interessenter.
Har en dyb forståelse for forretningsprocesser og være i stand til at transformere forretningsbehov til tekniske løsninger.
Er proaktiv og nysgerrig, med en konstant trang til at forbedre processer og løsninger.




Din tjekliste:

Du trives med at arbejde på et højt fagligt niveau, hvor vidensdeling er essential.
Du drives af at omsætte komplekse problemstillinger til værdifulde AI-drevne indsigter.
Du vil være en del af en best-in-class virksomhed som især formår at skabe handling bag rådgivningen og de strategiske planer.
Du ønsker at udfolde din gode energi og skarpe perspektiver, som gør dig til en eftertragtet problemløser og sparringspartner for kolleger og ledere på alle niveauer.
Du har et naturligt behov og fokus på hele tiden at dygtiggøre dig.
Du holder af at have stor fleksibilitet og mulighed for selv at planlægge din hverdag.




Vi tilbyder dig:

Udover et spændende job og kolleger i verdensklasse kan vi tilbyde dig:

Fremragende karrieremuligheder og personlig udvikling, inklusive løbende træning og uddannelse.
At blive en del af vores unikke Heartwork-kultur, hvor ambitioner og forventninger går hånd i hånd med passion og fællesskabsfølelse.
Mulighed for en fleksibel hverdag med hjemmearbejde og en attraktiv løn, der afspejler dine kvalifikationer.
En aktiv personaleforening med et bredt spektrum af aktiviteter.




Lokation og rejseaktiviteter:

Din primære arbejdsplads vil være på vores kontor i Kongens Lyngby, understøttet af en hybrid arbejdsmodel og med en minimal grad af rejseaktivitetet.




Kontakt os snarest muligt

Vi afholder samtaler løbende og ansætter, når vi har fundet det rette match. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at række ud til:




Steffen Krogsgaard, Head of Recruitment, krog@inspari.dk, +45 61 95 67 25




Vi lover at behandle vores dialog med stor fortrolighed.




English Version:




As a Principal Data Scientist at Inspari, you will hold a key position within the team, where your expertise is crucial in guiding and developing our clients to reach their highest potential through complex AI and Data Science challenges. You will be a frontrunner in transforming strategic visions into tangible AI solutions.




Your Responsibilities and Tasks:

Lead, develop, and provide consultancy on AI and Data Science projects to support value creation for our clients, from the initial idea phase to final implementation and adoption.
Decrypt and transform complex Data Science challenges into clear, value-creating solutions, ensuring effective communication of these solutions to both internal and external stakeholders.




In addition, you will:

Serve as a subject matter expert and mentor for team members and play a central role in enhancing internal competency as a Principal Data Scientist and consultant.
Contribute to improving and developing our team and strategy within AI & Data Science.
Engage in presales activities, facilitate workshops, and initiate education within AI and Data Science.
Actively contribute to the company's extensive product portfolio.




To remain at the forefront of the latest knowledge and technology in AI and Data Science, you will be dedicated to continuous self-development.




Your Qualifications:

The ideal candidate for this role has deep experience in AI and Data Science with a strong track record as a technical leader.




Additionally, you have:

Significant consulting experience, totaling at least 5-10 years, along with relevant higher education.
Robust technical experience with cloud services such as OpenAI, Microsoft Azure, including Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Data Lake and Blob storage, or similar platforms like AWS or Google Cloud.
Experience with MLOps, including setting up CI/CD pipelines for deployment and maintenance of analytical models.
Extensive experience in programming with Python and proficiency in libraries like Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, and scikit-learn.




We expect you to:

Have a keen ability to translate complex business requirements into ML/AI/GenAI implementations across business areas.
Possess strong analytical skills, demonstrated through advanced data analysis and applied statistics.
Be fluent in both Danish and English, written and spoken, and known as an excellent communicator who can convey complex concepts in an understandable manner to all stakeholders.
Have a deep understanding of business processes and be able to transform business needs into technical solutions.
Be proactive and curious, with a constant urge to improve processes and solutions.




Your Checklist:

Thrive in working at a high professional level where knowledge sharing is essential.
Are driven to translate complex issues into valuable AI-driven insights.
Will be part of a best-in-class company that effectively turns advice and strategic plans into action.
Wish to unfold your positive energy and sharp perspectives, making you a sought-after problem solver and sparring partner for colleagues and leaders at all levels.
Have a natural need and focus on constantly improving your skills.
Appreciate having great flexibility and the ability to plan your day independently.




We Offer You:

In addition to an exciting job and world-class colleagues, we offer:

Excellent career opportunities and personal development, including ongoing training and education.
The chance to be part of our unique Heartwork culture, where ambitions and expectations go hand in hand with passion and a sense of community.
The possibility of a flexible workday with home office options and an attractive salary reflecting your qualifications.
An active employee association with a wide range of activities.




Location and Travel Activities:

Your primary workplace will be at our office in Kongens Lyngby, supported by a hybrid work model with minimal travel activities.




Contact Us As Soon As Possible

We conduct interviews continuously and hire when we find the right match. If you have questions about the position, feel free to reach out to:




Steffen Krogsgaard, Head of Recruitment, krog@inspari.dk, +45 61 95 67 25




We promise to treat our dialogue with great confidentiality.

Show more
HTML:
Som Principal Data Scientist hos Inspari vil du indtage en nøgleposition i teamet, hvor din ekspertise er afgørende for at lede og udvikle vores kunder til at nå deres højeste potentiale gennem komplekse AI- og Data Science-udfordringer.

Du vil være frontløber i at transformere strategiske visioner til håndgribelige AI-løsninger.


English version below


Dine ansvarsområder og opgaver

Din rolle vil centrere sig om ledelse, udvikling og rådgivning på AI og Data Science-projekter for at understøtte værdiskabelse for vores kunder. Fra den indledende idéfase til den endelige implementering og adoption.

Du vil stå i spidsen for at dechifrere og omdanne komplekse data science-udfordringer til klare, værdiskabende løsninger og sikre en klar og overbevisende kommunikation af disse løsninger til både interne og eksterne interessenter.


Hertil vil du:

  • Være fagligfyrtårn og mentor for teammedlemmer og du vil spille en central rolle i at bidrage til det interne kompetenceniveau i din rolle som Principal Data Scientist og konsulent.
  • Være med til at forbedre og udvikle vores team, samt strategi inden for AI & Data Science.
  • Være engageret i presales-aktiviteter, facilitering af workshops og initiativer rettet mod uddannelse inden for AI og Data Science.
  • Være en aktiv bidragsyder til virksomhedens omfattende produktportefølje.


For at sikre, at du forbliver på forkant med den nyeste viden og teknologi inden for AI og data science, vil du være dedikeret til kontinuerlig selvudvikling.


Dine kvalifikationer

Den ideelle kandidat til denne rolle har dybdegående erfaring med AI og data science samt en stærk track record som teknisk driver.


Dertil har du:

  • En betydelig mængde konsulenterfaring, og en samlet erfaring på mindst 5-10 år, samt en relevant højere uddannelse.
  • En robust teknisk erfaring med cloud-tjenester som OpenAI, Microsoft Azure, herunder Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Data Lake og Blob storage, eller lignende platforme som AWS eller Google Cloud.
  • Erfaring med MLOps, herunder opsætning af CI/CD-pipelines for deployment og vedligeholdelse af analytiske modeller.
  • Omfattende erfaring med programmering i Python og være velbevandret i biblioteker som Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow og scikit-learn.



Vi forventer, at du kompetencemæssigt:

  • Har en skarp evne til at omsætte komplekse forretningskrav til ML/AI/GenAI og at du kan tænke i implementering på tværs af forretningsområder.
  • Besidder stærke analytiske evner som du har bevist bl.a. ved avanceret dataanalyse og anvendt statistik.
  • Er flydende på både dansk og engelsk, både skriftligt og mundtligt og kendes som en fremragende kommunikator, der kan formidle komplekse koncepter på en forståelig måde for alle interessenter.
  • Har en dyb forståelse for forretningsprocesser og være i stand til at transformere forretningsbehov til tekniske løsninger.
  • Er proaktiv og nysgerrig, med en konstant trang til at forbedre processer og løsninger.


Din tjekliste:

  • Du trives med at arbejde på et højt fagligt niveau, hvor vidensdeling er essential.
  • Du drives af at omsætte komplekse problemstillinger til værdifulde AI-drevne indsigter.
  • Du vil være en del af en best-in-class virksomhed som især formår at skabe handling bag rådgivningen og de strategiske planer.
  • Du ønsker at udfolde din gode energi og skarpe perspektiver, som gør dig til en eftertragtet problemløser og sparringspartner for kolleger og ledere på alle niveauer.
  • Du har et naturligt behov og fokus på hele tiden at dygtiggøre dig.
  • Du holder af at have stor fleksibilitet og mulighed for selv at planlægge din hverdag.


Vi tilbyder dig:

Udover et spændende job og kolleger i verdensklasse kan vi tilbyde dig:

  • Fremragende karrieremuligheder og personlig udvikling, inklusive løbende træning og uddannelse.
  • At blive en del af vores unikke Heartwork-kultur, hvor ambitioner og forventninger går hånd i hånd med passion og fællesskabsfølelse.
  • Mulighed for en fleksibel hverdag med hjemmearbejde og en attraktiv løn, der afspejler dine kvalifikationer.
  • En aktiv personaleforening med et bredt spektrum af aktiviteter.


Lokation og rejseaktiviteter:

Din primære arbejdsplads vil være på vores kontor i Kongens Lyngby, understøttet af en hybrid arbejdsmodel og med en minimal grad af rejseaktivitetet.


Kontakt os snarest muligt

Vi afholder samtaler løbende og ansætter, når vi har fundet det rette match. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at række ud til:


Steffen Krogsgaard, Head of Recruitment, krog@inspari.dk, +45 61 95 67 25


Vi lover at behandle vores dialog med stor fortrolighed.


English Version:


As a Principal Data Scientist at Inspari, you will hold a key position within the team, where your expertise is crucial in guiding and developing our clients to reach their highest potential through complex AI and Data Science challenges. You will be a frontrunner in transforming strategic visions into tangible AI solutions.


Your Responsibilities and Tasks:

  • Lead, develop, and provide consultancy on AI and Data Science projects to support value creation for our clients, from the initial idea phase to final implementation and adoption.
  • Decrypt and transform complex Data Science challenges into clear, value-creating solutions, ensuring effective communication of these solutions to both internal and external stakeholders.


In addition, you will:

  • Serve as a subject matter expert and mentor for team members and play a central role in enhancing internal competency as a Principal Data Scientist and consultant.
  • Contribute to improving and developing our team and strategy within AI & Data Science.
  • Engage in presales activities, facilitate workshops, and initiate education within AI and Data Science.
  • Actively contribute to the company's extensive product portfolio.


To remain at the forefront of the latest knowledge and technology in AI and Data Science, you will be dedicated to continuous self-development.


Your Qualifications:

The ideal candidate for this role has deep experience in AI and Data Science with a strong track record as a technical leader.


Additionally, you have:

  • Significant consulting experience, totaling at least 5-10 years, along with relevant higher education.
  • Robust technical experience with cloud services such as OpenAI, Microsoft Azure, including Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Data Lake and Blob storage, or similar platforms like AWS or Google Cloud.
  • Experience with MLOps, including setting up CI/CD pipelines for deployment and maintenance of analytical models.
  • Extensive experience in programming with Python and proficiency in libraries like Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, and scikit-learn.


We expect you to:

  • Have a keen ability to translate complex business requirements into ML/AI/GenAI implementations across business areas.
  • Possess strong analytical skills, demonstrated through advanced data analysis and applied statistics.
  • Be fluent in both Danish and English, written and spoken, and known as an excellent communicator who can convey complex concepts in an understandable manner to all stakeholders.
  • Have a deep understanding of business processes and be able to transform business needs into technical solutions.
  • Be proactive and curious, with a constant urge to improve processes and solutions.


Your Checklist:

  • Thrive in working at a high professional level where knowledge sharing is essential.
  • Are driven to translate complex issues into valuable AI-driven insights.
  • Will be part of a best-in-class company that effectively turns advice and strategic plans into action.
  • Wish to unfold your positive energy and sharp perspectives, making you a sought-after problem solver and sparring partner for colleagues and leaders at all levels.
  • Have a natural need and focus on constantly improving your skills.
  • Appreciate having great flexibility and the ability to plan your day independently.


We Offer You:

In addition to an exciting job and world-class colleagues, we offer:

  • Excellent career opportunities and personal development, including ongoing training and education.
  • The chance to be part of our unique Heartwork culture, where ambitions and expectations go hand in hand with passion and a sense of community.
  • The possibility of a flexible workday with home office options and an attractive salary reflecting your qualifications.
  • An active employee association with a wide range of activities.


Location and Travel Activities:

Your primary workplace will be at our office in Kongens Lyngby, supported by a hybrid work model with minimal travel activities.


Contact Us As Soon As Possible

We conduct interviews continuously and hire when we find the right match. If you have questions about the position, feel free to reach out to:


Steffen Krogsgaard, Head of Recruitment, krog@inspari.dk, +45 61 95 67 25


We promise to treat our dialogue with great confidentiality.

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.
Show more
